name: Modern Urban Oasis in Rino
description:
This is a converted 2500 square foot modern industrial loft space on a beautiful double 10,000 square foot lot in a great part of town. New places opening daily here. A-line Blake New Mission Ballroom is a short walk!

Super tall ceilings, reclaimed wood floors, mid-century modern, eclectic, bohemian vibe. It's equipped with an amazing sound system and commercial grade kitchen as well as spacious side yard with a fire pit. Ideal for large groups, reunions, and the like.
neighborhood_overview: Very close to the A-line Blake street stop from the airport. So many hip, new things to do in the neighborhood including the brand new Mission Ballroom which is only blocks away. The house sits in one of the coolest neighborhoods, Rino District, in Denver, close to downtown and a bevy of restaurants, bars, and cultural activities.
host_about: I'm a high school teacher in Denver. I teach media and pop culture.

name: Cozy Studio In the ❤️ of Denver
description: Located in Central Denver, CO only a short distance to Broadway Avenue, Denver Health, every sporting arena, and walking distance to all the food and art galleries down Santa Fe. Easy access to West 6th Ave and I-25.
neighborhood_overview:
Santa Fe Arts District features retail and dining within walking distance. First Fridays on Santa Fe is an eclectic social scene where galleries are open until 10 PM. The street is always bustling with street vendors, food trucks, and live music.
The salon next door is full of great self-care services.
host_about:
Professional by day and avid adventurer on the side, just living the high life in Colorado. My husband, pup, and I  live in the upstairs studio apartment. We will always be happy to help you with any questions or concerns, even if it is just a place to dine. We love hosting guest and are passionate about sharing our vibrant community. Denver has everything and we are in the ♥️ of it all. For whatever reason your visit, you're welcome to make yourself at home in the quint little studio in the ❤️ of Denver.

-Lauren and Patrick

name: Cozy Carriage Home Sante Fe Style!
description:
We are a long term rental FYI
This is a perfect space for a light-weight traveler interested in a cute place to come home to each evening, with all the basic conveniences. It's in a very cool urban neighborhood with lots to offer to foodies, creatives, art galleries and adventurers.
This studio carriage home is not a shared space and it is completely an independent unit from the main structure. Separate and private entrance. Great work space with Internet speeds over 100 mbps Xfinity service!
neighborhood_overview: https://m.youtube.com/watch?v=P34vFBWYSzg&feature=youtu.be
host_about:
We are from Chicago and we enjoy the mild winters in Colorado and all the outdoor activities this state has to offer. Come and experience it yourself.  We enjoy this private coach studio we are sure you will too! 

We love deep dish pizza so we occasionally go back to Chicago to make our frequent favorite pizza stops.

We both love to ride the bicycle!

We are frequent runners and enjoy running in Washington Park. We totally recommend this park.

We are big fans of Renegade Brewery!

We recommend the First Friday of every on month on Sante Fe!

Enjoy yourself and contact us if you have any questions.

Thanks

Edwin

name: Modern Townhouse in Downtown with Private Balcony
description:
Experience the best of urban living in our contemporary two-story townhouse, nestled in the historic Five Points neighborhood of Denver. Our spacious 1365 sq. ft home boasts a private balcony with city views, providing the ideal spot to unwind and relax.

Our location is unbeatable, with many restaurants, bars, Coors Field, and Denver Performing Arts Center just blocks away. You'll also be within easy reach of the Denver Zoo, Museum of Nature and Science in City Park & Botanic Gardens.
neighborhood_overview: I am in one of the most popular historic neighborhoods in Denver. Dozens of restaurants and bars within blocks. 15 minute walk to Coors field or downtown. Grocery store and liquor store one block away.
host_about: I love travel, great food, adventures and meeting new people.

name: Hotel Residential of Denver [Suite #1]
description:
Welcome to Hotel Residential of Denver.

Denver's most Central Location for everything downtown. Designed for both business & leisure travel.

Bachelor(ette) Parties - Friends/Family Trips - Sports Trips - Convention Goers - Company Retreats - Hospitality Suite

Surround yourself with Denver's best bars, restaurants, breweries, nightlife, music venues, and sporting events. Take a short walk to the Colorado Convention Center or visit Coors Field just 2 blocks away.

We'd love to have you!
neighborhood_overview:
Local Attractions...

→ Coors Field (Rockies Baseball) → 2 blocks away
→ Ball Arena (Nuggets Basketball) → Less than 1 mile away
→ Empower Field at Mile High (Broncos Football) → 2 miles away
→ Colorado Convention Center → Less than 1 mile away
→ Red Rocks Amphitheater → 20 miles away
→ Denver Union Station → 0.5 miles away
→ 22 miles away → Denver International Airport

Convenience within 1 block of your doorstep...

→ Hotel Residential (In Unit Snack/Beverage Vending)
→ Max's Market (Grocery Store)
→ Brother's (Convenience Store)
→ Mr. B's (Liquor Store)
→ The Dab (Public Dispensary)
→ Frank's Gentlemen's Salon (Barbershop)

Ski Towns:
→ Loveland - 55 min
→ Copper Mountain - 1 hr 30 min
→ Breckenridge - 1hr 45 min
→ Vail - 1hr 55 min
→ Keystone - 1hr 55 min
→ Beaver Creek - 2 hrs
host_about:
Hotel Residential is an independently owned and operated boutique hotel in the heart of Downtown Denver. Our mission is to bridge the gap between traditional hotels and short term rentals by offering guests an option of [2] modern, large format suites unlike any other. Standards of cleanliness and safety have been set and are meticulously maintained. Partnerships with local bars, restaurants, breweries, and gyms offer a variety of experiences unique to each group. We hope this blending of place and experience is a welcomed retreat for both business and leisure travelers alike.

Hotel Residential is independently owned and operated by Jonathan & Kelly Van Sistine.

name: ZEN HOUSE - Meditation Room - Home Theater - PS4
description: Includes a basement Home Theater, offering cinematic experiences right at your fingertips. PS4 and Wii in the living room. Serene Meditation room and King Suite. Soft lighting and minimalist decor create a calming atmosphere. Outside, a peaceful frontyard with a soothing water fountain provides a perfect space to relax with family or friends. Located in Denver's art district, galleries, events, and dining options are within easy reach. Modern elegance and Japanese design in the heart of the city
neighborhood_overview:
Unlike typical crowded apartment complexes or challenging street parking, this exceptional house offers both a quiet space and privacy within the city limits. You are also a short walk from the Osaga and 10th Light Rail Station!

Indulge in the convenience of being within distance to a variety of restaurants, breweries, and attractions like Meow Wolf, the Convention Center, 16th Street Mall and Empower Field. Just a brief two-block stroll away, you'll find the First-of-the-Month Fridays Art Walk featuring art galleries, quality food trucks, wine tasting, and much more entertainment. Whether you're yearning to be in proximity to the city buzz or seeking a serene sanctuary to return to, this location offers the best of both worlds on a quiet street. And don't overlook its advantage of easy mountain accessibility, courtesy of nearby Highway 6.

Check out my guidebook for recommended amenities close by!

Public Transportation 2 blocks away, as well as close a

name: Cozy City Park 1 BD/BA Close to Everything!
description: Located in the quiet Whittier neighborhood,  close to downtown, RiNo,  17th Ave restaurants, City Park, major hospitals and much more.  This recently constructed,  private basement apartment includes a bedroom (queen bed), large sofa, private bath, stocked kitchen with refrigerator, convection microwave and counter top electric stove.   We have air mattresses, a pack n play, as well as extra bedding available.  The space opens up to our shared backyard with with a large deck and lots of seating.
neighborhood_overview: Whittier is just a few blocks from City Park, an easy walk to 17th street bars and restaurants and a short ride to all that downtown Denver has to offer.  Walk to the Denver Zoo, Museum of Nature and Science and City Park Golf Course.  We're also just a few blocks from Saint Joseph Hospital, Presbyterian St. Luke's Medical Center and Rocky Mountain Hospital for Children.

name: Private Room w/Private Bath and View of Mountains!
description:
Our private suite has amazing views of the mountains and city! Located on the top floor of the historic Airedale Building, get cozy in a king sized bed with a private bathroom, while enjoying the chic, vintage and eclectic decor of the space. Guests have access to our full bar, modern kitchen, multiple lounges, and outdoor patio. We look forward to hosting you!
Valid CC or Debit Card Required for check in for incidentals/proof of identity but will not be charged.
neighborhood_overview: We are in the HEART of downtown Denver and walking distance to major Denver attractions. Hostel Fish is steps from Coors Field, minutes from the trendy RiNo district, and surrounded by cool bars. PROTIP: There's an incredible axe throwing place across the street!
host_about: We the People of Hostel Fish believe that a hostel of backpackers, by backpackers, and for backpackers, shall be a fun, safe, spotless, high-end joint that is Classy as F…(ish!). We are focused on the traveler and the traveler's needs and believe something being affordable should still offer exemplary service and more than expected perks. We believe that shared rooms and neo-urbanism, when combined, create an epicenter for those "seekers of life's adventures" to meet each other and foster new friendships. We're stoked to host you. We're jazzed to have you as our guest. We're here for you and always want to hear your thoughts or suggestions on how we can improve your experience.

name: Private Lock-off in RiNo (400+ Positive Reviews!)
description: Large, private studio with separate entrance, located in Denver's urban- industrial River North (RiNo) neighborhood.  Located walking distances from some of Denver's best restaurants, craft breweries, coffee shops, cocktail bars, and the world-class  RiNo Art District. This home-away-from-home is perfect for weekend guests looking to take advantage of all that Denver has to offer; and for weekday guests looking for a quiet retreat during work trips just outside of downtown Denver.
neighborhood_overview: Our home is in on the dividing line between the recently revitalized RiNo neighborhood and the historic Curtis Park neighborhood. The RiNo neighborhood is full of breweries, boutiques, coffee shops, bars, and restaurants, all of which are within walking distance of our home and ideal for daily fun. The Curtis Park neighborhood is mostly residential, with a number of parks and bike paths that are perfect for afternoon trips.  Because of our home's central location, you're just a short walk to Coors Field and Union Station. For those looking to explore beyond RiNo, Curtis Park and Downtown, hopping on a bike for 20 to 30 minutes, or taking a 10 minute Uber/Lyft ride, will quickly land you in Capitol Hill, City Park, Cheesman Park, Highlands, and Globeville.

name: Bed, Bath and Hot Tub with Private Entrance
description:
Peaceful, large bedroom/bath with private entrance off the gorgeous garden in 1930s vintage home. Close to several medical centers such as National Jewish, Rose Medical Center, Children's Hospital, and University Hospital. We are a few blocks from bus routes, coffee shops, concert venues (bluebird, Ogden, Fillmore) and fun restaurants.

fast Wifi, TV, microwave, fridge and hot tub. The room has a new king-size bed and self-controlled air conditioner/heater for maximum comfort. Not 420 friendly.
neighborhood_overview: We live in the Mayfair Neighborhood, just East of Downtown Denver, with many great restaurants, coffee shops and concert venues within a short distance. The best coffee shops near are Hooked and Bellweather on Colfax. Trader Joes is just up the street. Our favorite close restaurants include Chop Shop, Annies, Angelos, The Abbey and Jelly.
host_about:
I am a happy, people person who believes that we can do wonderful things when we set the intention to do so. I am a Life Transformation Coach, helping people create the life of their dreams, along with a plan to achieve it. I am a Reiki healer as well and am happy to book a session with you if you are interested. Because I spent most of my life as an entrepreneur, I teach entrepreneurship full time at MSU Denver and love the job. While I do not believe my jobs defines me, I sure love teaching, coaching, and healing. 

Travel is my other favorite past time. I recently traveled to the south of France with friends and family where we stayed in a castle. After that, my awesome adult kids and I and walked a portion of the Santiago de Compostela in Spain. I travel a lot in the US and love staying at Airbnb locations. It is there that a person gets the true nature of the city/location.

5 Things I Cannot Live Without:

Travel
Water (beach, pool, river, hot tub, hot springs)
Bacon
Wine
People

I love hosting guests through Airbnb. We have an eclectic house full of charm and cool things. Our only pets are fish in a fish tank and Koi in a Koi pond. The energy in our home is peaceful and enriching and I am super excited to share that with others.

Because we have lived in Denver for a long time, we know all the good places to go—local coffee shops, unique boutiques, micro breweries. 

While the space is fairly private, having your own entrance and bathroom, we are happy to share the kitchen and laundry facilities, if you are interested. We looking forward to hosting you!

name: Cozy Base in Vibrant Family Home (1 or 2 bedrooms)
description:
Enjoy a cozy, private guestroom in the basement of our spacious family home. With plenty of space for 1 or 2 & private bath, you'll have a warm welcome from your hosts & two whole floors separating you from the bedroom of our 10 year-old twin boys. Woohoo!
(Please note: We also have a second bedroom with a queen bed that can be added if your party needs it. Cost is 10% less than 1st bedroom, bathroom is shared with 1st bedroom, though not with our family. Please ask in your message!)
neighborhood_overview: Our urban residential neighborhood is a lively and diverse mixture of families, young couples, and the elderly. Our family is very happy here, and we embrace our urban location. We take our boys to the park, let them play outside, and say hello to all our neighbors. We also live on a very friendly block, where everyone knows each other and gets along great. Our particular area is residential and doesn't offer many restaurants or bars, but it is just a short drive from all the best spots in the city. On foot, you can visit a lovely coffee shop (Rivers and Roads), a 7-11, a liquor store, a couple of taquerias, and a nice little bar with food called Nola Voodoo Tavern.
host_about: We're a busy family of four, so y'know, always on the go...There's me, Rebecca, writer, artist, and avid cook and gardener, though I seem to spend a lot of time building marble runs and lego art with our two 9 year old boys.  There's Charlie, handy energy engineer, awesome garden and rain capture system builder.  And then there are those boys I mentioned...let's just say there's a lot of climbing on the furniture, drawing, puzzles, books, fort-building, dirt-digging, and marble-rolling in our house.  But don't worry, our two guest rooms are located far from the mayhem in our fully renovated basement, otherwise known as "the fortress of solitude". And marble rolling ceases at a reasonable hour with kid bedtime!

neighborhood_overview:
The Lower Highlands (commonly referred to as "LoHi") is known for its craft beer spots, cocktail bars, countless restaurants and incredible downtown views. This little nook of a neighborhood is one of Denver’s best kept secrets. Tree-lined streets, a sidewalk scene filled with boutique retail and restaurants, local cafes filled with friends and neighbors, great schools, nearby parks, strollers, dogs and pints…

With hundreds of shops, salons, restaurants, and other fun things within walking distance, getting bored is impossible!  We have many events each year, including the CC Arts Festival, the CC Wine Festival, the CC Sidewalk Sale, and regular farmers markets. name: Remodeled Old-World Home in Downtown Denver
description: Stylish remodeled home in prime location right next to downtown Denver. Situated between LoDo and RiNo puts you just steps from Coors Field, breweries, restaurants, and more.
neighborhood_overview:
Five points is a beloved old neighborhood in Denver. Situated in a prime location between RiNo and LoDo. It's a great place to see shows, hop around local breweries, and enjoy local art. The Curtis Park Deli is right around the corner, British Bulldog is right down the street, and with a short walk, scooter or Uber you can be at many of Denver's best restaurants, bars, and entertainment areas.

As this house is at the heart of the city, you will hear city noises, including emergency vehicles at times during your stay. Also, it is only a few blocks from the mission, so there are quite a few homeless persons in the area. I've never experienced any issues with them in the year I've lived here.

description:
This beautiful historic building was built in the 1880s as a carriage house and converted into a living space in 2005. Brick walls, original wood floor, big wooden beams, gears and chains for the platform elevator.....this is not your everyday stay. This is a place like no other and smack dab in the middle of one of the hottest neighborhood in Denver. No need for a car at this place.


High Speed Internet ...100Mbps

License: 2017-BFN-0001262
Includes 10.75% Denver tax

No pets, No parties
neighborhood_overview: LoHi is currently one of the hottest neighborhoods in Denver. Tons of new and interesting restaurants and many holdovers  from "the olden days" when it was the Italian district.  In less than a mile you will find 5 of AirBnB's top 7 Best of the Best of Denver's bar/restaurants. (https://www.airbnb.com/things-to-do/denver) . Walking at night is safe and well lit.
host_about:
I'm a portrait and wedding photographer working and playing in Denver, Boulder and around the country and world. When I'm not working, I'm trail running in foothills, cycling wherever I can, or riding my horse into the sunset. So much to do and enjoy in Colorado.

Welcome!!

name: Nice house w/ huge yard in desirable Neighborhood
description: Just across the street from Mayfair Park, near Montclair, Cherry Creek, and restaurants. This is the perfect size for a couple, business associates, a small family, or an individual who would prefer to use the second bedroom as an office. Large private backyard with grill, spacious kitchen, real wood floors, and washer and dryer. King in one bedroom, queen in the other. *Pets considered with an additional fee, must message me prior to booking for approval.
neighborhood_overview: Located near shopping, restaurants, short drive to Cherry Creek Mall and downtown.
host_about:
Hello, I work in the field of marketing and my husband, Tim, works in Solar. We are quite active and self-proclaimed foodies. If you want any recommendations on where to hike or eat while in Denver, we have some good recommendations. 

HOW HOSTING BECAME OUR PASSION:
Tim and I came into our relationship each owning a 2 bedroom house.  As our family grew and our needs changed, we decided to rent out both of our two homes because neither one of us wanted to sell. We gave short term renting a try and we’ve had such great experiences with the wonderful people we’ve met. It brings joy to know that our guests are enjoying our homes as much as we did. 

As a couple who travels quite a bit, we try to incorporate a high level of standards of what we expect in a hotel. Our ultimate goal and passion is to help our guests get as much out of their visit as possible, as there's just so much to offer in this unique and beautiful city. If there is anything that would make your stay more enjoyable, please reach out prior or during your stay. 

*I have contracted a translator for French and Spanish speaking guests to help arrange accommodations, if needed.

neighborhood_overview: Situated right between West Wash Park and Baker, this location is a short walk from all the sights and scenes in two of Denver’s hottest neighborhoods. Start your day with a top-rated breakfast across the street at Lucille’s, go for a jog around Washington Park with the locals, and then spend the afternoon boutique shopping along S. Broadway where you’ll find some of Denver’s most popular bars and eateries.
host_about:
I have lived in denver for about 8 years.  I love to travel and that's how I discovered Denver that I now call home.  I enjoy everything that Colorado has to offer: biking, hiking, skiing and hanging out with our friends.

I have lived in New England, Miami FL, Raleigh NC and Colorado.  This has been by far my favorite.  I've found it's been very easy to go out and meet people with similar interests.  I hope you take advantage of all that Denver has to offer.

description: Spacious garden  level apartment, newly renovated, in very walkable neighborhood close to grocery stores, restaurants, and two blocks from Cheesman Park. One mile from state capitol building, central business district, museums and Cherry Creek shopping. Several bus lines within easy walking distance.
neighborhood_overview: This is a perfect place for folks visiting Denver for fun, business, or a stopping-off city location as one prepares to head up into the Colorado Rocky Mountains for sight-seeing, skiing, hiking, camping, and a wealth of other sports.  Our neighborhood, Cheesman Park, is a very well established and diverse residential area.  It's a wonderful part of town for walking or bicycling.  The Park is a very short walk and Historic Seventh Avenue Parkway with it's beautiful homes is two blocks to the south.  We're 10 blocks from the Cherry Creek Bike trail system with links to downtown, Auraria University Campus, Cherry Creek Reservoir State Park.  The Denver Botanic Gardens is a walk across the Park as is Congress Park with tennis courts and summertime swimming.  Grocery stores are nearby--King Soopers is 3 blocks, Whole Foods as well as Safeway are 5 blocks.  The up-scale Cherry Creek Shopping area is 1.5 miles away.  Downtown is a walkable destination and has oodles of entertainment, sports

name: Quaint Garden Suite 3 Blocks From City Park
description: Not an entire home, nor just a bedroom! It’s a sweet, suite - bdrm, bthrm, living rm, & front porch! Private front door, street access - no dark alleys, backyards or long stair cases! Lovely jog to City Park - breathtaking view of Downtown Denver, which is just a few min drive or an exhilarating 45 min walk. neighborhood_overview: The Historic Whittier Neighborhood was one of the first neighborhoods to be settled in Denver. Whittier’s beautiful, tree-lined streets are located two miles northeast of downtown.  There’s a new Rotating Tap House across the street, coffee shops and restaurants are close by.
host_about:
Originally from the Western Catskills of New York state, I moved to Denver in 1980, purchased my home in 1991 and raised my daughter here. I am a passionate gardener - as I'm sure you can see from my pictures - and now that I'm retired, I'm thrilled that my home will allow me to fulfill my life's mantra:

"I will age ungracefully until I become an old woman in a small garden doing whatever the Hell I want!"

Hotel Residential is an independently owned and operated boutique hotel in the heart of Downtown Denver. Hotel Residential is independently owned and operated by Jonathan & Kelly Van Sistine.

description: My place has a recently updated bathroom and refinished wood floors. The kitchen is fully equipped with utensils for all of your cooking needs. Due to the $@) friendly policy Guests under 18 not allowed. Plenty of free parking.
neighborhood_overview:
Make yourself at home and relax, you are among friends and neighbors!
When you exit the complex through the front gates, take a right to get to Sloans Lake, 25th St. Joyride Brewery, many dispensaries and restaurants.
You will notice the Mexican bakery, hair stylist and nail salon across the street (Sheridan) on your left before the 7-11 store. Other eateries are down along the lake on your right. Rupert's is my favorite, and is only open for breakfast and lunch.
Barbershop and one day spa are also down Sheridan just past Starbucks, as is Northern Lights dispensary. The other way on 29th is my favorite day spa A new spirit 4840 w. 29th.
Catch the #28 Eastbound bus in the covered bus shed by the lake across the street from 7-11. Fare is $2.60 and includes a transfer. This takes you downtown where you can catch the free 16th St. Mall Shuttle. Catch the #28 bus Westbound to return home on 15th St. The drivers are all very helpful as are other rider

name: Rococo Romance: 2 Bedroom Cap Hill
description: Great for long stays- this 30 day listing is a romantic two bedroom oasis in the center of Capitol Hill awaits your entrance. This recently renovated Mansion surprises and delights in its delicate and sensual decor. Nestled in Denver’s original upscale neighborhood you are walking distance from the best Denver has to offer, including the Denver Art Museum, Colorado Convention Center, and countless gourmet restaurants.
neighborhood_overview: Capitol Hill is a quintessential Denver neighborhood, a place where politicos and hipsters cross paths. It is Denver's most densely populated neighborhood. It was once the home of Denver's elite and origination of Foursquare architecture in Denver. Today it consists of historic mansions, apartments and condo buildings. Because of the concentration of multi-family uses and the urban character of the neighborhood, parking is at a premium. The area is strongly influenced by the Colorado State Capitol and Downtown Denver which is adjacent to the northwest boundary of the neighborhood. Commercial uses are typically located on major arterials such as Colfax Avenue, East 8th Avenue, East 14th Avenue, East 13th Avenue, Lincoln Street and Broadway. A considerable number of mansion properties have been converted to office uses over the past several years due to zoning exemptions offered to historic structures which are zoned for residential uses.
host_about: Hello, I'm originally from Ohio, and I thrive on Midwestern kindness and generosity. I have three young children, but in my free time (haha), I renovate spaces into places I would love to live. Interior design + traveling are two of my main passions. Before children, I was an avid traveler and explorer. One of my favorite ways to travel was to immerse myself in the culture. Staying at an apartment, vs a hotel, allows one to feel like they live in the new spot. I hope you enjoy staying at my listings.

name: Business traveller ready!  Awesome design.
description:
Freshly remodeled Garden Level unit in our historic Victorian home with separate entrance. Located in Denver's Swallow Hill Historic Neighborhood of mansions and Grand Victorians built in the late 1800's.

Completely furnished with custom designs from 2520 LAR.

Excellent "walkability" rating, in the heart of Denver's "Restaurant Row", 5 minute Uber to Downtown, the vibrant RiNo Art District & the incredibly cool 5-Points neigborhoods.

There is a friendly dog on this property.
host_about:
We love international travel and have attempted to visit one new country a year.  Raising a family and starting various businesses over the years has made it challenging to do so but we do our best.  We recently visited Cuba and loved it.  One of the favorite destinations of our family is Australia. When we can't make it out of the country, we enjoy hosting friend's, family, exchange students and now , hopefully Airbnb guests from all over the world.  It's almost as much fun as the travel itself.  
We have three great kids, ages 16-21 and a wonderful dog, Charlie.  
Our most recent business venture has been to promote the art and designs of Brian Trybus at our studio/gallery in the RINO art district.  We also display and promote the work of other local artists.
We look forward to meeting others with a love of travel by hosting with Airbnb.  We are open to as much or as little interaction as desired.  
Happy travels and we hope to meet you soon.

Short Term License #. 2017. BFN - 
000.  5421

name: Large Historic House Close to Mile High & Downtown
description:
Originally built in 1912 this renovated, historical house is walking distance to Mile High Stadium. Close to LoDo, the Convention Center, Coors Field, Denver Zoo, Aquarium, Union Station, Pepsi Center, lots of breweries, and both the Art Museum and the Museum of Natural History.

Includes 5 bedrooms and the ability to sleep 16 comfortably and 20 with tight quarters, a large 2nd story patio and backyard, and full size arcade games. All races, religions, and LGTBQ are welcome here!
neighborhood_overview:
Located next to Viking park in the Highlands area there are a ton of restaurants and breweries within walking distance. Both Zuni St and Little Machine breweries are just down the block and are great places to enjoy a freshly brewed beer while checking out the local food truck.

For breakfast check out Sassafras ( call ahead as they fill up quickly), for lunch my favorite spot is Snarf's Sandwiches or Federal Bar and Grill. There are so many dinner restaurants it's hard to choose! Uncle for picture worthy ramen, Patzquaro's Mexican food, Sexy Pizza, Highland Tap and Burger, Wynkoop Brewing and Restaurant, or Williams and Graham (a cool speakeasy) which was rated the #1 cocktail bar in the country in 2016. It's also a quick 5 minute drive to downtown for great shopping during the day and great breweries, bars and clubs for a night out.

The house is located close to both I-25 ( the main highway through Denver) and I-70 (the highway to the mountains) and is a great l
host_about:
Born and raised in Colorado, but I bleed Maize and Blue.. I love to play soccer, basketball, axe throw, and am generally just happier doing anything outdoors.

As a balance, I enjoy trying new foods and craft beers, and am always happy to share brewery and restaurant recommendations.

I have a week spot for booze brunches,  definitely best meal of the day.

name: Mid-Century Modern Room - Minutes to Cherry Creek
description: Welcome! My home is a mid-century modern, open plan that is just a few minutes away from light-rail, and Cherry Creek. It's very easy to access I-25 and go either to the Tech Center or Downtown if you're driving. No matter your background, all are welcome.
neighborhood_overview: I'm sandwiched between two mid-century modern housing developments. To the north is "Krisana Park"... A mid-century enclave that is fondly referred to as "Leichler" since it thinks it is "like Eichler". To the east is "Lynwood"... Very similar houses and very much in demand. This house was built in 1958 and is one of a kind. Other stuff? We have an authentic french bakery two blocks away (Detour) as well as an independent coffee house: Sojourners. The bus route begins a block away. The Lightrail "Colorado Station" is a mile's walk and can take you either south to the Tech Center, east to DIA or north to Downtown Denver. Cherry Creek is about 10 mins by car and has great shopping, restaurants and movie theaters. If you love gourmet, niche pizza, we have a fantastic neighborhood bistro, "Esters" that opened about a year ago. Their nachos are mouth-watering. They have a few awesome salads, some sandwiches and of course, what most people go for... The pizza (and the craft beers). Think aru
host_about: I've lived in the USA for 30+ years after narrowly escaping a rainy future in England. I can discuss American politics but not English ones, unless you count the politics of the school playground. I love chess. I've won one lottery (although there was no cash involved, just an elusive Green Card). I play six-degrees-of-separation for fun and find that in Denver, it's usually only two or three degrees (even if it's the President or a Hollywood movie star and sometimes it's one and the same). I am completely in love with my dog, Bodhi (a non-shedding, Portuguese Water Dog), who lives up to his name in every way (a being of wisdom and enlightenment). I am bummed (how's that for eloquence) that neither DaVinci or Einstein are still anchored to Terra Firma because I'd love to meet them, sit around a fountain somewhere (hopefully with an Americano in hand) and ask them what their take is on "Life, The Universe and Everything"... (Thank you Douglas Adams.) I love "Game of Thrones", "Homeland" and all things "Shameless"... And I'm just a little obsessed with the whole mid-century modern thing.

name: Private Basement Suite - the Heart of Central Park
description:
If you’re looking for quiet time or conversation, you’ll find it. Many of our guests have become family. Some simply want a place to crash! We’ll be good to you no matter what.

You have your own bedroom, bathroom, family room, coffee maker, and mini fridge. Hang out and stream Netflix or head to Puddle Jumper Pool, the Stanley Marketplace, the Town Center, or downtown Denver. Easy parking and access to Stapleton and hospitals. Close to Dick’s Sporting Goods Park.



License 2021-BFN-0008898
neighborhood_overview:
Stapleton is about 5 miles from downtown and Cherry Creek. We are a community with many families, parks, schools, and restaurants. Our neighbors are like family! Feel free to ask anyone for help or suggestions.

If you are looking for restaurants and shopping in the area, check out the Stanley Marketplace. You can walk! Plenty of restaurants, retail, coffee shops, ice cream, etc. I recommend using Yelp to determine quality of restaurant and proximity.
host_about:
Scott and I bonded over many things - one is our passion for travel. It’s in the DNA of our relationship. COVID may have blocked some of our adventures - like it has for everyone - AND it’s definitely granted us new ones!

We love being hosts. We love meeting new people, talking, and not talking. We value the inclusion, sharing, and connected culture that Airbnb offers. 

It reminds me of my great grandmother taking on “boarders!!” They seemed to be where her life stories came from.

description:
We offer an immaculate private guesthouse that is marijuana friendly. We just ask that you smoke outside.

We are located in the N. Denver neighborhood of Inspiration Point. Our guest house is a separate 400 sq ft brick unit with your own private driveway and patio.

10 min away from downtown Denver
30 min from Denver International Airport
20 min from Red Rocks
30 min Boulder
40 min from Rocky Mountain National Park
50 min from the first ski resorts
neighborhood_overview: Inspiration Point boasts a 75 mile view of the northern Front Range of the Rocky Mountains. We highly recommend walking the park to capture this magnificent view. We are the northern corner of the city of Denver with some incredible locations in walking distance like the famous Lakeside Amusement Park only three blocks away, Willis Case Golf Course just across the street to name a few. Like craft beers and interested in recreational marijuana? Tennyson Street is a lively neighborhood of bars, tattoo shops, restaurants and dispensaries only one mile away. There is a lot to experience in our part of north Denver.

description:
*Welcome to my Home -- it's comfy, modern, quiet & clean!

neighborhood_overview:
*My Home is in an ideal location.

*Virginia Village is residential, but also has an urban vibe. It is safe & walk-able, including at night--many stores & restaurants (Starbucks, Safeway, Jamba Juice, Best Buy, Hacienda Colorado, Jaya Asian Grill) are nearby.

*Free Parking: in the driveway / carport or on the street.

*Directly across the street is a church, which has a nice park.

*Easy access to Public Transit: light rail Colorado Station and buses #40 & 46.

*The highway I25-Colo Blvd Exit is only 5 min away, yet the House is quiet, so you can easily access all-things-Denver (downtown, DU, Cherry Creek & more) and beyond (the mountains).
host_about:
I have 2 amazing daughters. 

I love to travel. I've been to about 50 countries. Some of my favorites are South Africa, India, Iran, Ethiopia, Namibia, Italy, Argentina, Egypt, Israel, and Burma.

I obviously enjoy learning about & experiencing different cultures; especially but not only the food.

I'm flexible & easy-going. I prefer independent, budget travel.

name: Amazing Location | Eat, Drink, Shop, Rest & Repeat
description: Cozy garden-level apartment in historic Tennyson Square. Explore Denver's beloved Berkeley Highlands neighborhood with easy access to top eateries, coffee shops, breweries, parks, bars, and shopping. The apartment features vibrant furnishings, an ultra-cozy king bed, and a peaceful atmosphere. Discover nearby parks, art galleries, and cultural spots. Enjoy high-speed WiFi, a 60" Smart TV, a fully equipped kitchen, and a stylish bathroom. Experience the charm of Denver's Highlands neighborhood!
neighborhood_overview:
Explore Denver's Vibrant Berkeley Highlands Neighborhood!

Nestled in the heart of Denver's Berkeley Highlands, our cozy retreat offers the perfect blend of local charm and convenience. Discover the vibrant energy of Tennyson Square, just a block away, where you'll find a diverse array of restaurants, shops, bars, and parks waiting to be explored.

Local Highlights:

Tennyson Street:
Take a leisurely stroll down Tennyson Street, lined with trendy boutiques, cozy cafes, and inviting eateries. Whether you're craving a gourmet meal or a laid-back coffee, you'll find plenty of options to satisfy your palate.

Craft Breweries:
Indulge in Denver's renowned craft beer culture with a visit to one of the nearby breweries, where you can sample a variety of local brews and soak up the lively atmosphere.

Parks and Green Spaces:
Enjoy the outdoors at nearby parks, perfect for a relaxing picnic or a refreshing morning jog. Berkeley
host_about: Traveling is my passion. I try to explore as many new (and old) places as I possibly can each and every year. With a resource like Airbnb, I am able to exercise my passion more often with amazing places to stay at an affordable price.

name: 30+ Day Rental in Capitol Hill
description:
Have a sip of Rum in this bright garden level 1 bedroom apartment in the heart of Capitol Hill. Enjoy it's colorful decor while steps away from museums, the convention center and restaurants that Denver is famous for. You might swear you see a colorful tropical bird fly above this perfectly centrally located apartment. Book today and brighten your Denver stay with an electric tropical vibe. Private parking is just steps from the door. Great value in a terrific neighborhood.

2017-BFN-0000650
neighborhood_overview: Capitol Hill is Denver's most densely populated neighborhood. It was once the home of Denver's elite and origination of Foursquare architecture in Denver. Today it consists of historic mansions, apartments and condo buildings. Because of the concentration of multi-family uses and the urban character of the neighborhood, parking is at a premium. The area is strongly influenced by the Colorado State Capitol and Downtown Denver which is adjacent to the northwest boundary of the neighborhood. Commercial uses are typically located on major arterials such as Colfax Avenue, East 8th Avenue, East 14th Avenue, East 13th Avenue, Lincoln Street and Broadway. A considerable number of mansion properties have been converted to office uses over the past several years due to zoning exemptions offered to historic structures which are zoned for residential uses.
host_about: Hello, I'm originally from Ohio, and I thrive on Midwestern kindness and generosity. I have three young children, but in my free time (haha), I renovate spaces into places I would love to live. Interior design + traveling are two of my main passions. Before children, I was an avid traveler and explorer. One of my favorite ways to travel was to immerse myself in the culture. Staying at an apartment, vs a hotel, allows one to feel like they live in the new spot. I hope you enjoy staying at my listings.

neighborhood_overview: Our hostel is located in Cap Hill just a short walk from the state capitol, downtown bars and an awesome music scene. Capitol Hill was once the home of Denver’s elite and today consists of historic mansions, such as ours. The neighborhood has urban character, eclectic architecture and is well known as a haven for young artists, musicians, and bohemians (like Jack Kerouac who lived at the Colburn Hotel just one block from Ember Hostel). Near us is Colfax Avenue, which the concert and live music hub of Denver! The Filmore Auditorium, The Ogden Theater, as well as numerous late-night bars, coffee shops, thrift stores and restaurants are just blocks away. The Denver Art Museum, Santa Fe Arts District, and South Broadway bar scene is also walking distance from the hostel.

name: Cap Hill Private Condo. Great Walkability!
description:
Welcome to our recently renovated basement apartment in an 1880's built Capitol Hill gem! *We want you to know that we’re doing our part by following all Airbnb cleaning guidelines.*

This is a 1 bedroom/1 bath condo on the bottom floor of a Victorian home in the heart of Denver's cap hill neighborhood. This will truly be in a walkers paradise (Walkscore of 95!). The apartment includes newly renovated kitchen with basic supplies, a television, bluetooth speaker, and coffee.
neighborhood_overview:
With a walk score of 95, you are less than a mile from Cheesman Park, botanical gardens, museums, a variety of speciality restaurants, coffee shops, bars, B-Cycle stations, public transportation, and more.

If you have a car, please watch parking signs. Friday night at 7pm til Monday at 6am (and holidays) parking is available on the west side of Logan. Weekdays, 2 hour parking is available on the east side of Logan. Nights, weekends, and holidays, the east side of Logan is unlimited. On 11th and 12th st. there unlimited parking. Parking is difficult to find after 5pm. If all else fails there is paid parking on 13th and Logan (1.5 blocks north of the house).

name: Artisan Loft in Historic Five Points with Rustic Red Bricks
description:
Explore Denver's art district, then climb the steel stairs to this eclectic loft where vintage charm meets steam-punk fashion. Portuguese-style patterned tiles blend seamlessly with a bottle top coffee table and industrial-chic lighting.

This space was a family project (Steve, Lisa and Mick who are brothers and sister) – a carriage house built behind our 1900s house near downtown Denver. The building was designed to mimic older architecture to fit-in with the historic neighborhood. The interior was designed to carry that vintage charm inside with exposed brick and steam-punk fixtures and furniture to blend vintage and industrial design elements. We designed and built the structure including detail such as the black pipe chandelier, steel stair case and funky locker cabinets in the bathroom and bedrooms. Handcrafted items and collections from our family are displayed around the house.

The carriage house is exclusively for guests so anything you see is available i

My wife Cara is from NY and will join me this summer after she's finished the school year. We have two grown daughters Leslie and Kelly who both live in LA. We have a dog DeAndra.

name: 1885 Urban Victorian Charm | Sauna Backyard Oasis
description: Stunning & soulful loft-like Victorian built in 1885, just steps from the historical Highlands Square of Denver. Breathtaking 20' vaulted ceilings highlighted with pine beams and exposed brick everywhere! Nostalgic exterior architecture blends seamlessly with chic, modern updates inside. Huge kitchen with all the cooking essentials. 2 bedrooms and a Queen pull-out sofa in living room comfortably fit five people! Backyard is an urban oasis with a cedar sauna and ambient lights all to yourselves.
neighborhood_overview: Highland Square is a vibrant and dynamic offbeat urban neighborhood just west of downtown set among a remarkable collection of quirky shops, quaint architecture, tempting restaurants, unique entertainment, cozy homes and convenient personal services. This thriving historical arts district supported by both new youthful residents and longtime, committed community. Full of Victorian-era homes and buildings, lush gardens and parks, hip independently owned shops, art galleries and restaurants, the Denver Highlands neighborhood is a great destination for visitors. There are three diverse districts to discover here: Highlands Square, Tennyson Street and Lower Highland (LoHi). All boast there own flavors of trendy boutiques, salons, coffee shops and restaurants.
host_about:
Hey, I'm Danny! I'm originally a Midwesterner who moved to Colorado in 2017. I’m a full-time entrepreneur and have been a remote worker for a decade. 

I like to camp/hike/backpack, canoe/kayak/paddleboard, mountain bike, ski/snowboard, fish...you name it! It's easy to adopt more hobbies than you can handle in Colorado.  

I love meeting new people on my travels and really enjoy experiencing new cultures. I've been to all 50 US states, 59 countries on 6 continents, and am hoping to add more friends and destinations to this list through Airbnb! 

I use this platform on both sides and am an investor in the company too, as I believe in the growth of travel, hospitality, remote work, and placing an emphasis on buying experiences over things.

I’m easygoing, low maintenance, and don't need much to keep myself happy. I appreciate good hospitality, design, & communication and try to provide the same myself for my own listings. Let me stay at your place sometime, and you're always free to stay at mine!

Cheers and travel on!

name: Downtown Denver Victorian 1-Bedroom Apartment
description:
Beautifully modernized private 1-bedroom 1-bath apartment just 4 blocks from Downtown.

With a queen bed in the bedroom and a pull-out couch in the living area the apartment accommodates up to 4 guests.

Located among historic districts and 3 blocks from the light rail station. Just a 15 minute walk to the 16th street mall makes all of lower downtown easily accessible.

A perfect stay for anyone attending events at the Denver Convention Center - ride the light rail right to the front door!
neighborhood_overview:
The property is located in one of the oldest neighborhoods in Denver - at edges of the Curtis Park, San Rafael and Clements Historic Districts - all of which are dominated by beautifully restored Victorian 1880's homes.

Clements Historic District typifies high-style Queen Anne and Italianate architecture, and is one of the most intact collections of late 19th Century Victorian high-style residential architecture in Denver. It is representative of the City’s rapid growth and middle class population of the 19th Century. The district maintains beautiful views of the Rocky Mountains to the west.

Curtis Park, Denver’s first street car suburb, is one of the city’s oldest and most diverse residential areas. The neighborhood’s heyday was from the late 1870s until 1893. The district is a showcase of architectural styles from that era, including Italianate, Eastlake, Queen Anne, and Victorian eclectic homes. Romanesque, French Second Empire and Gothic Revival buildings
host_about:
I am a second-generation Italian-American Denver native raised in Denver's North Berkley neighborhood.

I have a background in civil engineering and worked by profession as a Geographic Information Specialist in Asia for 15 years. After returning to the US I embarked on a 3-year, painstaking renovation of the Tremont Place House.

From my time overseas I gained an appreciation for Asian style and art, which is reflected in my home renovation design and decor.

description: Make your next trip to the Mile High City memorable at this Victorian 2-bedroom, 1-bathroom vacation rental. Take a short drive to exciting downtown Denver attractions, walk the dogs around Washington Park, or spend your days exploring the local shops on South Pearl Street. Return to the home in the evening and prepare a meal on the grill or in the well-stocked kitchen. Later, watch a movie by the gas fireplace or play a board game with family and friends.
neighborhood_overview:
THINGS TO SEE + DO: South Pearl Street (3 miles), Downtown Denver (4 miles), Colorado State Capitol & Civic Center Park (4 miles), Meow Wolf | Convergence Station (4 miles), Downtown Aquarium (5 miles), Union Station (5 miles), Denver Zoo (6 miles)
TEE OFF: Aqua Golf (1 mile), Overland Golf Course (2 miles), Denver Country Club (3 miles), Wellshire Golf Course (4 miles), Cherry Hills Country Club (5 miles)
GET OUTSIDE: Ruby Hill Park (2 miles), Washington Park (2 miles), Harvard Gulch Park (2 miles), Cheeseman Park (4 miles), Denver Botanic Gardens (4 miles), Sloans Lake Park (6 miles), City Park (7 miles)
AIRPORT: Denver International Airport (25 miles)

name: Lovely Victorian/3 Bdrms/Next to Botanic Gardens
description:
Colorful Victorian home very close to restaurants, Denver Botanic Gardens, 3 parks, and downtown.
- Three queen-size beds in three separate bedrooms, pillow-top mattresses with multiple bed pillows
- 4th bed: queen-sized fold-out couch, and a 2-inch memory-foam topper
- fully-equipped kitchen
- tons of games/books
- Roku
- table seats 10
- high quality shampoos, soaps, lotions, no parabens
- all in one washer/dryer
- Window a/cs in the 3 bedrooms, and indoor Evaporative Cooler for the LR/DR.
neighborhood_overview: This is a very old neighborhood (1890's), charming and full of trees, but close enough to downtown to get there easily. We're in walking distance of restaurants, a market, coffee shop, parks, gym, swimming pool, and within close driving and biking distance of lots of things! The Botanic Gardens are super close (less than a block), and the zoo and museum of nature and science are in City Park, just 6 blocks directly north of us.
host_about:
Brad and I love Colorado, and have lived here for years.  Brad is a sommelier, and has seriously ruined my ability to drink boxed wine. He specializes in Italian wine.  He also loves to ski and can tell you about his favorite slopes.  I love my bike, gardening, and good food.  We're both foodies.  And in general, if we can be outside in the midst of any place that's green and lovely - with special points if there are small, wild creatures about - we are happiest.  

We've recently expanded our "urban farm" by including backyard chickens in the family. They are hilarious, delightful hens - all different. One might try to perch on the back of your patio chair and look over your shoulder at the book you're reading.

Like our hens, we are sociable types, love to have friends over. Guests tell us they love the house and outdoor space. Our lifestyle is relaxed and flexible, and we love to laugh.  But we also will give you all the privacy and personal space you need for your vacation or visit in Denver.

name: Platt Park Studio - 4 Miles from Downtown Denver!
description: Experience the exciting city of Denver from this charming vacation rental studio boasting a full bathroom, kitchenette, and a furnished deck. Catch a sporting event at Ball Area, watch a concert at Red Rocks Ampitheater, or walk along 16th street mall. With the many attractions of downtown just minutes away and easy access to the Rocky Mountains, this quaint getaway is the perfect couples retreat! After a day of adventure, relax on the deck and watch the sunset.
neighborhood_overview:
This Denver retreat is ideally located within steps of the amazing restaurants and shops of Broadway. Stroll 3 blocks west to grab a quick bite at Pasquini's Pizzeria and shop through the array of antique stores!

An easy 0.5-mile walk is all that stands between you and wonderful Pearl Street, home to various upscale boutiques and top-rated restaurants like Sushi Den and OTOTO. If you're in the mood for a casual meal, stop by Park Burger for a Classic Double and The Works!

The condo is also within walking distance of the Broadway light rail station, making it effortless to get downtown! While you’re in the city, roam down 16th Street filled with shops, check out the restaurant scene of Larimer Square, or catch a game at one of the several sports venues!

Outdoor lovers can get their nature fix in no time, as the mountains are only a quick drive away. Head to Lookout Mountain Park to unveil some stunning scenery, discover the archaic footprints of

This is a one of a kind place. Also, an easy walk to so many great places you'll need a month to get everything in!

Doggies allowed !!! Pet fee is $150 for the stay

neighborhood_overview:
Sunset Magazine: We can’t think of a cooler part of Denver than Lower Highland and the Central Platte Valley for beating the midwinter doldrums with a shot of cosmopolitan buzz. Think happening restaurants, a new contemporary art museum, and an architecturally forward-thinking bridge. The neighborhoods are easier than ever to visit in tandem, thanks to the bicycle-and-pedestrian Highland Bridge connecting them across Interstate 25.

Culture Trip: Restaurants: https://theculturetrip.com/north-america/usa/colorado/articles/the-10-best-restaurants-in-lohi-denver-s-hip-neighborhood/

LOHI

LoHi's unparalleled city view, access to the Highland Pedestrian bridge, and vibrant restaurant scene make it one of Denver's most popular neighborhoods. Accessibility and lifestyle are at the heart of LoHi Denver!
It’s home to young singles, urban professionals and growing families, who enjoy the quiet streets and proximity to neighborhood galleries, coffee shops and s
host_about:
I'm a portrait and wedding photographer working and playing in Denver, Boulder and around the country and world. When I'm not working, I'm trail running in foothills, cycling wherever I can, or riding my horse into the sunset. So much to do and enjoy in Colorado. 

I love meeting others through AirBnB and am excited to share this unique space with other adventurers. 

Welcome!!

host_about:
Welcome to our page! 

We are a hospitality and property management company dedicated to guest experience, fast response times, property cleanliness and an overall seamless and enjoyable stay for our guests. 

We manage everything from luxurious homes to affordable, yet value driven properties. Whether you want to explore the mountains in Colorado, soak up the sun in South Florida or look for longer term stays for business travels, our portfolio has a diverse set of properties in locations nationwide. 

Each property is fully stocked with items such as linens, kitchenware, everyday house hold items and more. Our team is constantly auditing our properties and performing quality control checks to ensure we have everything just right for your stay. Our cleaning partners dedicate themselves to thorough and detailed cleans that match the standard of 5-star hotels. 

Things do happen from time to time and when they do we are right here to answer any questions or concerns. We respond quickly and have a 24-hour response team in those rare emergencies. 

Lastly, hospitality is our number one focus. We are here to answer your questions, guide you through your stay and take care of anything you need.  We want you to have a memorable experience that keeps you choosing us for you next travel adventure!

name: Walk to Mile High Stadium & Downtown Denver!
description: Our guesthouse is the perfect location for exploring the city. We're  just a few blocks from Mile High Stadium and walking distance to many restaurants, breweries, and Denver City attractions. You will have complete privacy, your own off-street parking space, and all the amenities you need for a comfortable stay.
neighborhood_overview: Jefferson Park is a cute little neighborhood close to everything - home to the Mile High Stadium and a five minute walk to the Denver Aquarium, REI, Platte River trail, and several breweries and restaurants. In 15 minutes you can walk to downtown Denver. Hundred+ year old Victorian homes sit on our tree-lined street, which borders a beautiful neighborhood park that gives Jefferson Park it's name!

neighborhood_overview:
Walk to Lo-Hi! Coors Field & Lo-Do is ONLY 1 mile away! On the way back from the Rockies game grab some grub at Avanti Food & Beverage, then just a 5-minute walk home. Avanti Food & Beverage, Denver’s “Collective Eatery”, contains 2 bars & several “food truck” style restaurants for each member of your group to pick from. With too many bars & eateries to name in the immediate vicinity, your taste buds will be entertained at every meal.

Take the family a quick mile away to spend the day at the Downtown Aquarium, Elitch Gardens Theme & Water Park (Six Flags), or find your own haven on the banks of the South Platte River, at Commons Park, with trails to connect to the entire Denver area! The Pepsi Center is practically right next door with a variety of concerts & sporting events. From there, you are on the edge of downtown Denver with multitudes of shopping, sightseeing, & year-round events for the entire family. name: Cozy Capitol Hill Apt with Private Balcony
description: Capitol Hill is one of Denver’s most popular neighborhoods. The apartment is in a great building with a rooftop lounge that boasts incredible views and a grill for rooftop cookouts. You’ll get the perks of luxury living in a historic neighborhood. Within walking distance are an abundance of restaurants, coffee shops, and nightlife. 16th Street Mall and The Colorado Convention Center are both less than 1.5 miles away.
neighborhood_overview:
Check out Charlie Brown's for great food, drinks, and piano bar entertainment.
Torchy's Tacos is close by AND amazing!
Lowdown Brewery has a great outdoor patio space and fantastic beer.
City O' City is a delicious option for everyone, especially vegans and vegetarians.
Walking distance to the Denver Art Museum, The History of Colorado Center, Cheeseman Park, and the Capitol Building.

name: Capitol Hill Getaway across from Cheesman Park!
description:
Stunning garden apartment fully remodeled in 2021! Enjoy staying in Denver's first Historical District (every home is on the National Register of Historic Places) . There is so much history and character that the Denver Historical Society has tours of the neighborhood.

- Across the street from Cheesman Park!
- 10min drive/10min bus/30min walk to downtown (5min walk to restaurants, shops, and dispensary)
- New memory foam beds
- Convenience of city living in a quiet setting
neighborhood_overview: Denver's first Historic District affectionately known as Humboldt Island to the locals. Every home here is so incredibly unique that the Denver Historical Society even has tours of our neighborhood. You will be within a 10 minute walking distance of countless restaurants, nightlife, and Denver must-sees!
host_about:
I'm very active and love trying new things. Hobbies include travel, food, exercise, and playing with my dogs. 

Moving to Denver, CO has been one of the best decisions I've ever made. I love being able to host our space on AirBnB to other travelers so they can experience the city too!

name: Enchanting Escape
description: Step out of the usual boutique hotel routine and truly experience the liveliness of Denver. The Curtis Park Club has everything any wanderer needs to feel at home in the West. At The Curtis Park Club, our mission to provide every guest with the most memorable experience imaginable during their time in Denver. The Enchanting Escape is quaint, smaller room -  perfect for two people who want to spend as much time in and around Denver as possible.
neighborhood_overview:
Nestled in the heart of Denver, Colorado, our charming hotel is located in the RiNo District and offers the perfect home base for your Mile High City adventure. Known for its eclectic mix of art, culture, and urban living, this neighborhood is an artistic and culinary mecca that will make your stay truly unforgettable.

Artistic Vibes: RiNo is Denver's premier art district, and you'll be surrounded by mesmerizing street art and colorful murals at every turn. Stroll down the streets and alleys to discover stunning graffiti, sculptures, and inspiring art installations. You'll quickly see why RiNo is often described as an open-air art gallery.

Craft Breweries: Craft beer enthusiasts, you're in for a treat! RiNo is home to numerous award-winning breweries and taprooms. Sip on unique, locally brewed beers while soaking up the lively atmosphere. Be sure to explore the RiNo Beer Trail for a taste of the best of Denver's craft beer scene.

Culinary Delights: Food
host_about: Whether you're in town for business or to get away for the weekend, The Curtis Park Club has everything a traveler would desire. We are located in the heart of RiNo. Our purpose is to equip travelers with anything they would need to make their stay in Denver the most memorable experience yet. If you're interested in renting out the entire space for an event, please send us a message so we can assist with planning the finest outing possible!

name: Spacious Artist’s House in the middle of Denver
description: Fantastic, one of a kind 138 year old home with 2,550 spacious sf close to the best Central Denver has to offer. One block from the light rail or a short walk to Coors Field, the convention center, restaurants, music venues, RiNo (River North Arts District) and much more. Play cards and shuffleboard in the basement speakeasy/3rd bedroom or hang out around the fire pit out back while grilling with views of the city.
neighborhood_overview:
Just three blocks away is the River North Arts District (RiNo) which made Food + Wine Magazine's 2018 Top 10 Coolest Neighborhoods. There you'll find hundreds of great murals, coffee shops, restaurants galore, nightlife and the largest concentration of Brewery's, Cideries, Distilleries and Wineries in a 1 square mile radius anywhere in the country with 18 Breweries and counting. If you'd like to venture a bit further, you'll be a 15 minute walk from Coors Field which is surrounded by some of Denver's hottest clubs and nightlife activities. If you don't want to walk, there are scooters for rent all over. Uber and Lyft are also a great way to get around.
Also close is City Park where you'll find a golf course, Nature and Science Museum and the Denver Zoo.
Visit: https://www.airbnb.com/things-to-do/denver for several great ideas.

description:
Welcome to The Poplar Queen, a charming two-bedroom rental in Denver's Park Hill neighborhood. This unit offers easy access to Denver's attractions and features a full kitchen, climate control, and free off-street parking. Enjoy a marijuana-friendly experience and stay connected with fast WiFi.

Walking distance to Dining, Gas, and Groceries

neighborhood_overview:
I bought the home in June 2018 and have grown to love the neighborhood. The house sits on the border between the traditional Park Hill neighborhood and the newer City Park (formerly Stapleton). This offers the advantage of staying in a well-lived and loved neighborhood with easy access to amenities.

Just a block away, you'll find a shopping center with a large grocery store, three different types of fitness facilities, and plenty of restaurants. Whether you're looking for a quick lunch at Chipotle, a yoga session at Core Power, or a delicious meal at Little India, the neighborhood has something for everyone. There are also several other commercial centers within a close radius for all your shopping, dining, and entertainment needs.

For marijuana dispensaries, you're in a great area. Five minutes north along the I-70 corridor, many industrial spaces have been converted to marijuana grows or shops. Five minutes south is E. Colfax Ave, an iconic Denver street known
host_about:
Hi!  I'm a 5th generation Denver native with roots and pride in my place.  I love welcoming people to the Mile High City and putting our best foot forward by hosting my home.  In July 2020 I also become owner and proprietor of a very cool property in Western Colorado currently hosting three tiny homes.

Before COVID I spent several long stretches of the year working as a Tour Director.  I lead small groups on wonderful vacations like "Italy's Great Cities," or the "Best of Spain." I also lead student groups to DC and NYC, and birthright tours to Israel.

Long term travel is in my system.  I've spent years at a time in Morocco for the US Peace Corps and more years in each of Japan, Israel and Costa Rica working mostly as an English teacher and basketball coach.

Between the really long living abroad situations, I tried to see as much as I could see.  From the top bunk of a crowded boxcar on the Trans-Siberian Railway, to five-star hotels in Jerusalem I stayed everywhere.  Seeing the best and worst of accommodations, I learned to love the hospitality game.  

In 2014 I returned to Denver to became a family caregiver.  I began hosting a small family owned condo in Denver.  That little condo kept my pockets jingling and my mind spinning for four years.  So many problems!  Floods and bugs and drugs, Oh my!

But I worked that little listing, and I leveraged my hard-knock education into SuperHost status.  When it came time to trade up, I sold the condo and found this wonderful house in Denver.  I selected it specifically because I recognized its versatility as an AirBnB property.  

This home will forever be a work in progress.  It will never be perfect.  But it may be perfect for you!  I am an individual home owner and not a large conglomerate or property management company.  I'm working to improve and integrate new technology including dynamic pricing, limited automated messaging, and streamlining all my cleaning processes.

Would love to have you see these little passion projects of mine.  Speak to you soon!

name: Charming carriage house - 30 day rental
description: This charming carriage house is fully equipped with all the amenities to make your stay enjoyable. Its location in downtown Denver, trendy bars, and some of Denver's best restaurants will provide nightlife fun for all types of travelers.
host_about:
Scott Hemerda is a founding principal and owner of Vacation Rental Collective (VRC), offering premier vacation rentals along the Front Range, including the greater Denver metropolitan area.  As a native Coloradoan, Scott spent his childhood in Littleton, studied at Colorado State University in Fort Collins, and raised his family in Parker. His daily commute to downtown Denver led to a love of the city in addition to his established love of the surrounding suburbs and mountains. Scott worked in financial services as the Director of Institutional Relationships for 18 years at TIAA-CREF, where he managed relationships worth 20 billion in assets. In addition to leading the top performing relationship management team, Scott supported and retained clients through challenging service model and system changes all evidence of his superior relationship management skills.
Scott married his high school sweetheart and they have three children. A lover of sports, he instilled the values of collaboration, teamwork, and good sportsmanship as a role model participating in softball and basketball and then as a coach for all of his children in their numerous activities. Scott grew up skiing and now enjoys hiking and exploring the mountains with his wife. Business trips, family vacations, and romantic getaways have cultivated his love and expertise on the needs of vacationers.

neighborhood_overview:
We live in the historic Clayton neighborhood which is a wonderful, quiet and diverse neighborhood. There's a mix of young people, families and seniors from all different backgrounds and we ask that you respect everyone you encounter.

Within walking distance you can find River and Roads Coffee Shop, Tres Girasoles Mexican Grill, Tighe Brothers Distillery, NOLA, Jack Rabbit Slims Sports Bar and an array of fast food. City Park is 6 blocks south which is home to the Denver Zoo, the Denver Museum of Nature & Science, and boasts many outdoor activities, music concerts, paddle-boating and more. We are a short drive or bike ride (about 3 miles) from Downtown Denver, Coors Field, Union Station, Larimer Square, 16th Street Mall and the hundreds of restaurants and bars Denver has to offer. If you're here to ski, you can hop on I-70 easily to get to the mountains (but no promises about I-70 traffic when you head back to the city!)

We are located just off I-70, 20 mins to
host_about: We are a family of Coloradans  (our kids are 6th gen Coloradans!) who love all things Colorado and are passionate about the communities around us. neighborhood_overview:
North Park Hill is a historic location of Denver, bordering Martin Luther King Jr Blvd and Colorado Blvd. It is one of the most mixed neighborhoods of the city where you can find everything from local breweries to amazing soul food.

This location is right across from a small local park; less than a mile and a half away from the RTD A Train from Denver International Airport (40th and Colorado Station); 1.5 miles to the South is Denver Museum of Nature & Science, the Denver Zoo, City Park, and the infamous Colfax Avenue.

This location borders Central Denver and is extremely close to City Park, Rhino, Congress Park, Skyland, Stapleton, Hale, Clayton,Cole, Whittier; and less than a 15 minute drive to Capitol Hill, Five Points, Cheeseman Park, Golden Triangle, downtown, and Cherry Creek.
host_about:
As a traveler, usually not asking for much more than a place to sleep, to me it's all about location!

As a host and concierge I can be on site up to half the time, though sometimes I am away on my own travels. I try to find a balance between giving guests ample space and unhindered access to shared spaces and being there to share stories, answer questions and give local advice.

neighborhood_overview: My neighborhood is called Westwood and is located on the southwest side of Denver. The main street through the neighborhood is called Morrison Road Corridor and is colored with beautiful murals along the entire strip. Within walking distance (along Morrison Road) you'll find several Mexican restaurants, a Mexican ice cream parlor, a few bars, a couple of small/tiny grocery spots, a liquor store and dispensary. Khalos Mexican Restaurant is particularly tasty with lots of vegetarian and vegan options, fresh juices and smoothies along with all of your favorite Mexican dishes.  Cultura Chocolate, across the street from Khalos, has unique gift shop and serves amazing tasting chocolate, teas and coffees. On the weekends a Mayan food truck is open just behind the cafe and serves some yummy foods and I hear they smoke the meat underground over night. Down the street a bit further is a great low-key artisan pizza place called Pizzeria Lui. There are two small parks within a short walking distan
host_about: Hi! I live in Colorado with my two little dogs. I love to get out of town on the weekends and in the summer when I’m off work, I spend my days at my place in Michigan by the lake. I enjoy hiking, riding bikes, camping, snowboarding, fixing up my house, gardening and going to the lake. My pronouns are she/her.

neighborhood_overview: South Park Hill is considered one of the best neighborhoods in Denver metro. We are located on the coveted 17th Avenue Parkway, among some of Denver's most beautiful old homes. There is a glorious center parkway right in front of our house ideal for walks or a run that goes east for nearly 2 miles with beautiful trees and greenery and some of the best architecture in the city. And to the West one block you will find City Park...one of the largest parks in Denver at 3 miles around. It backs up to The Denver Zoo and houses The Denver Museum of Nature & Science. One of our favorite evening strolls is walking through City Park around the lake and by the boat house. :)
host_about:
Billy and Tahvory have been together for 20 years! Tahvory is a Colorado native born and raised in the Boulder area and Billy was raised on the East coast in Guilford Connecticut and has lived in Colorado since 1990 and considers himself a local.  They've lived in the neighborhood for 20+ years and have watched it grow into the thriving neighborhood it has become! They both love the outdoors and spend a lot of their time enjoying the amazing mountains of Colorado. Tahvory is a hiking enthusiast and Billy has been skiing since he was 3 years old and gets out on the mountain as much as possible. 

Billy and Tahvory are both very social people and know the city and it's many fun places to explore!!  Feel free to ask any questions about restaurants or nightlife.  Their biggest hope by opening this space to guests, is to  provide a unique and personal  experience on their visit to Denver, and if the timing is right meet some very interesting people during their stay in their home.

If you choose to stay with them, don't hesitate to call them if you need advice about this beautiful city they call HOME.

name: Middle of Denver, Private 7 Rooms, Kitchen
description:
Work & Play in the Heart of Denver. 7 Private Rooms, just Painted. Clean, Safe, Warm & Comfortable. Everything is here! Amenities, Balcony, Free Parking, Walkability, 2,500 Venues, Shops, Eateries, Clubs close by.

Remodeled King Master w/Balcony. Workstations, Big Screen, Kitchen, Laundry, Fast WiFi. Thick Towels & Quiet nights.

Coffee & Tea: fresh cream, bottled water, condiments, many extras.

2 Blocks: groceries, parks, dining & shopping. 1/2 mile: 500+ more. Enjoy where you are!
neighborhood_overview:
Huge trees, well-kept homes on a charming street in the best part of Denver, minutes to every top venue in the city. Nights are quiet. Low-density, single-family home neighborhood in the heart of Mid-Town Denver. The house, street, neighborhood, community and area combine to make this a rare Airbnb opportunity. Guests really do get it all: a house with everything on a property that is everywhere. Please read the reviews, check out a Denver map or ask Tim, your Host. This section begins at home, expands outward 360 degrees.

Guests are thrilled with the ability to stay in their "own private house and enjoy proximity to everything". Convenient walkability, close to downtown, events and attractions, steps to transit line and free parking 30-feet from the front door. The vibrant neighborhood features quiet evenings, interesting turn-of-the last 2 centuries architecture and stunning original Denver homes. The street is clean and safe with towering maple and elm trees and friendly
host_about:
Greetings Airbnb travelers. Welcome to Denver Colorado!

I’ve learned a couple things from my business career and 15-year experience with VRBO/Home Away. First: no matter how competitive or “mature” your market is, there is always room for a company that does it right. And: listen to your guests, get creative and provide dazzling service.

You already have the location and amenities. I look forward to helping make your stay in Denver-the best.  I’m a Colorado native, University of Colorado at Boulder grad, businessperson, City-dweller and outdoor adventure junkie. My passions are family, snow skiing and exploring my surrounding urban environment.

I look forward being here for you and providing an appropriate and memorable personal touch, even if that means staying out of your way.  Please feel free to connect with me via text, phone or email-anytime. Thank you for taking a look.

Tim

name: Contemporary Berkeley 3 BED/3 BATH & Outdoor Patio
description: This property is centrally located in Denver’s charming Berkeley neighborhood where you’ll find easy access to restaurants/bars, breweries, coffee, shopping and outdoor recreation. The unit features 3 bedrooms, 3 bathrooms, a fully equipped kitchen, living/dining area and outdoor patio. Easy access to DIA, downtown, Tennyson St., Highlands and all that Denver has to offer!
neighborhood_overview: Berkeley has a quiet small town feel but is close to some of Denver’s most popular restaurants, shops breweries and so much more. There are several coffee and restaurant options within walking distance. Tennyson Street is about a mile away and is lined with an eclectic mix of art galleries, shopping, breweries and unique amenities. Rocky Mountain Lake park is a few blocks away and Berkley Lake Park is less than a mile away both are perfect for picnics or an evening stroll. This funky neighborhood is full of local flavor and offers a unique Denver experience!

name: 30 DAY DEAL I  MODERN STUDIO GEM IN REGIS
description:
Denver's Hidden Gem!

Welcome to our cozy studio suite, tucked in the heart of Denver for an amazing stay.

Unique & Cozy: Experience a one-of-a-kind stay.
Private Oasis: Enjoy our suite with a private entrance and bathroom.
Close to Regis University
Vibrant Neighborhood: Explore Tennyson Street & Highlands Square
Proximity to Denver's Best: Downtown, Highlands, Red Rocks, and mountains
Sleeps up to 4
Your Denver adventure begins here. Book now for this charming hidden gem!
neighborhood_overview: Easy access to Downtown from this urban city neighborhood called Berkeley Heights/Regis and the walk-able two neighborhood commercial spots that have bars, restaurants, shops, and 2 large parks with lakes. We are two blocks away from Rocky Mountain Lake Park! Simple commute to downtown, DTC, airport, mountains, ski-resorts, Red Rocks, and Boulder. We also live right next door to a Buddhist Temple which is very unique.  We have a few great restaurants and bars within walking distance. Also, Regis University is 2 blocks away if you're coming for an event!
host_about: My husband and I have 3 kids under the age of 9! We lead very active lives and love exploring, fitness, eating, and traveling!
