name: Private Room in Charming Denver Row House
description: This charming, private guest room is found in the up and coming Jefferson Park neighborhood of Denver. My home is just steps from a coffee shop, liquor store, pizza place, grocery store, ice cream shop & several restaurants! I am a 10 minute walk to Mile High Stadium, perfect for access to concerts and football games! I have easy access to downtown for all of the attractions & to I-25 for mountain adventures! I get the convenience of city living with the feel of living in a quiet neighborhood.
neighborhood_overview: I am in the up and coming, yet still quaint neighborhood of Jefferson Park. In addition to the coffee shops, restaurants, and parks just a few blocks away we are just a 10 minute walk to Mile High Stadium, 5 minute drive to the Pepsi Center, 5 minute drive to the Highlands neighborhoods and 8 minutes to downtown (i.e. LoDo & Ballpark). There is also super easy access to I-25 for anyone looking to adventure in the mountains!
host_about:
I’m quiet, tidy, polite and love getting to meet new people! I like to experience new places like the locals experience it, for that reason I tend to book shared Airbnb‘s so that I get to interact with the host. 

I love the outdoors, hiking, camping and spending time with my dog. 

I am an Airbnb host myself and have met the most amazing people!

name: Modern Victorian in Highlands
description: Beautiful Victorian home is 1 block away to colorful Highlands shopping and dining. The perfect home base to explore Denver. Five minutes to Downtown, 3 minutes to LOHI, and 8 minutes to RINO, this 3 bedroom/1.5 bath two-level renovated Victorian is convenient, and perfect for larger groups & families. A gorgeous private garden patio backyard is dreamy for entertaining with market lights and hurricane candles. It has beautiful citrus and succulents and a grapevine arbor lounge area with a BBQ.
neighborhood_overview:
Highlands is a fun historic neighborhood, and one of the most walkable. You can easily walk up the alley to 32nd Ave where you’ll find NOVO coffee, El Camino tavern for authentic Colorado Mexican food and great margaritas, FnG restaurant for delicious sliders and burgers, mondo vino wine store for a superlative wine and special Colorado distilled spirits and brews, and Salt & Grinder for perfect sandwiches to take on hike. The Perfect Petal is our floral and retail boutique. You should find fun homewares and cards. Next door is Ruby Jane for all your travel apparel shopping needs!

The next neighborhood over is called LOHI. (Lower Highlands) there you’ll find incredible restaurants and views of the city. We love Bar Dough, Uncle, señor Bear, Old Major, El Five, Linger, Family Jones and Root Down. I would take a short LYFT rather than walk but it depends on your fitness level.

RINO is close and is THE hot area right now. Look for all of the art murals along Lari
host_about: I am a travel lover, who loves to be hosted and host others! I own a Floral Special event company and homewares store in Denver. My family also runs a lodge and event venue in the Tx Hill Country. We love art, books, collecting objects and friends in all our travels and work.

name: Urban Oasis - private room in the heart of LoHi
description: Stay in the heart of LoHi with restaurants, bars, parks and shops right outside the door. Enjoy the privacy of your own bedroom with en suite bathroom while sharing our townhouse - perfect for those needing a "home base" when visiting friends or family or coming/going from a ski trip!
neighborhood_overview: Located right in the middle of LoHi, the hottest spot in town! You will be within walking distance of some of the best restaurants and bars (Avanti, Linger, Root Down, Williams & Graham, Little Man Ice Cream) and minutes away from all the major stadiums (Pepsi Center, Broncos Stadium, Coors Field). A quick Lyft/Uber ride will put all of Denver's hippest areas within easy reach: $6-$10 to LoDo, Uptown, & South Broadway; Cherry Creek is only about 20 minutes away. With easy access to the highway, this is perfect spot to start or end your Mountain Getaway.
host_about: As a Colorado native, i love the mountains and outdoor adventures and since I’m a proud dog Dad, Buster usually comes along for the ride. I also enjoy a nice craft beer or local whiskey, rock out to 80’s music and chill out with a murder mystery or horror movie.

There is bus service within a block that services downtown Denver.

name: Clean & Comfy Private Room * Ideal Location
description:
*Welcome to my Home -- the basement is modern, comfy, quiet & clean!

*Ideal Location: 5 min to the highway I25-Colo Blvd Exit -- easily access public transport -- close to d'town, DU & Cherry Creek -- walk to stores & restaurants.

*small Private Room: comfy twin -- space heater & fan.

*Bathroom: often private but might be shared with me.

*Den: smart tv & comfy couch.

*(Main Level) Kitchen, Living/Dining & Back Patio--great place to eat & relax.

*self check-In -- free parking -- WIFI
neighborhood_overview:
*Virginia Village is residential, but also has an urban vibe. It is safe & walk-able, including at night -- nearby are many stores & restaurants (Starbucks, Safeway, Best Buy, Jamba Juice, Corner Store, Jaya Asian Grill, Hacienda Colorado).

*Free Parking: in the driveway / carport or on the street.

*Directly across the street is a church, which has a nice park.

*The highway I25-Colo Blvd Exit is only 5 minutes away, yet the House is quiet, so you can easily access all-things-Denver (Cherry Creek, University of Denver, downtown) & beyond (the mountains).

*Easy access to Public Transit: light rail at Colorado Station (Colo Blvd & Evans) & buses #40 & 46.
host_about:
I have 2 amazing daughters. 

I love to travel. I've been to about 50 countries. Some of my favorites are South Africa, India, Iran, Ethiopia, Namibia, Italy, Argentina, Egypt, Israel, and Burma.

I obviously enjoy learning about & experiencing different cultures; especially but not only the food.

I'm flexible & easy-going. I prefer independent, budget travel.

I'll go anywhere to see Springsteen; I've been to approximately 150 concerts.

I'm from Baltimore--go Orioles--and have lived in Denver for over 20 years. I love the sunshine & everything the mountains have to offer.

name: Lovely garden level One block from Washington Park
description: This private apartment is on the lower level of our single-family home in one of Denver's most popular and centrally located neighborhoods.  It includes a comfortable living room,  full kitchen,  bedroom and bath.   Enjoy the comfy new queen bed, and if needed, there is a self- inflating twin mattress.  There's a private patio right outside your door so you can enjoy Denver's sunny days.
neighborhood_overview: Every season brings new beauty to Washington Park, less than a block away.   Year round you'll find Denver locals enjoying a run, a walk, or riding bikes -- enjoying the outdoors that Colorado is famous for. You'll be a short fifteen minute walk to two unique urban districts with great restaurants and locally-owned shops; Old South Pearl Street, and historic South Gaylord.  You can catch Denver's light rail train for a quick ride downtown to the theater district, concert halls and sports arenas.

name: Sunny Highlands Home Brimming with Style
description: Head upstairs to escape into the Hightop House. The sunny, vaulted space overlooks bustling 32nd Avenue in the heart of Denver's popular Highlands neighborhood. Bold pops of color and artfully curated pieces enhance a loft-like living space with skylights. The thoughtfully designed space is equally comfortable for one guest staying a single night or for a group of friends settling in for a week or more. Come stay with us!
neighborhood_overview: The guesthouse is above a design studio, in a walkable neighborhood full of young people, families, and dogs. Explore its markets, coffee shops, restaurants, and parks. A wonderful old bookstore and a marijuana dispensary are just steps away.
host_about: Hi! Together Kimberly and Marke are raising three girls and running The Made Shop, a design studio in Denver, Colorado. We've been traveling with our girls since they were babies, staying in wonderful airbnb homes around the world. We've just built a new house and studio in Denver, and designed our own airbnb apartment above the studio. We're truly enjoying getting to host now as well as guest.

host_about:
Scott Hemerda is a founding principal and owner of Vacation Rental Collective (VRC), offering premier vacation rentals along the Front Range, including the greater Denver metropolitan area.  As a native Coloradoan, Scott spent his childhood in Littleton, studied at Colorado State University in Fort Collins, and raised his family in Parker. His daily commute to downtown Denver led to a love of the city in addition to his established love of the surrounding suburbs and mountains. Scott worked in financial services as the Director of Institutional Relationships for 18 years at TIAA-CREF, where he managed relationships worth 20 billion in assets. In addition to leading the top performing relationship management team, Scott supported and retained clients through challenging service model and system changes all evidence of his superior relationship management skills.
Scott married his high school sweetheart and they have three children. A lover of sports, he instilled the values of collaboration, teamwork, and good sportsmanship as a role model participating in softball and basketball and then as a coach for all of his children in their numerous activities. Scott grew up skiing and now enjoys hiking and exploring the mountains with his wife. Business trips, family vacations, and romantic getaways have cultivated his love and expertise on the needs of vacationers.

Get a great night's rest before heading out on your Colorado adventure! Cook meals in a fully-equipped kitchenette.
Utilize the spacious modern shower w/ dual shower heads.
Stay in to work, write that blog, cozy up to watch a movie, or read a book.

name: Insta-Worthy Victorian Home (3 beds +balcony/loft)
description:
WELCOME TO YOUR HOME AWAY FROM HOME IN DENVER!

Discover the perfect blend of historic elegance and contemporary style in our 130-year-old Victorian condo, located in the heart of Five Points. This "Insta-worthy" 3-bedroom home offers modern amenities, accommodating up to 6 guests with 3 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms. foodie/brewery mecca ● hip/artsy ● local businesses ● music venues ● vibrant

host_about:
I'm an entrepreneur and emergency manager that is addicted to traveling, good coffee, and the occasional craft brew. I started Airbnb hosting in 2019 & became an Airbnb Ambassador in 2020 - I'm excited to meet new people and share my love for Colorado with them!

My guests can expect an awesome stay every single time. I really care about you, your needs, and expectations... I hope you love Colorado as much as I do!!

name: Home w/ Yard & Grill - 1 Mile to Downtown Denver!
description: Let this stunning vacation rental serve as the foundation for your next holiday to the Mile High City! This 3-bedroom, 2.5 bathroom home is well-appointed with accommodations for 6, modern decor, and a backyard complete with patio furniture and sparkly market lights. Nestled in the trendy Five Points neighborhood, you're within walking distance to breweries, restaurants, cafes and the Five Points Jazz Festival! Other nearby attractions include Coors Field, the Pepsi Center and Mile High Stadium.
neighborhood_overview:
Easily explore all that colorful Colorado has to offer from this Five Points property! Walk to nearby art galleries, breweries, Rosenberg's Bagels, Cervantes Ballroom, or the Light Rail station for easy transportation to downtown Denver.

The greater Denver area hosts an array of exciting events, including the Great American Beerfest, Denver Comic Con, the Five Points Jazz Festival, and the Denver Auto Show.

Sports fanatics are in luck with Mile High Stadium, Coors Field, and the Pepsi Center all within 2.5 miles of this vacation rental!

The mountains are calling and you must go! Hop in the car for a scenic drive on I-70 to Summit County for skiing, hiking, mountain biking, and more!

Other area attractions include the famous Red Rocks Amphitheatre, the Denver Center for the Performing Arts, Union Station, and the lower Highlands neighborhood for delectable cuisine and cocktails!
host_about:
Hi! We’re Evolve, the hospitality team that helps you rest easy when you rent a private, professionally cleaned home from us.

We promise your rental will be clean, safe, and true to what you saw on Airbnb or we'll make it right. Check-ins are always smooth, and we're here 24/7 to answer any questions or help you find the perfect property.

name: Paintbrush Room: GOURMET BREAKFAST INCLUDED
description:
The Capitol Hill Mansion Bed and Breakfast Inn has been in operation for approximately two decades and is the Number 1 rated bed and breakfast in Denver. The Mansion has a perfect 5.0 star average review on TripAdvisor with over 1000 reviews.

The owner, Carl, is a well known Gourmet chef, featured in Nationwide B&B cookbooks, and each morning he provides his guests with a true culinary experience. His rooms are constantly updated while retaining old world charm that rival the best hotels.
neighborhood_overview: The mansion is a Denver and National Landmark and has been given historic designation from the Landmark Preservation Commission, Colorado State Register of Historic Properties and the National Register of Historic Places. The mansion is within four (4) blocks of the State of Colorado Capital building, three (3) blocks to the History Colorado Museum, four (4) blocks to the Denver Art Museum, (1) block to the Molly Brown House Museum, and (2) blocks to the Vance Kirkland Museum, known as the “Museum District” and (5) blocks to the 16th Street mall and many other area attractions.
host_about:
Nestled in the quaint Capitol Hill Neighborhood of downtown Denver, this romantic Bed and Breakfast is a Colorado and National Historic Landmark and is just a short walk from everything in the Mile-High City, including attractions, gourmet restaurants, theaters, museums and shopping.

Built in 1891, the gorgeous ruby sandstone mansion is located on Denver’s famous “Millionaires Row,” just a block from the mansion immortalized in folklore -- the home of “Unsinkable Molly Brown.” This was Denver’s original upscale neighborhood. The homes here feature a variety of classical architectural styles, each with its own flamboyant and whimsical touches such as turrets, spires, and porches.

Eight elegantly appointed rooms and suites offer turn-of-the-century opulence with modern day flair.
property_type: Private room in bed and breakfast

name: Tastefully Designed Apt In Historic Neighborhood
description:
This modern and elegantly designed garden level apartment is the perfect blend of style, comfort and location.


**A tenant lives upstairs. We only allow the outdoor grill in the backyard courtyard to be used by both tenants.**

2024-BFN-0010287
neighborhood_overview: We are located in a Prime location in downtown Denver.
host_about:
Welcome to our page! 

We are a hospitality and property management company dedicated to guest experience, fast response times, property cleanliness and an overall seamless and enjoyable stay for our guests. 

We manage everything from luxurious homes to affordable, yet value driven properties. Whether you want to explore the mountains in Colorado, soak up the sun in South Florida or look for longer term stays for business travels, our portfolio has a diverse set of properties in locations nationwide. 

Each property is fully stocked with items such as linens, kitchenware, everyday house hold items and more. Our team is constantly auditing our properties and performing quality control checks to ensure we have everything just right for your stay. Our cleaning partners dedicate themselves to thorough and detailed cleans that match the standard of 5-star hotels. 

Things do happen from time to time and when they do we are right here to answer any questions or concerns. We respond quickly and have a 24-hour response team in those rare emergencies. 

Lastly, hospitality is our number one focus. We are here to answer your questions, guide you through your stay and take care of anything you need.  We want you to have a memorable experience that keeps you choosing us for you next travel adventure!

name: Private Residence in Berkeley
description: Beautifully appointed 1 bedroom/ 1 bathroom, 650 sq ft private unit with a private 1 car garage. The kitchen features new stainless appliances and necessary utensils to cook meals during your stay. High efficiency washer/dryer in unit. The bathroom is stocked with basic toiletries for your convenience. Smart TV with cable and HBO. Queen sleeper sofa in living room. Dining table with 4 chairs. Excellent location close to highways, downtown Denver, and numerous restaurants, bars, and parks.
neighborhood_overview: Berkeley has more amenities than can be listed here, but, we'll try anyway: Tennyson St coffee, Parisi, Mas Kaos, CTA Brewery, Local 46, Wendells, Tres Chiles, West End Tavern, Hops & Pie, Billy's Inn, Allegro coffee, Berkeley Park, Rocky Mountain Lake Park, the list goes on and on and all of this is within walking distance.

name: Comfy Suite, Great Neighborhood, Restaurants, Vibe
description: Newly-remodeled 2-bedroom garden-level suite in my centrally located Denver home with semi-private entrance. Guests are loving the walkability to great restaurants, coffee shops, breweries and shops. Located minutes away from Denver’s best restaurants, stadiums and concert venues but tucked away in a quiet safe neighborhood. The location provides quick and easy access to all of Denver. Beautiful Platt Park for the kids to play or to walk the dog 1 block away.  You'll have the space to yourself.
neighborhood_overview:
The suite is in Platt Park, which is 3 blocks from tons of unique shops, restaurants, and bars on south Broadway, and Old South Pearl St. Very walkable neighborhood.

Super close to all major public transportation and in the middle of Denver (10 min. to Downtown and 10 min. to Denver Tech Center). 1/2 mile from Washington Park and all the activities around that popular area.

Ubers/Lyfts available 24 hours/day.

5 minutes from Denver University campus.

Close to everything, yet quiet so you enjoy a great night sleep with brand new comfortable beds.
host_about:
Born and raised in Iowa, and have been living in Colorado for the past 26 years.  I enjoy hiking, skiing, working out, going to concerts, weekend getaways, and am a big sports fan.

When hosting, I try to give my guests as much space as possible. I love to give tips on where to go and where to dine in order to give my guests an amazing experience that they may not otherwise have.  So please, ask me questions! I would love to help you.

name: The Garden at Alamo-Placita
description: Small but comfortable socially-distant garden-level studio apartment with full bath and kitchen and private entrance.

Location, Location, Location
Fabulous newly constructed carriage house in the middle of the city! This one bed, one bath town home has radiant floor heat and air conditioning and it includes a full kitchen with dishes, utensils, pots and pans. You are able to walk to the capital, convention center (1 mile), 16th St. mall and various restaurants. You will be pleasantly surprised with how quiet the carriage house is considering the proximity to the city! We are 420 friendly, but outdoors only!

name: Private Guest Suite in the Heart Of Denver
description:
Fully private studio in Capitol Hill. You have your own entrance with keypad, and the unit is completely separate. Central location, close to downtown, concert venues and cool dining options. Huge private patio is the perfect spot for a morning coffee or an evening smoke :-)
We allow small pets (25 pounds or less). Please note when booking, a $25 dollar pet fee will be collected at check in.
neighborhood_overview: Capital Hill is an amazing neighborhood!  Packed with quirky shops, eateries, dispensaries and bars. We rarely drive, as there are plenty of walkable options combined with Uber, Lyft, and a decent public transportation system.   Plenty of Lime and Lyft scooters along with bikes that you can use to navigate the neighborhood. We have several restaurants, bars, dispensaries, grocery stores, and music venues within blocks of our home. See our "guides" for more options!
host_about:
Hi!  It's Chris & Luis.  We're married for 3 years now and loving life in Denver.  We're avid travelers, fans of live music, improvisation, theater, biking and WINE :-)

name: NEW! Unit in Historic Mansion.  Location! Views!
description:
NEW! Amazing fourth floor of historic downtown mansion. Stunning views, light, and huge private porch for enjoying the city, mountains, and sunset views. Large, cozy, old world bedroom with beautiful windows, light, and views. Large dining table and area for enjoying an elegant meal.
Imagine spending evenings on the porch watching the sun set, then walking around the corner to one of many restaurants or bars. Hop on your bike and be at the 16th Street Mall or many museums in minutes.

name: Beautiful Condo in the heart Downtown Denver!
description: The Best location in downtown Denver!! Easy access to just about anything you might want to enjoy in our wonderful city.  Just 2 blocks from the Denver Convention Center makes it a perfect location for business or pleasure. With access to both the light rail and the 16th Street Mall ride across the street you can get to just about anywhere in Denver you would like to go.
neighborhood_overview:
Denver central business district has everything you might ever need or want.
2 Blocks from the Colorado Convention Center, 1 block from the Denver Pavilions, 4 blocks to the Denver Performing Arts Complex.
Take the 16th Street Mall ride (free) to Union Station, Larimer Square, Coors Field, State Capital, University of Colorado Denver. Also a short light rail ride or uber to DIA (Denver International Airport) Mile High Stadium, Pepsi Center and Elitich Gardens.


Quick access to all of Denver's best restaurants including The Kitchen, Urban Farmer, Capital Grill, Giordano's, Ocean Prime, Jax, Guard and Grace, Citzen Grill, Sam's #3, Milk Market, Snooze, The Source and many more!

Love shopping?? We are just a hop skip and jump away from H&M, Sephora, Banana Republic, Express, Famous Footwear, TJ Max, Target and many more great stores!

name: Rain Shower - Natural Light - Close to City

Beautiful private walkout next to the light rail. Lots of natural light and space in this apartment. The kitchenette has a microwave, toaster oven, induction cooktop, kettle and everything you need to cook a meal.
Bedroom has a comfortable queen bed and blackout blinds.
Bathroom is luxurious with a rain shower (everyone’s favorite!)

Red Rocks: 20 minutes

name: Spacious private suite Wash Park lakeview home
description:
Enjoy one of Denver's most lovely neighborhoods, just steps from locals' favorite park.
Expansive unit on main level of home. Includes full kitchen & breakfast nook, living & dining room, 2 attached bedrooms and sunroom. 2nd Airbnb on lower level (Kiwi Suite). Each private with its own entry. Common areas are laundry room & side yard. Host lives in apartment-like quarters down hall from guests* and is available upon request.

* Denver Airbnb regulations require host to live on property .
neighborhood_overview: Classic Washington Park neighborhood.  Stately historic homes. Canopy of over 100 year old trees in a peaceful, quiet area.  Within walking distance to Old South Gaylord, South Pearl Street coffee shops and restaurants, including the Bonnie Brae Ice Cream. Park, lake, sports and leisure activities offered in Washington Park, including  swimming at "Wash Park" Recreation Center located 2 blocks away. Pedal  boat and canopy bike rentals available in spring and summer months at Smith Lake as viewed from your Airbnb. Easy access to I-25 and the Rocky Mountains.
host_about: I'm the homeowner and  Denver, local, resident of 35+ years. I opened up sharing my home to Airbnb guest from all over the world going on 5 yrs. I love giving to others & interaction with people, although my number one priority for my guest is privacy. Hosting is an honor & privilege. I'm a daughter, grandmother and friend.  I welcome you to stay at my Spacious Lake View Home in the true spirit of Denver Hospitality!  best, olivia

host_about:
My family and I started hosting on Airbnb from our 2 bedroom home in downtown Napa California in 2015. 

A close friend was undergoing medical treatments, and because we did not have a lot of money, we decided to rent out our house (and stay on his couch) for the weekend of a now famous music festival. 

The weekend was a huge success, the guests had an amazing time, we made new friends, and our friend got the money for his medical treatment. After that we were hooked!

Since 2015, we have lived the goodness everyday that hosting people can generate. We have now hosted thousands of visitors in properties around the country that we either own renovated and manage, or have helped others renovate and/or manage.

Our family works extremely hard to provide our guests a luxury experience (at a price point for everyone) by combining perfect accommodations, unrivaled service plus concierge access to the local area. 

We love hosting weekend getaways, large groups for Bachelor/Bachelorette parties, extended stays for traveling professionals. Anyone with goodness in their heart are always welcome at any of our homes.

We have a small staff that helps answer any question 24/7, but we're a very small family company with a passion for providing an incredible guest experience.

We look forward to hosting you!
Cheers- Christian (big bro) + Shannon and John (little bro) + Lauren (VentureBNB)

name: *French Consulate Historic Mansion/Den-King/1900s*
description:
Perfect home to work, and vacation from. Located in The HEART of Denver! Strict cleaning measures in place!

Welcome inside this luxury-classic, one of a kind historic property's. Conveniently located in Denver's DOWNTOWN, next to the Governor's Mansion & Park. If you are attending a wedding, traveling w/friends, family, or with colleagues, stay in the BEST of Denver!

*PLEASE NOTE: The Mansion is split into 2 separate homes.
The entire LARGE 3rd & part 2nd floor is for the Airbnb, 3,500 sqft.
neighborhood_overview:
The former French Consulate Mansion, Denver’s #34 Awarded Historic Landmark, converted into two separate-private homes, This private section includes a total of 5 bedrooms, located on the 2nd & 3rd floor of the mansion. This section comes with the best views of the Rocky Mountains and directly across the Grant-Humphreys Mansion. We are located in the heart of Downtown Denver. There is plenty to keep you entertained right at your doorstep, including amazing restaurants, bars and coffee shops, and the best of shopping inside the cherry creek mall as well as an amazing outside mall with local boutiques:

Grant–Humphreys Mansion-- "In Denver, Colorado, was built in 1902, in the Neoclassical style of architecture by Boal and Harnois, for James Benton Grant following his one term as the third Governor of Colorado."
This is a popular local wedding and conference venue that is simply across the street from the French Consulate. If you are looking to recommend high-quality acco
host_about:
We love sight seeing architecture and design around the world.

Soo excited to be a part of this community and provide travelers this wonderful timepiece historic home. 

Would love to know more about you, we very much look forward to hosting you, and to share this beautiful, uniquely one-of-a-kind property with you and your group.

This suite is located in the front half of our owner occupied home. We live on the backside of the house. Locking French doors separate the two spaces. You have complete privacy with a separate entrance, but may hear us occasionally.

There are plenty of great places to grab a bite, there’s also a gym, a community center, as well as other great Colorado amenities located nearby.

name: Congress Park Carriage House
description: Welcome to your cozy carriage house in Denver's popular Congress Park neighborhood.  Perfect for a vacation or business trip.  Our private, fully furnished space offers comfortable amenities with restaurants and coffee shops just steps from the front door.  The space is minutes from Downtown Denver and just a few blocks to many famous Denver sites such as the restaurants and music venues of Colfax, City Park, Cheesman Park, Congress Park and Cherry Creek North neighborhood and shopping mall.
neighborhood_overview: Congress Park is a beautiful, established neighborhood in Denver.  The carriage house is close to so many Denver attractions.  City Park, the Natural History Museum, Denver Zoo,  Denver Botanic Gardens, Cheesman ParkThe Bluebird on Colfax, The Ogden, The Fillmore music venues and the Cherry Creek North shopping district and mall.  With events in these locations throughout the year.  There is a Starbucks, Einsteins Bagel, Falafel King and a few bars just 1 block from the space.  In addition, Snooze and Trader Joe's are just across the street and Tag Burger bar and the cutest ice cream shop are about 5 blocks from the house.

name: Studio near Broncos Stadium
description:
We have a self check-in, and the only shared area is the front door.

Brand new spacious, bright and charming basement unit. Walk to Broncos stadium and great bars and restaurants while enjoying the peaceful surroundings of a neighborhood.
Incredible location in Jefferson Park with a walking score of 86! Walk or quick Uber to the Lower Highlands, 32nd street, and Tennyson.
Hard wood floors
10 foot ceilings
500 square feet

Ask me about the Jeep Wranglers and a Honda Accord available for rent
neighborhood_overview:
Walking score of 86! Jefferson Park is a charming and historical neighborhood just outside downtown. It is home to Empower Field, where the Denver Broncos play and host other events, as well as the Denver Aquarium, and Children’s Museum. It is a block from Briar Commons Brew Pub and Awake Coffee, two blocks from 2914 Coffee, Sexy Pizza, El Cazo (upscale Mexican), Jefferson Park Pub, Santiago’s, and Safeway.
Half mile from the Lower Highlands (Linger, El Five, Little Man Ice Cream, Postino, Avanti, Prost Brewery etc.)
There is a scooter spot on the corner and the studio is one block away from major bus stops.
Less than a mile away from the Pepsi Center and 1.4 miles from Coors Field.
Two miles from the heart of downtown. Uber rides to downtown are about $5-$10 depending on the location and time.
host_about: I moved to Denver four years ago from Texas and I love it.  Let me know if you would like recommendations around this area!

Welcome to Sunny Side! Newly remodeled 1 bedroom basement apartment minutes from downtown, Rino Art District, LOHI, Coorsfield & much more. All brand new appliances! Kickback watching your favorite Netflix show or enjoy a cup of coffee on your own private covered patio. Eating out? We got you covered with some of Denver's best only blocks away. Equipped with a private side entrance and well lit walkway. Your home away from home.
2019-BFN-0009646
neighborhood_overview: Blocks from Chaffee Park, and multiple renowned local eateries such as Bacon Social, Sunny's, Pepper Asian Bistro, Huckleberry Roasters, NECIO and The Wolf's Tailor recently named one of America's 10 best new restaurants by Bon Appetit.
host_about: I am a hard working professional who loves to travel the world and see new places. I live in Denver Colorado and adore the mountains. Ski, hike, camping, sign me up! I have an adorable five year old lab named Oscar.

name: Updated home in vibrant five points neighborhood - walk to downtown denver
description: Immerse yourself in Denver's historic and highly-desirable 5 Points neighborhood, in our newly remodeled 2-bedroom house. Situated just north of Downtown, this house provides ideal access to everything Denver has to offer.
host_about:
Scott Hemerda is a founding principal and owner of Vacation Rental Collective (VRC), offering premier vacation rentals along the Front Range, including the greater Denver metropolitan area.  As a native Coloradoan, Scott spent his childhood in Littleton, studied at Colorado State University in Fort Collins, and raised his family in Parker. His daily commute to downtown Denver led to a love of the city in addition to his established love of the surrounding suburbs and mountains. Scott worked in financial services as the Director of Institutional Relationships for 18 years at TIAA-CREF, where he managed relationships worth 20 billion in assets. In addition to leading the top performing relationship management team, Scott supported and retained clients through challenging service model and system changes all evidence of his superior relationship management skills.
Scott married his high school sweetheart and they have three children. A lover of sports, he instilled the values of collaboration, teamwork, and good sportsmanship as a role model participating in softball and basketball and then as a coach for all of his children in their numerous activities. Scott grew up skiing and now enjoys hiking and exploring the mountains with his wife. Business trips, family vacations, and romantic getaways have cultivated his love and expertise on the needs of vacationers.

name: Southwestern Hideaway - Cool + Cozy Living
description: Fellow adventurers! Come kick off your hiking and riding boots at our newly redesigned, well-lit, renovated 1920's bungalow -  close enough to enjoy all big city Denver has to offer and only a short drive from the escape of the mountains, downtown, the RiNo Art District, Bronco or Rockies stadiums, Red Rocks, Meow Wolf, the airport, and more.
neighborhood_overview:
The neighborhood is quite diverse in many ways, both culturally and income, which is why I moved here. If you're only on foot, I recommend taking ride-shares or the bus.

River and Roads Coffee is a beautiful, friendly coffee shop that is literally just around the corner from the house. Next to coffee shop is Flux Studios, LLC. - a glass blowing and ceramics studio and gallery with classes. There is a laundromat, liquor store, and some fun restaurants and bars within walking distance.

Check out my neighborhood guide included on this listing for more details!
host_about:
Hey there! I’m a half-Danish, half-American 36-year-old transplant from Texas. I moved to Colorado in 2012 to seek adventure and work on environmental issues. Now I'm creative, writer, and visual storyteller with film and photography! You can find guided adventure/photography hikes from me on AirBnB experiences under "Guided Outdoor Adventure w/ Photography." 

I’ve been to 7-continents, and over 30 countries. I’m based in Denver and love all the outdoors has to offer, filmmaking, photography, and nature.

name: Stunning, Private Capitol Hill Carriage House
description: Stunning contemporary architecture in a stand-alone carriage house in Quality Hill Historic District. Completely furnished down to Q-Tips for your comfort, it is a hidden gem in Capitol Hill, an area right next to downtown. Very private, sunny, open plan 1 bedroom 1 bath condo has its own private patio area and a reserved parking space less than to feet from its door. Wifi, cable, flat-screen TV, Blue tooth speaker, complete kitchen with breakfast fixings make it so comfortable for you.
neighborhood_overview: Capitol Hill was the first place people moved to when what is now Lower Downtown became crowded. It has many historic districts, stately homes dating from the late 1800s to the present day, large and small parks, and unique restaurants. It is very walkable and close to B-cycle stations and bus stops to downtown and Cherry Creek. We're a mile to downtown, museums and the Convention Center.

name: Bootleg Bungalow
description: Immerse yourself in the nostalgic charm of Bootleg Bungalow, a speakeasy-inspired getaway nestled between Downtown Denver and Cherry Creek. This exclusive lower-level unit blends vintage allure with contemporary amenities, making it ideal for up to 3 guests. Enjoy a fully-equipped patio, fast WiFi, and easy access to local shops and eateries. With 420-friendly outdoor spaces and a dedicated host, your stay promises to be as relaxing as it is memorable.
neighborhood_overview:
The Bootleg Bungalow is perfect for 1-3 people who will be visiting central Denver, downtown Denver, or the Cherry Creek area for vacation, work, or visiting nearby family and friends. Located in the charming Congress Park neighborhood and the 7th Ave. Historic District, the area features eclectic, historic architecture, easy access to downtown and Cherry Creek, greenways for walking and has many popular restaurants and shops nearby. A list of some of the most popular are below:
Denver Zoo
Museum of Nature and Science
Denver Botanic Gardens
Snooze an A.M. EateryTrader Joe’s
Congress Park Taproom
Chipotle

Starbucks

TAG Burger Bar
Sienna Wine Bar & Small Plates
Barolo Grill
Cherry Creek Shopping & Dining
Colfax Ave. and the many restaurants, shops, bars/clubs, and concert venues located there
National Jewish Hospi
host_about: I grew up in Denver, CO and recently moved back after spending four years in the Cibola National Forest in New Mexico. Happy to be home though, and looking forward to creating a space where others can enjoy all that Denver and Colorado have to offer :o)

name: Peaceful Modern Apartment in Central Denver
description: Fully furnished modern garden level apartment with a private entrance. The kitchenette is equipped with everything you need to make a home-cooked meal. The bedroom nook has a queen bed with under-bed storage and  the closet houses the washer/dryer. Whole house water filter. Unit comes fully equipped with linens and cleaning supplies. Family of 4 lives in the rest of the house. No smoking or vaping. Apartment is only available for a minimum 28 day rental.
neighborhood_overview: The West Washington Park neighborhood is perfectly situated between downtown Denver and Cherry Creek for restaurants, shopping, and travelers working anywhere in Central Denver. In addition to great restaurants and retail, we are also 20 minute walk from Washington Park, great for running or cycling.
host_about: My husband and I both grew up in Colorado so we have a passion for skiing, bike riding, hiking and generally being outside. Our kiddos are 7 and 4. Kelly is a fundraiser for the University of Denver and Stephan is an architect for a local firm. Stephan designed the apartment to maximize every space for comfort and easy living. We hope you enjoy your time in Denver just that much more because of our cozy apartment.

name: The Funky Franklin | Cap Hill | Traveling Workers
description:
Stay at my newly remodeled 2 bedroom garden level apartment in Capitol Hill. Fabulous location in an historic building - -blocks from Cheesman Park, restaurants, music venues, VooDoo Donuts and more.

Funky and luxurious with all new furnishings including beds and couches. Painted concrete floors and lots of light.

New kitchen with dishwasher, microwave, coffee maker, blender and toaster.

Private outdoor space as well as larger shared outdoor area with grill.
neighborhood_overview: On quiet street near Cheesman Park.  Restaurants, bars, parks and downtown are in easy walking distance.  VooDoo donuts, on Colfax, is just one block away!
host_about: My husband and I just returned from living and traveling overseas.  We enjoyed great hospitality and are excited to return the favor!! We like to make guests feel at home but are always near if they need anything!  Just let us know!

description: Come stay at our hip little 2nd story studio space. Enjoy the Denver skyline & Rocky Mountains right outside your windows. Our studio space is brand new and accessible through our backyard with a keyless entry system. Our dogs - Jack Jack and Sophie Nacho - may welcome you but there is a gate closing in the space so they won’t be greeting you close up!
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is in the middle of the city just north of Denver's historic City Park. Our neighborhood is known as Skyland and is close to RINO (River North) &  LODO (Lower Downtown).
host_about:
Hi. And, I am super glad you are looking into coming to Denver. Here are three things I keep in my Denver rotation that I highly recommend:
1. getting a coffee at Crema on Larimer or Queen City Coffee Roasters on Welton
2. riding a bike or scooter on the South Platte River path or even just around town
3. hiking a trail in the foothills
Enjoy!

name: Sonder Zuni | Queen Studio Apartment
description: Say hello to the Mile High City at Zuni. These contemporary studios have a fully equipped kitchen, in-suite laundry, and a Roku for streaming. And you can catch a glimpse of the mountains from the rooftop terrace. Centered in the LoHi neighborhood, you'll have all the excitement of Downtown while being just far enough for a restful sleep. A short walk across the architectural Highland Arch Bridge will bring you to Commons Park where you can enjoy a day lounging in the grass or playing volleyball with friends. Don't miss a chance to stay in this inventive and innovative neighborhood.

name: Luxe City Retreat
description: Bright and vibrant during the day ~ Serene and Ambient at night! Welcome to your private home located in the Santa Fe Art District. I have 2 sons ages 16 & 20 who are professional Roller Skaters

name: Monthly Furnished Apt in Cap Hill + Free Parking
description: Looking for a comfortable and convenient living space in the heart of Denver's Capitol Hill neighborhood? Look no further than our cozy furnished one-bedroom apartment, available for long-term rent.
neighborhood_overview:
Capitol Hill is a vibrant, eclectic neighborhood located in Denver, Colorado, just southeast of downtown. It is known for its historic mansions, impressive architecture, and diverse population.

The neighborhood is bounded by Colfax Avenue to the north, Downing Street to the east, Seventh Avenue to the south, and Broadway to the west. Capitol Hill is a densely populated neighborhood with a mix of residential, commercial, and cultural offerings.

The neighborhood is home to many notable Denver landmarks, including the Colorado State Capitol building and the Molly Brown House Museum. It is also home to a variety of restaurants, bars, cafes, and shops, many of which are located along Colfax Avenue and Broadway.

Capitol Hill has a strong arts and cultural scene, with many galleries and performance venues throughout the neighborhood. It is also home to several parks and green spaces, including the popular Cheesman Park and Civic Center Park.

Welcome to your own private studio! Enjoy your stay on the top floor of a brand new complex with downtown skyline views of the city, and a large private balcony to soak it in!
A thoughtfully designed home complete with plants, natural light, high-end appliances/furniture, and city views.

I’m looking forward to hosting great people!
neighborhood_overview:
Located right in the heart of downtown RiNo (river north arts district) you are a block off of Denver’s most happening street (Larimer) filled with restaurants and bars. Enjoy a night out just blocks from your bnb with seemingly endless options for restaurants, galleries, breweries, nightclubs, and bars. No need to even bring a car or call an uber!

Just across is a 4-star boutique hotel, the Ramble. Which features two restaurants, multiple bars, and rooftop right at your fingertips!

RiNo, Denver’s hippest area itself is famous for its many breweries, contemporary art galleries, street art, and concert venues. And not to mention it’s walking proximity to downtown, LoDo, and ballpark Coors field.

Originally from Ottawa, Canada, I moved to Denver for a job and of course for the mountains.

description: This is your functional oasis designed for Long Term stays. A walkable neighborhood near coffee shops, Cheeseman Park, Whole Foods, restaurants with a dedicated parking spot for a mid-sized car, in-unit laundry, generous workspace, comfortable furnishings, and an epic black king bedroom designed through the science of sleep. neighborhood_overview: Capitol Hill is adjacent to downtown but supremely more livable and charming. There are two large grocery stores 2 blocks away, including the new Ideal Market by Whole Foods, which also has a coffee shop, beer bar, and outdoor seating. There is a children's park within walking distance.

name: High Rise Condo Downtown-Executive 30 Day Rental
description: Housed in the estimable Windsor high-rise building, gorgeous 2 bed/1 bath condominium is 1,035 sq. ft. and located in coveted downtown district.
host_about:
Scott Hemerda is a founding principal and owner of Vacation Rental Collective (VRC), offering premier vacation rentals along the Front Range, including the greater Denver metropolitan area.  As a native Coloradoan, Scott spent his childhood in Littleton, studied at Colorado State University in Fort Collins, and raised his family in Parker. His daily commute to downtown Denver led to a love of the city in addition to his established love of the surrounding suburbs and mountains. Scott worked in financial services as the Director of Institutional Relationships for 18 years at TIAA-CREF, where he managed relationships worth 20 billion in assets. In addition to leading the top performing relationship management team, Scott supported and retained clients through challenging service model and system changes all evidence of his superior relationship management skills.
Scott married his high school sweetheart and they have three children. A lover of sports, he instilled the values of collaboration, teamwork, and good sportsmanship as a role model participating in softball and basketball and then as a coach for all of his children in their numerous activities. Scott grew up skiing and now enjoys hiking and exploring the mountains with his wife. Business trips, family vacations, and romantic getaways have cultivated his love and expertise on the needs of vacationers.

name: Downtown Skyline View 19th Floor High Rise
description: Your perfect downtown getaway! Immerse yourself in the city, exploring it on foot! Nearby Denver's TOP attractions, including 16th Street Mall, LoDo, LoHi, Coors Field, Ball Arena, and Broncos Stadium at Mile High. Also within walking distance to the Denver Center for the Performing Arts, Convention Center, Denver Art Museum, Capitol Hill, 100's of restaurants, stores, bars, and more. After a long day, return to your comfy retreat and enjoy some of the best sunsets on this side of the Rockies!
neighborhood_overview:
Just one block from the 16th Street Mall and the free downtown shuttle or an easy walk to everything downtown Denver has to offer. This includes areas such as Larimer Square, Union Station, Coors Field, Pepsi Center, Mile High Stadium, Denver Center for the Performing Arts, Convention Center, Denver Art Museum, Capitol Hill, restaurants, shopping, and more. Secured building with a 24-hour doorman. Secured entrance with fob controlled elevator access.

If flying in from out of town, just take the A-Line train to Union Station and then walk to the condo.

16th St Mall - 1 Block away
Larimer Square - 4 min walk
Union Station - 6 min walk
Cherry Creek Trail (bike path) - 6 min walk
Coors Field - 8 min walk
Denver Center for the Performing Arts - 8 min walk
Convention Center - 10 min walk
Pepsi Center - 15 min walk
Empower Field at Mile High - 25 min walk
host_about:
I have a passion for travel and have explored over 40 counties. I moved to Denver 8 years ago and love all of Colorado. From day one in Denver it has had my heart. This city has a soul. 

I am thrilled to be able to share my home with the world to enjoy. It will help create memories for those of you yet to experience the city I call home. 

I have been waiting years to be able to live in my amazing building with gorgeous views from the 19th floor. I know you will love the sunsets just like I do after a long day of work or walking around our city. I run daily down by the river, which is extremely close; you will also love it.

If simple is more your speed, Starbucks is an 8-minute walk away.

Modern, private, 1 bedroom suite just blocks away from Denver's largest park, zoo, science museum and more! Only 10 minutes from downtown - ballparks, breweries, light rail, airport train - all close!

neighborhood_overview: Berkeley neighborhood is a hot spot with recreational activities, renowned restaurants and locally-owned shops. Just West of Downtown's major attractions like Union Station, Broncos Stadium and the Convention Center, it's the perfect neighborhood to experience everything that makes Denver unique without having to be IN the hustle and bustle of Downtown.  If you want to spend some time enjoying nature but don't want to venture all the way to the mountains, Berkeley Lake and Willis Case Golf Course are within walking distance, or you can jog over to Sloan's Lake and take in views of the city and the mountains.

name: Charming Baker Row House - 2 Miles from Downtown
description: Gorgeous 950 SF, 2 bedroom/1 large bathroom row house in the historic Baker neighborhood. Just blocks from the hub of the hip Broadway shopping/dining/nightlife and 2 miles from downtown Denver. Victorian character with refinished hardwood floors and formal dining room. Outside has fenced front/back yards with large deck. Forced air heat and A/C. Kitchen has refrigerator, microwave, dishwasher, and gas Viking stove top. Basement has a washer and dryer and storage. Available for 30 day+ rental.
neighborhood_overview:
Baker is one of Denver’s hippest neighborhoods. It’s known for Broadway, a bustling thoroughfare lined with vintage fashion boutiques, eclectic Asian restaurants, casual brewpubs and late-night hangouts for live music and dancing. Open since the 1930s, the art deco Mayan Theatre shows independent movies and has a popular bar. Green spaces include Phil Milstein Park, with riverside trails and picnic tables.

As soon as you stroll through the Baker Neighborhood, you notice that it is unique. The neighborhood has the largest collection of Queen Anne Middle Class homes in Denver.

Baker hosts some of the trendiest shops and dining in all of Denver. This Denver neighborhood is a frequent destination for Denver residents and beyond.

neighborhood_overview:
Eat & Drink

The Highlands has one of the highest numbers of food and beverage offerings per capita of any neighborhood in Denver. The area is home to celebrated local restaurants like Spuntino and Cart-Diver; one of the city’s first food halls, Avanti Food & Beverage; and trendy additions such as Daughter Thai Kitchen & Bar and Señor Bear.

That doesn’t mean you can’t find history here. Lechuga’s Italian Restaurant has been around since 1961, and My Brother’s Bar (add a burger to your beer order) is the city’s oldest bar—it’s been operating since 1873.

Imbibers can stroll almost anywhere in the ’hood and find plenty of venues to enjoy craft brews (Denver Beer Co.) or craft cocktails (Lady Jane, Room for Milly) or locally made spirits (Mythology Distillery, the Family Jones Spirit House) or coffee (Queensberry Coffee, Pinwheel Coffee).

Catch a Show

name: RARE! Monthly Furnished Rental in Denver RINO area
description:
Welcome to your stylish and fully furnished apartment in Denver's vibrant RiNo (River North) district! Nestled in the heart of one of the city's trendiest neighborhoods, this contemporary unit offers the perfect blend of modern comfort and urban excitement.
Tastefully furnished, this 1 bedroom 1 bath can sleep 2 guests (in Queen bed). The RiNo District is one of the most sought after neighborhoods in the US.
neighborhood_overview:
RiNo is an eclectic and vibrant neighborhood located just north of downtown Denver. It has undergone significant transformation in recent years, evolving from an industrial area into a thriving arts and cultural hub. Here are some key features of the RiNo neighborhood:

Art and Creativity: RiNo is renowned for its extensive collection of street art and murals. The area is home to numerous galleries, studios, and creative spaces, making it a haven for artists and art enthusiasts.

Craft Breweries and Distilleries: The neighborhood boasts a diverse array of craft breweries and distilleries. Beer enthusiasts can explore the many tasting rooms and taprooms that showcase the city's burgeoning craft beverage scene.

neighborhood_overview: Capitol Hill is a delightful residential district offering a unique mix of history and hip! Stroll the tree-lined streets and take in the majestic architecture of the stately old mansions. Be sure to include a visit to the iconic Molly Brown House Museum, an exquisite late 19th century Victorian home with beautiful period art and furnishings. Don't forget to admire the majestic Colorado State Capitol Building with its iconic gold-domed cupola. Shopping and nightlife are the pursuits of choice on the iconic 13th Avenue. One-of-a-kind punk-aesthetic shops, trendy bars, and cozy coffeehouses combine to create an unforgettable bohemian atmosphere for visitors and locals alike!

description: Cozy studio in-law apartment in Denver Art District close to theatre, restaurants, shopping, Union Station, Cherry Creek and the Rocky Mountains. A perfect crash pad for touristing/working in Colorado. I'm a quiet person and an early riser, and this is a space for like-minded guests. neighborhood_overview:
Denver’s Art District on Santa Fe (ADSF) is a nationally known arts and cultural district, encompassing hundreds of artists, galleries, studios, theaters, and creative businesses along Santa Fe Drive in Denver, Colorado. Founded in 2003, ADSF is a 501(c)(3), nonprofit membership organization and one of the first Certified Creative Districts in the state.

Historically anchored by pioneering spirit, ADSF has long-championed citizen creativity as a cultural crossroads of the city. Thousands visit from the Rocky Mountain region and beyond during the monthly First Friday Art Walks to experience the highest density of art galleries in the country.

While it’s name is rooted in the arts, it’s not only a creative community. The District reflects the neighborhood’s rich, cultural fabric—a symbol of its storied past and bright future. Steeped in Latino heritage and today representing a diverse population, the district aims to honor the heritage and support creativity. For
host_about: I enjoy snowboarding, hiking, camping and traveling.  I myself have have many stays around the world in Airbnb's and I want to share my space to like minded respectful travelers.

name: Washington Park Bungalow with hot tub!
description: One of the nicest neighborhoods in Denver, this dog-Friendly ($20 per dog per night extra) bungalow is just two blocks from the very popular Washington Park. Relax and enjoy this spacious unit. Just a short uber/Lyft ride from downtown and walking distance to restaurants, bars, and shopping. This is the perfect place for a weekend getaway or business trip.  You have a very nice restaurant (Blackbird) within 20 steps and a Starbucks right across the street!
neighborhood_overview: Washington park is one of the most desirable neighborhoods in Denver. The housing prices are high and the park itself is huge and is the nicest and most popular park in the city. The easy access to a variety of restaurant options make the location top notch. The variety of activities that the neighborhood offers provides guests a chance to stay busy while providing a laid back environment all at the same time. The location 5-10 min. from downtown is also very convenient and appealing.

name: New Modern Townhouse in the RiNo Art District
description:
This brand new beautiful townhouse is centrally located in the River North Art District. Home to many bars, restaurants, art galleries, brewpubs, and more. You’re a quick walk from some of Denver’s top restaurants and breweries as well as downtown.

The townhome was built in 2020 and you will enjoy 2 bedrooms & 2.5 bathrooms - including a large soaking tub, lots of natural light and a fully equipped kitchen. You can also make use of the 50” TV, Nespresso, and in-unit washer & dryer.
neighborhood_overview:
The River North Arts District is home to some of Denver's best restaurants, bars, breweries, cafes, and art galleries! The buildings in the neighborhood are home to many beautiful murals and it's easy to walk or scooter from place to place.

Some of my personal neighborhood favorites are: Safta, Honey Elixir Bar, Improper City, Lekker Cafe, Cart Driver, and Bellota.

neighborhood_overview: Skyland is adjacent to City Park and a handful of budding northeast neighborhoods, this square of land—and its established bungalows and Tudors—often gets lost in the conversation. It feels like a place yet to be discovered, but you may want to take a look sooner rather than later. The transitioning neighborhood’s location combined with homes hovering around the $525,000 mark it as an up-and-comer. Though there isn’t much to speak of in terms of shopping or feasting, Skyland is surrounded by bike lanes and its borders enclose the public City Park Golf Course, which reopened in 2020.

description: This private cozy guest suite with separate entrance is the perfect spot for solo travelers, couples, or friends looking to explore Colorado. Located just a half block from City Park, and within walking distance to the Denver Zoo, Museum of Nature and Science, and Botanical Gardens! Downtown is just 2 miles away and Red Rocks Amphitheater is only 30 minutes away. We provide all the essentials for a comfortable stay. So come enjoy all that Colorado has to offer with our home away from home!
neighborhood_overview:
Our house is located in a quiet residential neighborhood adjacent to what is arguably Denver’s best park, the 314-acre City Park. Here you’ll find the Denver Zoo, 14 tennis courts, a lake with boat rentals, the Denver Museum of Nature & Science, Jazz in the Park (on summer Sundays) and the newly renovated 18-hole City Park golf course. The Denver Botanical Gardens is located just over a mile away.

Houses, from slightly weathered Victorians to newer condos, are peppered throughout the neighborhood. A large portion of City Park West’s north end is taken up by hospitals and medical centers; to the south, East 17th and East Colfax avenues are busy commercial corridors that draw people of all ages to their buzzing blocks.
host_about: My wife Shannon and I live in Denver with our golden retriever Oakley. We enjoy hiking and exploring the City and love designing spaces that give our guests a comfortable landing spot for their own adventures!

name: Regis Cottage
description: Regis Cottage with super comfortable Queen Bed's, full kitchen, 65" smart TV, and Wi-Fi . Located in a quiet neighborhood within steps of Regis University, and the breweries, restaurants, coffee shops and boutiques on Lowell & Tennyson Street. Downtown Denver is just 5 miles away, 15 min drive to Red Rocks, perfect location with EZ access to all major roads including less then 1 mile to I-70, I-25, & Hwy 36! This home has 2 window A/C unit's on the upper level.
neighborhood_overview:
Pastel-hued the Noshery is the highlight here, with a menu of pastries (the coffee cake is a standout) and breakfast and lunch sandwiches. El Taco Veloz slings crave-able tacos; 5280’s food editors are especially fond of filling theirs with nopales (cactus). 

Goldspot Brewing Company taps new beers every couple of weeks. Expect to find classic varieties as well as more unique spins and creative collaborations, like the Pink Boots Juicy IPA, which was brewed with Five Points’ Jagged Mountain Craft Brewery and incorporates peach, orange, and banana flavors. 

Get Outside 

Willis Case Golf Course is a favorite among golfers for its mountain views—particularly off the first tee—and the variability of each hole, making it more challenging than other city courses. name: 1BR in a Small house with a great location
description:
Small house in a great location. Depending on how far you like to walk, I'm walking distance to RINO, Coors Field, the Denver Zoo, City Park and more. If you don't like to walk, then it's a short uber ride. The bedroom is no frills, queen bed with closet. Work place available on request. Back yard is a work in progress.

I travel a lot so chances are you will have this house to yourself.
host_about:
Hello all.  I recently retired from the Army and moved back to Colorado.  I was station here about midway throughmy career and made it a goal to gwt back. I'm an extrovert and prefer grabbing a beer downtown as opposed to the house.   Originally from NYC, I'm an Army brat and was given the opportunity to grow up overseas.  Heidelberg Germany, to be specific.  Since then traveling has become my way of life.  I just hit my 40th country with lots more to go.  My international travel took a hit when after 17 years of living abroad, I moved back the states and discovered there's a whole lot of exploring to do in this country.   I maintain my season pass to the Vail resorts and used to be a ski instructor at Keystone.  I'm just getting into the hosting thing as we'll see how that goes.  Like many things, I wonder why I didn't start this years ago.  I hope to hear from you.

Jp to

description:

host_about:
Hundreds of guests hosted and all great reviews!  We welcome ALL with open arms. All religions, nationalities, genders.  We've recently added a Pack and Play to make my listings to be more family friendly and we have great Internet and work space for your business trips - let me know how I can make your Denver experience unforgettable!  

We love to travel and have been all around the world.  We've been hosting through Airbnb for over 7 years now and I also volunteer to host international guests in my home for a month or more at a time.  We're very professional and clean - we think there are certain standards of hospitality and being a guest that everyone should follow, which basically stems from respect for yourself and others.

We're big on communication and am happy to help you make your stay in Denver memorable - from the check in process to restaurant reservations.  We can accommodate special requests like an airport pick up or a pre-stocked refrigerator if you'd like.   Let me know how I can help!

name: No. 4 Red Trolley Place
description:
Vibrant location in the heart of Denver's Highlands neighborhood. Surrounded by exceptional dining, this light and airy apartment is a quick trip to anywhere in Denver; Empower Field at Mile Hi, Ball Arena and Downtown Denver are all minutes away and connections to the airport and the mountains are a breeze.

Apartment has a workspace and is a terrific place for remote workers.
neighborhood_overview:
Victorian-era homes and buildings; lush gardens and parks; hip independently owned shops; art galleries; and restaurants, all make the Denver Highlands neighborhood a great destination for visitors.

Boutiques, wine shops and bookstores, as well as popular restaurants and bars radiate out from Highland Square on West 32nd Avenue and Lowell Boulevard. And, in the Tennyson Street Cultural District, you can spend an afternoon browsing antique prints, photographs and paintings from Colorado artists, plus find live music venues and great international foods. LoHi is characterized by a mix of old and ultra-modern architecture, some of the city's most innovative restaurants and bars and incredible views of the Highland Bridge and downtown Denver.

name: Modern & Sleek Schafer Park Guest Home
description: This quaint and beautifully designed studio space has everything you need for your stay in Denver. Centrally located and sitting directly next to Schafer Park, our home is the perfect blend of comfort and location.  Thanks to our proximity to Denver's main thoroughfare you will be a quick transport to downtown, the airport and the mountains.
host_about:
Welcome to our page! 

We are a hospitality and property management company dedicated to guest experience, fast response times, property cleanliness and an overall seamless and enjoyable stay for our guests. 

We manage everything from luxurious homes to affordable, yet value driven properties. Whether you want to explore the mountains in Colorado, soak up the sun in South Florida or look for longer term stays for business travels, our portfolio has a diverse set of properties in locations nationwide. 

Each property is fully stocked with items such as linens, kitchenware, everyday house hold items and more. Our team is constantly auditing our properties and performing quality control checks to ensure we have everything just right for your stay. Our cleaning partners dedicate themselves to thorough and detailed cleans that match the standard of 5-star hotels. 

Things do happen from time to time and when they do we are right here to answer any questions or concerns. We respond quickly and have a 24-hour response team in those rare emergencies. 

Lastly, hospitality is our number one focus. We are here to answer your questions, guide you through your stay and take care of anything you need.  We want you to have a memorable experience that keeps you choosing us for you next travel adventure!

It’s also home to two well-performing schools, including McAuliffe International.

name: Stylish and Comfortable Home | Heart of Denver
description:
This updated historic house is conveniently located with an easy drive to attractions in and around Denver. Walkable to cafes, bars and restaurants on Broadway. Located in the charming neighborhood of Baker.

Enjoy shuffleboard in the living room, foosball and arcade pong in the basement, walk three blocks to the scenic Cherry Creek bike/run trail, drive 5 min to the Denver Performing Arts District, and 25 mins to Red Rocks Amphitheater. Driveway parking available for one car. .
neighborhood_overview:
Welcome to the centrally located, but chill and laid back neighborhood of Baker; one of the most sought after locations in all of Denver! The area boasts unique, colorful, historic houses with lush, quirky gardens. Running alongside Baker is Broadway, a thriving area full of cafes, bars, movie theaters, hip bowling alleys, stores, restaurants, and so much more!

Walk to bars and restaurants on Broadway. Take the bike route by the front door 3 blocks to the scenic Cherry Creek bike/run trail.

host_about:
Welcome to our page! 

We are a hospitality and property management company dedicated to guest experience, fast response times, property cleanliness and an overall seamless and enjoyable stay for our guests. 

We manage everything from luxurious homes to affordable, yet value driven properties. Whether you want to explore the mountains in Colorado, soak up the sun in South Florida or look for longer term stays for business travels, our portfolio has a diverse set of properties in locations nationwide. 

Each property is fully stocked with items such as linens, kitchenware, everyday house hold items and more. Our team is constantly auditing our properties and performing quality control checks to ensure we have everything just right for your stay. Our cleaning partners dedicate themselves to thorough and detailed cleans that match the standard of 5-star hotels. 

Things do happen from time to time and when they do we are right here to answer any questions or concerns. We respond quickly and have a 24-hour response team in those rare emergencies. 

Lastly, hospitality is our number one focus. We are here to answer your questions, guide you through your stay and take care of anything you need.  We want you to have a memorable experience that keeps you choosing us for you next travel adventure!

name: Capital Hill's Cozy Cottage by Richard
description: Our home is located in Denver's vibrant Capital Hill neighborhood with easy access to all areas of the city and nearby Colorado sights. Capital Hill is home to a cross-section of people with a a rich ethnic diversity and every economic level. You'll have the master bedroom with ample light, a desk, and TV . If there are 3 or 4 in your group, the secondary bedroom is available. You'll have access to Wi-FI throughout. You must be fully vacinated to stay here! Access to the hot tub is now available
neighborhood_overview: Capital Hill in Denver is wonderful because of it's walkability and ease of getting around on foot, by bike, scooter, bus or Lift, etc. Join me for a dogwalk to Cheeseman Park in the early mornings and evenings. Then there are restaurants, bars and taverns, convenient grocery stores, and other shops and stores nearby. People are friendly and helpful and will actually talk to you if approached. We have a great mix of people: middle class, the wealthy in the highrises, all ethnicities and a large population of LGBTQ folks, all making for the most diverse and interesting neighborhood in Denver.
host_about: I've been a teacher all my adult life starting out with the Peace Corps in Thailand teaching English as a Foreign Language and then working for a private company teaching the same subject at a military school in Saudi Arabia. I did the same at Bridge English, a private language school in Denver for almost 30 years. Today I teach business executives online in Latin America. I work exclusively with these students teaching business English.

name: City Park Casita / Walk To Eats, Brews, Park, More
description: Dreaming of Denver? You’re not alone! Our outstanding updated carriage house is the perfect Mile High home base. Located two blocks from City Park, Denver Zoo and the Museum of Nature and Science, this space has all the comforts of home. Pack light and live like a local in a hip space complete with full kitchen, washer/dryer and amazing queen bedroom. Walk to Colfax eateries and nightlife, Denver Botanic Garden and other top-shelf attractions. Downtown, RiNo and more are a short Uber ride away!
neighborhood_overview:
City Park West

Our neighborhood gets its name from the nearby 314-acre park, which is also the home of the adorable residents at the Denver Zoo. You’ll see plenty of locals commuting — by bike and car — between the city’s west side and downtown. To the south, East 17th and East Colfax avenues are bustling cultural corridors that draw people of all ages to their buzzing blocks.

Weathervane Cafe, Onefold, or Syrup are all wonderful places to start your day, since they all open early. At lunchtime, check out Dos Santos, Illegal Pete’s, or Atelier by Radex. Not full yet? Pho & Bar or Mile High Hamburger Mary’s should do the trick. For a pick-me-up, swing by Doppio Coffee or St. Mark’s Coffeehouse, which has a fabulous back patio.

It’s easy to find a tasty libation in this neighborhood. Vine Street Pub & Brewery serves Mountain Sun Pub & Brewery pints. Irish Snug is stocked with more than 70 whiskeys. Thin Man Tavern is known for its house-infused vodkas. An

name: Stunning Updated Home Steps From City Park
description: Located in the heart of Denver you'll be a stone’s throw away from award winning restaurants, bars, clubs, shops, and landmarks when you stay in this updated and tastefully designed house. Within walking distance to Denver's largest park, City Park, Denver Zoo, The Nature & Science Museum and newly designed City Park Golf Course. We provide one complimentary in-stay clean! Come and enjoy the best the city has to offer in this unbeatable and walkable location.
host_about:
Welcome to our page! 

We are a hospitality and property management company dedicated to guest experience, fast response times, property cleanliness and an overall seamless and enjoyable stay for our guests. 

We manage everything from luxurious homes to affordable, yet value driven properties. Whether you want to explore the mountains in Colorado, soak up the sun in South Florida or look for longer term stays for business travels, our portfolio has a diverse set of properties in locations nationwide. 

Each property is fully stocked with items such as linens, kitchenware, everyday house hold items and more. Our team is constantly auditing our properties and performing quality control checks to ensure we have everything just right for your stay. name: Modern, 2 Bed/1 Bath Lower Unit on The Front Range
description: Kick back and relax in this calm, stylish space. 20 min from downtown Denver and 20 min from Red Rocks makes this place centrally located to access the best of both downtown shenanigans and the mountains. neighborhood_overview:
The home sits directly in the middle of a condominium community. It is family friendly and close to many nearby dining and shops.

Back Story: This property was originally built in the early 1900's as a farmhouse surrounded by several acres of ranch and agricultural land. It has undergone several rennovations and updates over the years to keep its improvements modern. In the 1980's the surrounding land was sold and developed into privately owned condominiums which still stand today. Because of this homes' location, it was grandfathered-in to all amenities shared by the surrounding complex. This includes a clubhouse, pool, tennis courts and a grassy park/BBQ area.
host_about: I'm a professional Property Manager and Real Estate Investor, living and working in the Denver, CO area. I was introduced to the Airbnb platform while traveling through Iceland/Norway in 2016 and have been welcoming guests from everywhere to my properties ever since!

Welcome to the vibrant Whittier neighborhood in Denver, Colorado, where historic charm meets modern amenities. This cozy short-term rental property is nestled in a prime location, just a stone's throw away from the trendy River North Arts District (RiNo) and the expansive greenery of City Park.

Neighborhood Highlights:

Arts and Culture in RiNo: Immerse yourself in the artistic atmosphere of RiNo, known for its eclectic murals, galleries, and creative spaces. With numerous art studios, craft breweries, and hip restaurants, this neighborhood is a haven for those seeking a dynamic cultural experience.

City Park: Nature enthusiasts will appreciate the proximity to City Park, Denver's largest park. Enjoy leisurely strolls around Ferril Lake, picnics on the grassy lawns, and outdoor activities. The park also hosts various events and festivals throughout the year.

host_about:
Scott Hemerda is a founding principal and owner of Vacation Rental Collective (VRC), offering premier vacation rentals along the Front Range, including the greater Denver metropolitan area.  As a native Coloradoan, Scott spent his childhood in Littleton, studied at Colorado State University in Fort Collins, and raised his family in Parker. His daily commute to downtown Denver led to a love of the city in addition to his established love of the surrounding suburbs and mountains. Scott worked in financial services as the Director of Institutional Relationships for 18 years at TIAA-CREF, where he managed relationships worth 20 billion in assets. In addition to leading the top performing relationship management team, Scott supported and retained clients through challenging service model and system changes all evidence of his superior relationship management skills.
Scott married his high school sweetheart and they have three children. A lover of sports, he instilled the values of collaboration, teamwork, and good sportsmanship as a role model participating in softball and basketball and then as a coach for all of his children in their numerous activities. Scott grew up skiing and now enjoys hiking and exploring the mountains with his wife. Business trips, family vacations, and romantic getaways have cultivated his love and expertise on the needs of vacationers.

neighborhood_overview:
Athmar Park is a hidden gem with a friendly, multicultural vibe. Walkable attractions include Chain Reaction Brewing Company (0.5 miles), beautiful Huston Lake Park (0.7 mi) and expansive Ruby Hill Park/Levitt Pavilion (1.4 mi). Huston Lake Park features mountain views, tennis and pickleball courts, a playground and a mile-long paved path around the water — also popular for fishing. In the warmer months Levitt Pavilion offers free concerts.

The area has amazing international food including Latin, Vietnamese and Chinese. This is a paradise for taco and pho-lovers alike. For more Asian flavors, check out Star Kitchen's weekend dim sum. More into pancakes, pizza or burgers? There's a huge range of cuisine options nearby including Joy Hill, Atomic Cowboy and The Brutal Poodle. Nearby Broadway is home to a huge array of bars/clubs and Denver music institutions including Hi-Dive, The Roxy and Herman's Hideaway. No matter your taste, there's no shortage of relaxation, food or fun.

neighborhood_overview: The River North Art District "where art is made" goes by the nickname of "RiNo" and has even adopted a rhino design for its official logo, so look for creative rhinos in art and signage all around the neighborhood! The district's interesting blend of urban charm and unique industrial revival makes it a great destination for visitors. Historic warehouses and factories now house jazz bars, restaurants, brewpubs, art galleries and working studios. RiNo boasts a diverse mix of creative businesses ranging from visual artists, designers and furniture makers, to craft distillers and brewers, winemakers, creators of unique outdoor gear and small-batch coffee roasters. The art definitely extends beyond gallery walls in this neighborhood, with its colorful and innovative street art murals in alleys and on buildings around almost every corner!

neighborhood_overview:
The home is technically located in the College View neighborhood, but it is tantalizingly close to Englewood. Skip the bustle of Denver’s more populous neighborhoods for an evening exploring its local-favorite suburban neighbor. Here, you’ll find all the cultural aspects of a city center: delicious dining options, low-key happy hours, live music venues, integrated and innovative museums, and sun-filled parks.

Wander diverse blocks with vibrantly colorful homes and rolling parks. Englewood and its sister neighborhoods are bike- and public-transit friendly. The C and D light-rail lines drop passengers at CityCenter Englewood, a transportation hub, where you can catch another train downtown or south to Littleton. Cyclists can access 20 miles of bike trails. The City of Englewood and RTD also operate a free shuttle named “Art.” Art runs Monday through Friday from 6:30 a.m. to 6:30 p.m., and takes riders from CityCenter to Englewood Parkway, where cafes, fast-casual eateries, and
