neighborhood_overview:
Cultures blend in historic Five Points, one of Denver's oldest and most diverse neighborhoods. The district was known as the "Harlem of the West" because it was a frequent stop for jazz greats including Billie Holiday, Louis Armstrong and Miles Davis, who played clubs like the Rossonian and the Rainbow Room. The neighborhood was also mentioned repeatedly in Jack Kerouac's "On the Road."

Today, historic Five Points' creativity and vibrancy live on in a fascinating fusion of old and new. Visitors can stop in at innovative coffeehouses and craft breweries, visit museums telling stories from the past, experience live music from all genres at independent music venues or eat at beloved soul food and barbecue institutions.

neighborhood_overview: Our home and neighborhood is accessible from the airport and downtown via the RTD, which is Denvers very nice train system.  We encourage all guest to utilize it. Excellent local brewery Seedstock is short walk or very easy scooter ride.  Sloan Lake is short distance away with excellent food and drink options. Our neighborhood is also a short train or scooter ride away from Downtown. Easy access to HWY 70, I-25, 6th and access to mountains/Red Rocks.
host_about:
I am Ryan and am originally from Manitowoc, WI, a small town on Lake Michigan about 3 hours directly north of Chicago.  I moved down to Chicago to attend DePaul University and spent about 14 years there.  My wife and I decided we needed a change and moved to Denver the summer of 2016 after a 6 week roadtrip across America.  I love going to see live music; I enjoy pretty much all types of music, but specifically blue grass, jam bands, rap/hip hop and electronica.  I try and bike as much as possible, so it has allowed me go around the city and visit all of the different neighborhoods.  I am also a Chicago sports fan and love to cheer on the Bears, Hawks, Bulls & Sox.  However, if there is any type of sporting event on, I am always down to watch. 

I am Nicole, originally from Ohio and moved to Chicago in the fall of 2010 where I met Ryan.  After almost 6 years there, we were excited to move to Denver together the summer of 2016.  I enjoy exploring the different neighborhoods and the restaurants, bars and shops within them.  I strive to live a natural and green lifestyle by making my own cleaning products and eating healthier at home.  I enjoy finding new recipes and trying them out.  I also love travelling and learning about new places and their cultures.  When I travel, I like to try to find the hidden, "untouristy" spots, which is why Airbnb is perfect for me!  I also enjoy live music and checking out new bands at different venues throughout the city with Ryan!!

Ryan and I thoroughly enjoy hosting.  We love getting to know our guests and including them in our summer bbqs, dinners and/or visits to the bars.  We are very much in love with our Catahoula dog named Bunches.  He is a very sweet dog who loves children and any kind of attention he can get.  He is a mellow dog who is potty trained and would love to meet you!  We also hope to meet you and show off our beautiful city!  Feel free to message us with any questions :)

neighborhood_overview:
Since its humble beginnings in 1863, Berkeley's Tennyson Street has continued to grow and to evolve - somehow mastering the perfect balance of casual cool through its shopping, services, attractions, and amenities for Denver visitors and residents alike.

Originally annexed as the Town of North Denver, the Berkeley neighborhood has set the stage for some of Denver's most well known names. Historic giants like Elitch's (Zoological) Gardens, whose original theatre is still located at 38th and Tennyson, helped to create the vibrant cultural landscape unique to the neighborhood and its history. Mary Elitch, the owner of Elitch's Gardens and namesake theatre, had a particular interest in developing the arts and cultural scene in the northwest Denver neighborhood. The popularity of her theatre (the first to screen movies in Denver), zoological and botanical gardens resulted in the rise of the Tennyson street car named the "Berkeley Motor", a bustling track of transportation that se

name: Clean & Comfy House * Ideal Location
description:
Welcome to my Home--it's clean, modern, comfy & quiet!

4 Bedrooms with very comfy beds (king, queen, 2 twin).
2 full Bathrooms.

Great Location: a nice & safe residential neighborhood, yet only 5 minutes to the highway (I25 & Colo Blvd), with easy access by car or public transit to downtown, DU, Cherry Creek....

Self Check-In. Driveway. Great Back Patio. Full Kitchen. Washer/Dryer. Finished Basement. A Park across the street. WIFI. 2 TVs. Walk to many nearby Stores & Restaurants....
neighborhood_overview:
*My Home is in an ideal location!

*Virginia Village is residential, with an urban vibe. It is safe & walk-able, including a night. You can easily walk to many nearby stores & restaurants.

*Directly across the street is a church, which has a nice park with a field & jungle gym.

*My Home is only 5 minutes from the highway I25-Colo Blvd Exit, yet it's also very quiet, so you can easily access all things Denver (downtown, Cherry Creek, DU...) & beyond (the mountains).

*Easy access to public transport: light rail Colorado Station (Colo Blvd. & Evans) and buses #40 & 46.
host_about:
I have 2 amazing daughters. 

I love to travel. I've been to about 50 countries. Some of my favorites are South Africa, India, Iran, Ethiopia, Namibia, Italy, Argentina, Egypt, Israel, and Burma.

I obviously enjoy learning about & experiencing different cultures; especially but not only the food.

I'm flexible & easy-going. I prefer independent, budget travel.

I'll go anywhere to see Springsteen; I've been to approximately 150 concerts.

I'm from Baltimore--go Orioles--and have lived in Denver for over 20 years. I love the sunshine & everything the mountains have to offer.

name: Brand New Modern Guest Suite I W. Colfax
description:
Welcome to Denver! Our guest suite is located in a quiet, friendly neighborhood

• Brand new row home
• Awesome living room space
• 2min walk to Perry St station (W line Light Rail)
• Fast internet
• Kitchen
• Netflix
• Private entrance
• Self Check-in
• Street Parking
• 5-15 min drive to Highlands/Tennyson/Coors Field/Downtown/RiNo

neighborhood_overview:
West Colfax is a quiet neighborhood, with the bustle of the city life and stadiums next door. You have a mix of new build that brings along the restaurants and café’s, but also the long-time residents where it is not uncommon to walk by one of their Sunday fiestas. We are located between Sloan’s Lake with a walking track, playground, paddleboard, kayaking opportunities (depending on the time of the year), and the light rail, which runs parallel to a bike path. The light rail is Union station going east, or Golden heading west. During the summer, there is the 3-8 pm Sloan’s Lake Saturday night Bazaar (3 blocks).
You can find residents enjoying a fresh pint of craft beer at Seedstock Brewery or grabbing a morning pick-me-up at Brew Culture Coffee. In addition, Paco Sanchez Park provides a space for locals to play disc golf, picnic, or bike on the Lakewood Gulch Trail.

Eat and Drink spots for consideration:
- Seedstock Brewery
- Odell Brewing Sloans Lake – (roof

name: Sunny Carriage House • 1 BR/Bath • Patio + Firepit
description: Indulge in splendor at our Sunnyside carriage home, perfect for a cozy stay with hotel-quality amenities. Enjoy a plush king bed, ensuite bathroom, air conditioning, and bright living & dining spaces. Relax in the shared outdoor area or make a quick meal in the kitchenette. Just steps away from Rocky Mountain Lake, with stunning views of the Rockies. This private unit is separate from the main house, with its own entrance. Backyard is shared with the main house. Bring your furry friend too!
neighborhood_overview:
Sunnyside is a walkable, historic neighborhood in Northwest Denver with easy access to major highways and public transportation. It has recently undergone a development resurgence, bringing in new restaurants and breweries. The area features a mix of popular local spots and new classics, including Acova, Bacon Social House, El Jefe, Los Carboncitos, Sunny's, The Wolf's Tailor, Denver Market, and Pecos Square Retail Center. Parking is ample in the neighborhood. Just a stone’s throw away from the Rocky Mountain Lake, you can take a stroll while taking in the breathtaking scenery of the Colorado Rockies.

DRIVING DISTANCES:
• i70 Highway: 2 mins

• Wheat Ridge: 7 mins
• Downtown Denver: 8 mins
• Sloans Lake: 8 mins
• Coors Field: 9 mins
• Pepsi Center: 9 mins
• Rocky Mountain Lake: 10 minute (walk)

neighborhood_overview: This unit is located in the Speer neighborhood right next to the popular South Broadway st. You will be only a few blocks away from a historic theater, and unique bars, restaurants, and music venues. The neighborhood is extremely walkable with all the entertainment and amenities within walking distance.
host_about: A fellow host and avid traveler! More often than not traveling with my husband. We're outdoor enthusiasts who love experiencing new places through great food and nature.

name: Cozy Casita—Private Suite in Athmar Park
description:
Kick back and relax in our guesthouse. Whether you need a staycation or you're wanting a weekend escape to the Denver, we want you to feel it’s your home away from home, and we're right here if you need anything.

From here, you can walk to Denver's best Latin American and Asian restaurants or stroll around Huston Lake Park (you can also stay indoors and watch movies all day—you do you!).

Your stay supports permanently affordable housing in Denver. Ask us to learn more!
neighborhood_overview:
Athmar Park is home to some of the best Latin American and Asian cuisines in Denver. Grab vegan mole enchiladas at Tarasco's or order take-out pho from New Saigon Restaurant. And don't underestimate the taco trucks! On Sunday afternoons, you're likely to see decked out cars cruising up and down Federal Blvd.

If you like walking, we are a few blocks from the Westwood neighborhood which has colorful murals and delicious treats at Cultura Chocolate. We're also a few block down from Huston Lake Park (free yoga every Monday at 6:30!)

We're super close to I-25, and you'll be 15 min or less to most places, including Downtown Denver, South Broadway, the Art District on Santa Fe, Bronco's Stadium, Meow Wolf, the Aquarium, Children's Museum, Denver Art Museum, Clyfford Still Museum, and so much more
host_about: Longtime Denverite passionate about building a more inclusive economy.

name: Fresh & Cozy Studio Guesthouse; dedicated parking
description: Lovely, detached studio carriage house in central Denver.  Clean, newly restored studio unit located on second floor above detached garage.  Enjoy coffee and meals on your elevated deck.  Access to ground-level patio.   Grounds surrounding the main house are filled with blooming gardens and peaceful ambience. Ten minutes from downtown Denver amenities (LoDo, 16th Street Mall, etc.). Walking distance to glorious Washington Park.  Neighborhood restaurants abound. Free, dedicated parking.
neighborhood_overview: The West Washington Park neighborhood is filled with charming, turn-of-the-century homes.   Neighborhood walks feature lovely architecture and many gorgeous gardens.   Washington Park itself is a huge, gorgeous asset in Central Denver, with a lake, running trails, grassy open spaces for picnics, and multiple sports fields.   Downtown Denver is minutes away, but your space feels secluded and quiet in Denver's showcase West Washington Park community.

name: Newly built guest house - baker neighborhood
description: This beautifully remodeled guest house in located in the trendy Baker neighborhood.  With a king size bed and high end amenities, you'll be sure to enjoy your time in the house.
neighborhood_overview: Baker is one of Denver's most active neighborhoods.  Perfectly located with easy access to Denver's highway system (quick drive to the mountains) and downtown Denver.
host_about:
Scott Hemerda is a founding principal and owner of Vacation Rental Collective (VRC), offering premier vacation rentals along the Front Range, including the greater Denver metropolitan area.  As a native Coloradoan, Scott spent his childhood in Littleton, studied at Colorado State University in Fort Collins, and raised his family in Parker. His daily commute to downtown Denver led to a love of the city in addition to his established love of the surrounding suburbs and mountains. Scott worked in financial services as the Director of Institutional Relationships for 18 years at TIAA-CREF, where he managed relationships worth 20 billion in assets. In addition to leading the top performing relationship management team, Scott supported and retained clients through challenging service model and system changes all evidence of his superior relationship management skills.
Scott married his high school sweetheart and they have three children. A lover of sports, he instilled the values of collaboration, teamwork, and good sportsmanship as a role model participating in softball and basketball and then as a coach for all of his children in their numerous activities. Scott grew up skiing and now enjoys hiking and exploring the mountains with his wife. Business trips, family vacations, and romantic getaways have cultivated his love and expertise on the needs of vacationers.

name: Urban Peaks & City Streets: Denver Oasis by Train
description:
🏡 Modern and brand new two-story townhome perfectly situated in the heart of Denver

🚥 Conveniently located next to I-25 and I-70, your gateway to the Rockies

🚆 A block away from the Lightrail and RTD

☕️ Walking distance to coffee shops

🌆 Less than a mile from the Highlands

🚗 Free Street Parking & Nearby Hourly Garage

So whether you’re looking to hit the slopes, catch a game, taste a new craft beer, Sunnyside Hideaway is the perfect spot for your next Colorado adventure!
neighborhood_overview:
Sunnyside, nestled in the bustling heart of Denver, is a neighborhood where charm and community spirit form the core of daily life. Known for its friendly faces and eclectic mix of historic homes and modern conveniences, this area offers residents and visitors alike a taste of suburban serenity amidst urban vibrancy.

Tree-lined streets lead the way through Sunnyside, showcasing a diverse architectural landscape that ranges from quaint bungalows to sleek, contemporary townhomes. The neighborhood's residential tranquility is complemented by bustling commercial corridors where local cafes, boutique shops, and family-run restaurants reflect the entrepreneurial spirit of the area.

Green spaces are a proud feature of Sunnyside, with parks such as Ciancio Park offering residents a grassy retreat for picnics, play, and relaxation. The community gardens dotted around the neighborhood are testament to the local passion for sustainability and urban agriculture.

description: Bright 2 bedroom 1 bath located in the RiNo Art District. Recently ranked as one of the top 10 neighborhoods in the U.S., RiNo is known for murals, craft breweries, nightlife, galleries, and food halls including Denver Central Market and The Source. From the front door you can see Barcelona, a wine and tapas bar, and Ratio, a staple Denver brewery. name: Bright, urban, modern barn loft - S. Capitol Hill
description: Bright and stylish 1 BR, 1 BA barn house 2.5 miles from downtown in a beautiful neighborhood located a few blocks from many good restaurants, bars, parks, coffee shops, and more. Lounge by the fireplace, listen to some vinyl, enjoy the plants throughout. Large patio with porch swings. Spacious bedroom with luxurious queen mattress, cotton bedding and blackout curtains. Laptop-friendly workspace plus barn doors upstairs.  Easy access to everything in Denver, but you may just choose to stay in.
neighborhood_overview:
Emerson Barn House is located within the Alamo Placita Historic District of Capitol Hill. There is beautiful architecture throughout the neighborhood dating from the late 1800s to early 1900s. We are in a very walkable neighborhood with numerous coffee shops, restaurants, breweries, shops, bars, parks, grocery stores and every service you can think of within a 15-20 minute walk. Alamo Placita Park is a block away, and the Cherry Creek hike/bike path (connected to 50+ miles of trails) can be accessed 2 blocks away. There are numerous good restaurants within a short walk away: Fruition, Angelos, Satchels on 6th, Tikka & Grill, Uncle Ramen, and more. TRVE Brewing has excellent saisons and other solid beers nearby. Pablos or Novo for coffee, or Rise and Shine for some coffee and killer biscuit fixins. Don's Club Tavern is a classic bar 2 blocks away.

Within a 15 minute drive, you can experience just about everything Denver has to offer: Downtown Denver (2.5 miles), Meow Wolf |
host_about: A native Floridian, I moved to California in 2008 to explore sustainability and experience the adventure of a new place - and to chase the woman that eventually became my wife :). I unexpectedly ended up staying 12 years, earning a masters degree in urban planning from SJSU, launching a nonprofit called Garden to Table that focused on local food system development, and helping launch a company called Public Space Authority that focused on developing, programming, and studying public spaces. I also became a master gardener in California during this time, and have since completed the course in Colorado as well - each property reflects this knowledge and will always be adding more plants to the landscape. In 2020, I left my job as COO of a successful company to take care of my 2 kids, and we decided to move our family to Denver, CO to focus on raising our kids with our closest friends. After 9 years of saving money living in a tiny home (<700 sq ft) with 2 kids and dog, we finally took the plunge and bought our home in Denver with a rental property in the back, and a small house in Saint Augustine, FL, which is our home base for staying connected to our Florida family - where all our parents, siblings, and the vast majority of our extended family live. Prior to setting up our own Airbnbs, we used the platform extensively, traveling all over the country and many parts of the world. Being on the hosting side has been a real treat - as we have been able to take all the experiences we have had over many years of travel and put them in both of our rentals, which we are constantly tinkering with and improving. If you come back again, you will notice little touches inside and out. We are constantly working to improve the things we can control. We are also travelers, foodies, and people that love the outdoors. Ask for recommendations and we are happy to share what we have learned.

name: South Broadway Getaway with Patio
description: Stay in the heart of Denver's South Broadway neighborhood at our beautiful 2 bed/1 bath house. Enjoy easy access to Denver's top bars, restaurants, coffee shops, and more. Explore downtown Denver by walking, biking, or scootering from our convenient location with one onsite alleyway parking spot available. The best part? We take care of all cleaning tasks as part of our cleaning fee, leaving you with more time to relax and enjoy your stay. Book now for an unforgettable visit to Denver!
neighborhood_overview:
Our location on the edge of Denver's Baker and South Broadway neighborhoods, between Broadway and Lincoln, offers the best of both worlds. Baker, known for its beautiful architecture and laid-back vibe, boasts a range of independent businesses including coffee shops, restaurants, bars, and boutiques. Meanwhile, South Broadway is a vibrant and dynamic area with a lively nightlife scene, unique shops and boutiques, and plenty of artistic flair.

Foodies will love the wide range of culinary options available in South Broadway, while Baker is particularly known for its international flavors and innovative cuisine. You'll have no problem satisfying any craving with VooDoo Donuts, Postino's Wine Bar, Atomic Cowboy, and Cochino taco all within walking distance. For entertainment, the Mayan Theater and live music venues are just a short walk away.

With easy access to downtown Denver and other popular neighborhoods, our location is perfect for those looking to experience
host_about:
My husband and I live in Denver, CO and have been hosting on AirBnb since 2020. Our goal is to offer a safe and comfortable space for guests to call home during your visit.

We pride ourselves in being easy to communicate with and responsive to all inquiries and requests, making the booking process seamless. 

Whether you're visiting Denver for business or pleasure, we will make sure that you have everything you need for an unforgettable stay.

neighborhood_overview:
Welcome to Denver! Our home is technically located in the Regis neighborhood, but its proximity to highway access and other hip neighborhoods is really the attraction here. We are minutes from I-70 West, which takes you straight into the mountains for skiing, hiking, mountain towns and other adventures.

Just five minutes away is Berkeley and its main drag, the Tennyson Street Cultural Arts District. Tennyson is a walkable locale packed with cute shops, mouthwatering local eats, delicious brews and quirky entertainment venues.

15 minutes to the South-east you will find Downtown Denver -- Coors Field, Larimer Street, the Denver Performing Arts Center, indoor mini golf, axe throwing, breweries galore. The list goes on and on! This city has attractions to delight every type of traveler.

neighborhood_overview:
This bright and sunny loft is perfectly positioned near 3 of Denver's most popular restaurant/bar/art districts (RiNo, LoDo, and Five Points). The loft provides easy access to more than 30 restaurants and bars, but is just far enough away to be peaceful and quiet. The walk from RiNo into downtown has become one of the highlights of a stay in Denver, thanks to the large murals that brighten the walls of this art district, and our home is in the perfect position to access it all. Public transportation is only blocks away, but a nice walk or e-scooter will probably be all you need.

This central area in Denver provides easy access to major highways, 10 min Coors Field and Mission Ballroom, 25 min to Red Rocks.

description: Enjoy all Denver has to offer from your private studio located in Congress Park. name: Adorable Berkeley Guest Suite - Walk to Tennyson!
description: Keep it simple and peaceful at this adorable Berkeley private guest suite. Completely private entrance to your 1bed/1bath unit with fully stocked kitchenette. Centrally located, walking distance to Tennyson St, Berkeley Park, and close access to I-70 if you plan to head to the mountains! neighborhood_overview: The Tennyson / Berkeley neighborhood is unique, vibrant shopping district in Northwest Denver - A distinct collective of specialty shops and on the rise boutiques, eateries, breweries, bars, yoga studios, and galleries.
host_about: My husband Sam and I have lived in Denver for 10 years and have always loved hosting family & friends, sharing what the city has to offer! Our home has been a gathering spot for many and we are excited to offer the same for our Airbnb guests. While your stay will be completely separate and private, we live in the main part of the house and want to ensure you have a great experience! If you need anything at all, please feel free to reach out.

name: Funky Hip Basement Digs - 2BR+BonusBunkRoom
description: Fantastic location! Warm & cozy. This spacious private 2 bedroom plus bonus bunk bed room is in a super friendly fun basement apartment in one of the coolest neighborhoods in Denver. Walk 7 blocks to Tennyson St. for great shops, restaurants & bars. Quick jump onto I-70 provides easy access to explore the mountains, Red Rocks (20min), Golden, Boulder & more! Rebuilt after a fire, my home is a labor of love. Enjoy modern conveniences of new construction infused with warmth comfort & creativity.
neighborhood_overview:
Situated in the farthest NW corner of Denver proper, Berkeley Park is considered part of the greater Highlands neighborhood (the Highlands, not to be confused with the more suburban Highlands Ranch in south Denver). The Highlands/Berkeley is a friendly community in a beautiful urban setting close enough to the excitement of downtown city life but chocked full of its own list of cool places to visit if a day of exploring the local neighborhood can be part of your itinerary.

Berkeley Park's main street is the happening Tennyson Street, 7 blocks away. We're surrounded by many charming neighborhoods most with their own unique main street draws.

While we sometimes despair at the inevitable churn of development and gentrification, Berkeley Park remains a cherished Denver neighborhood filled with an eclectic mix of vintage and modern homes close to so many great attractions and activities. name: Artsy Platt Park Guest Suite, Walk Everywhere
description:
Beautifully updated 1 bedroom suite in the Platt Park area of Denver! Easy access (under an hour) to amazing places, Red Rocks, ski resorts, hot springs, animal sanctuary etc!

Everything’s been thought of for your stay including snacks, parking, kitchen items and access to the backyard lounge area. Located between Historic South Pearl Street and South Broadway! Short drive to DU, downtown and concert venues, perfectly situated between 2 rail stations for easy access, including DIA Airport
neighborhood_overview:
Walking distance of the beautiful Platt Park! Just a few streets away from the fun and trendy South Pearl St and South Broadway areas. There is more than enough to do in the area, including fine dining restaurants, bars, dispensaries, vintage/antique shopping and so much more! You will feel right at home here; this neighborhood is a great option for those guests that are not traveling with their own car because it is so walkable and safe!

Steam and Corvus coffee shops are super close and neighborhood staples. Dispensaries, breweries and wine bars all in walking distance as well, you will so enjoy your stay here with plenty to do!
host_about: Passionate and creative artist (obviously), who used her creativity to come up with this special stay for you all! I am using my Airbnb as an opportunity to touch more people with my art, let me know if you’d like to buy anything from the Airbnb or check out my website! I love Denver and know more than my fair share of fun places, don’t hesitate to ask me about my favorite places around town!

name: Cozy 1 bdrm Rowhome in Wash Park & Private Terrace
description: Feel at home in this charming Wash Park rowhome with large private terrace. Recently remodeled kitchen and bathroom give an updated feel and natural light floods in. The bedroom features a king size bed and down stairs offers a washer & dryer. The private terrace has dining and lounging seating available with a fire-pit and outdoor BBQ grill. Walk or Bike to Wash Park, South Broadway with easy access to Downtown by car or lightrail (2 blocks away).  A quiet neighborhood next to all the action.
neighborhood_overview: Located in the highly sought after West Wash Park, you are only 8 short blocks away from the beautiful Washington Park where you can enjoy walking & biking trails, and summer activities. Just north is the  bustling street of South Broadway that offers shopping, dining and nightlife. 2 blocks away is the lightrail and access to I25 to get downtown or on your way up to the mountains. Other recommended neighborhoods near by include South Pearl, South Gaylord and a bit further the Shopping & Dining District of Cherry Creek.

name: Spacious 2BR Home - mins to Downtown & Red Rocks!
description:
Private 2 br, 1 ba - 1,025 sq ft split-level home
-90 min drive to the mountains for snow sports
-15 min drive to Red Rocks, Coors Field, Mission Ballroom, nightclubs
-10 min drive to Ball Arena, Empower Field, Meow Wolf, Downtown Denver (restaurants, theatre, museums, music venues, bars, etc)
-6 min drive to light rail that hits all of Denver, including airport
-6 min drive to River Point Shopping Center
-5 min drive to S Broadway
-Grocery store, coffee shops, brewery, restaurants w/in 1 mile!
neighborhood_overview:
This home is located in beautiful SW Denver, 5 min drive to South Broadway which is known for its eclectic mix of neighborhood taverns, vintage clothing stores, bookstores, art galleries (1st Friday art walks), international restaurants, craft shops, an arthouse movie theater, live music venues, and nearly 100 antique stores packed into just 18 blocks.

Denver has it all for everyone, including the little ones! To name a few places: the Aquarium and the interactive Children's Museum (15 minute drive), Denver Zoo (20 minute drive), and Belmar shopping center (12 minute drive). There, you can find over 80 stores including Best Buy, DSW, Lucky Strike bowling alley, and even an ice skating rink! If you're looking for nature: Boulder, Golden, and Evergreen are all between 20 and 35 minutes away, so finding a plethora of breath-taking hikes are right around the corner!
host_about: I enjoy traveling and adventure! I love the outdoors and especially the mountains and water. I enjoy meeting new people and seeing new places!

name: Boho Lake House with bikes - Steps to Sloans Lake!
description:
Welcome to Sloan's Lake! This duplex is two blocks from one of the most popular lakes in Denver. Beautiful boho vibes and lots of natural sunlight. Very clean and comfortable space with Netflix, Prime, and Hulu. Enjoy the outdoor space relaxing in the hammock or watching the sunset. Take the bikes for a spin around the lake. Head home to unwind and play records. Only 10min from downtown Denver and walking distance of plenty of bars/restaurants.

See other details for all the perks of my place!
neighborhood_overview:
The house is situated in an urban environment close to the lake and close to the busiest street in Denver.
Sloan's Lake is a 10min drive from downtown Denver. The lake is a nice 2.5 miles and one of the best parks for catching a sunset, with stunning views of the Rocky Mountains and Denver skyline. One minute drive to Target, King Scoopers, Starbucks, liquor store, and Edgewater market.
Edgewater Public Market is Denver’s most eclectic collective of local food stalls, retail boutiques, and rotating events.
There are a few bars and restaurants in the area - Odells Brewery, The Patios, Tap & Burger, and my favorite Joyride Brewey!
I'm a 5 min drive from both Empower Field Meow Wolf.

name: Bright with High Ceilings - Walkable, Urban Charm
description: One block from dozens of restaurants, shops, bars and theaters, this West Wash Park 3BR 1BA includes access to a yard with outdoor dining setup, lots of seating, grill and fire pit. Bright, spacious and well appointed kitchen, comfy beds, a large dining table, an extensive library and a big sectional sofa with tv & plenty of pillows and blankets. Explore all of Denver from this central jewel. PARKING AREA IN ALLEY IS SHARED AND MAY BE TIGHT FOR LARGE SUVs, CANNOT ACCOMMODATE OVERSIZED VEHICLES.
neighborhood_overview: Located near the intersection of Lincoln and Ellsworth, this home is conveniently located one block off Broadway where you'll find a variety of restaurants, bars, vintage and specialty shops. The neighborhood is funky and eclectic with an urban feeling. The house itself provides a peaceful contrast to the bustling neighborhood. From this hot spot you'll find plentiful Uber and Lyft bikes and scooters for rentals, as well as easy access to public transportation. The house is right in the center of the city, so it's a quick trip to anywhere in Denver. It's less than ten minutes in a car or Lyft to Washington Park, Cherry Creek, Capital Hill or Downtown.

name: Cheerful 1-Bedroom Near Rockies & Downtown Denver
description:
Relax at this peaceful, bright place to stay. Enjoy the natural settings of the backyard; the fire pit, the wood burning barbecue and casual dining space and deep open backyard.
This one-bedroom space also has a full bathroom and a tiny kitchen. You are welcome to use the shared laundry as well if you wish.
Also we will be glad to provide the additional opportunity of serving Persian dishes to you if you would like to order :)
We are near Rockies and only 10 minutes from downtown Denver.
neighborhood_overview:
This residential calm, low density neighborhood, named "College View" or "Boulevards Garden", once used to be a suburban community of older Denver when it has not been become a large city yet.

"West Harvard Gulch" located 14 minutes walking distance north of us, is a beautiful linear park which includes a biking trail leading to Platte River, that runs northward, passing from Downtown and finding its way to Nebraska and beyond less than a mile away east of the neighborhood. The must see, "Littleton Museum" is also 12 minutes drive southward, which can also be accessed by D-Line (light rail) conveniently.

We are 5 - 10 minutes drive from Denver light rail network, Santa Fe Drive, 285 and I-25 highways. Local shopping centers, restaurants and medical facilities are also fairly close.

host_about:
Hello! I'm originally from Denver, Colorado, but you'll likely find me in any number of places across the globe as I travel extensively for both work and pleasure! I've been to 64 countries thus far and have many more on my "want to see" list!

During my travels I am frequently a guest at Airbnbs and hotels, and I love incorporating all that I've learned into creating a comfortable and memorable experience for my guests who stay in my home!

My other hobbies include snowboarding, scuba diving, golfing, rock climbing, yoga, poker, and reading about science and astronomy. I also enjoy going to music festivals and have been to some incredible events in locations across the globe!

Please feel free to reach out if there are any questions I can answer.

name: Chic home in Highlands I near Downtown I Sleeps 7
description:
Location, Location, Location. Enjoy this wonderfully decorated turn of the century home (1890) situated in one of Denver's best neighborhoods - the Highlands

→ Amazing walkability (87 WalkScore) and Bikers Paradise (85 BikeScore)
→ Incredible backyard
→ Two dedicated parking spots
→ Stones throw away from hip eateries, cafes, art galleries, and boutiques
→ 1.5 miles from Downtown/Convention Center/RiNo
→ 1 mile from Coors Field
→ Washer/Dryer


Be sure to add my listing to your Airbnb Wishlist!
neighborhood_overview:
Victorian-era homes and buildings; lush gardens and parks; hip independently owned shops; art galleries; and restaurants, all make the Denver Highlands neighborhood a great destination for visitors. There are three diverse districts to discover: Highlands Square , Tennyson Street and Lower Highland (LoHi ).

Boutiques, wine shops and bookstores, as well as popular restaurants and bars radiate out from Highland Square on West 32nd Avenue and Lowell Boulevard. And, in the Tennyson Street Cultural District, you can spend an afternoon browsing antique prints, photographs and paintings from Colorado artists, plus find live music venues and great international foods. LoHi is characterized by a mix of old and ultra-modern architecture, some of the city's most innovative restaurants and bars and incredible views of the Highland Bridge and downtown Denver.

description:
2 rooms. 1 queen sized bed, desk, armoire, and 43" HD TV, door has lock for privacy. 2nd room has 1 full bed and optional twin mattress.

More details in "neighborhood" section
neighborhood_overview:
North Park Hill is a historic location of Denver, bordering Martin Luther King Jr Blvd and Colorado Blvd. It is one of the most mixed neighborhoods of the city where you can find everything from local breweries to amazing soul food.

This location is right across from a small local park; less than a mile and a half away from the RTD A Train from Denver International Airport (40th and Colorado Station); 1.5 miles to the South is Denver Museum of Nature & Science, the Denver Zoo, City Park, and the infamous Colfax Avenue.

This location borders Central Denver and is extremely close to City Park, Rhino, Congress Park, Skyland, Stapleton, Hale, Clayton,Cole, Whittier; and less than a 15 minute drive to Capitol Hill, Five Points, Cheeseman Park, Golden Triangle, downtown, and Cherry Creek.
host_about:
As a traveler, usually not asking for much more than a place to sleep, to me it's all about location!

As a host and concierge I can be on site up to half the time, though sometimes I am away on my own travels. I try to find a balance between giving guests ample space and unhindered access to shared spaces and being there to share stories, answer questions and give local advice.

name: Historic Denver Apt Steps From Fillmore Theatre
description: Location! Location! Location! Our newly remodeled 2/1 basement apartment is located in popular Uptown (heart of Denver) in our beautiful historic home built by the famous Denver architect, William Lang. The natural light, high 10 foot ceilings, new remodel, and personal garage will make you feel right at home. Within steps you'll be on 17th Ave, often referred to as Denver's Restaurant Row.
neighborhood_overview: Located in North Capitol Hill. Walking distance to 17th street shops and restaurants.
host_about:
Welcome to our page! 

We are a hospitality and property management company dedicated to guest experience, fast response times, property cleanliness and an overall seamless and enjoyable stay for our guests. 

We manage everything from luxurious homes to affordable, yet value driven properties. Whether you want to explore the mountains in Colorado, soak up the sun in South Florida or look for longer term stays for business travels, our portfolio has a diverse set of properties in locations nationwide. 

Each property is fully stocked with items such as linens, kitchenware, everyday house hold items and more. Our team is constantly auditing our properties and performing quality control checks to ensure we have everything just right for your stay. Our cleaning partners dedicate themselves to thorough and detailed cleans that match the standard of 5-star hotels. 

Things do happen from time to time and when they do we are right here to answer any questions or concerns. We respond quickly and have a 24-hour response team in those rare emergencies. 

Lastly, hospitality is our number one focus. We are here to answer your questions, guide you through your stay and take care of anything you need.  We want you to have a memorable experience that keeps you choosing us for you next travel adventure!

name: Entire home 2-bed/2-bath w/private fenced yard
description:
This uniquely renovated 1916 house has a fully-fenced yard perfect for family gatherings, pets and outdoor living.
Very convenient access to both I-70 and I-25 as well as a quick trip to the heart of RiNo, downtown, the mission ballroom and others while still being located on a quiet park away from the center of the city
Free street parking always readily available. Off-street parking is possible if you open the gates and pull your car into the side yard.
neighborhood_overview: The house is located on the park in a historically working class neighborhood named "Globeville" as people came from all over the globe to work there.  While Washington street is still largely industrial and there is a train spur that is occasionally used just north of the park the house itself is located off the beaten path.  Highly recommend the Fort Greene bar on 46th between Grant and Logan.

name: Luxury home in N. Cherry Creek 13 minutes to DU
description:
A 2,800 square feet home with opulent pleasures including a newly remodeled Chef's Kitchen, Dining Room, full size shuffle board table, large screen TVs, and an outside courtyard with private seating.
Smack dab in the middle of three fabulous neighborhoods: Cherry Creek North, 9Co and Congress Park we are sure you will enjoy the area. Whether it's dinning, shopping, or enjoying open space that brings you to Denver this home has it all within walking distance!
neighborhood_overview:
North Cherry Creek is an affluent residential district with a vibrant shopping scene. We are 4 minutes from the Cherry Creek Mall, with bustling department stores, high-end fashion boutiques.

Eclectic eateries, relaxed cafes and chic cocktail lounges line the surrounding streets, which are also home to small contemporary art galleries.

The award winning weekly farmers market is minutes away as well as the world renowned Cherry Creek Arts festival.

name: Modern Sanctuary: 6br/6ba urban historic property
description:
It's rare to find a place that's both historic and one-of-a-kind.

Enter: Modern Sanctuary, a 6500sqft, 6bd/7ba historical church renovation where gorgeous, eclectic design meets modern comfort. Tastefully decorated and situated immediately east of the happening RiNo arts district, this converted 100-year-old, mission-style church is centrally-located and perfect for large groups. Ideally located to maximize your Mile High City experience, you'll stay in luxury and leave divinely inspired.
neighborhood_overview:
Whittier is home to historic homes, tucked away eateries and charming parks both big and small. Wonderfully walkable and adjacent to City Park and Five Points, you'll be hard pressed to find a better home base for your Denver adventures.

The neighborhood is culturally and economically diverse. Like most of Denver it is undergoing significant transformation. Utmost respect for the community and neighbors is essential.

name: Luxury LODO Loft on the Cherry Creek
description: Stunning downtown loft overlooking the Cherry Creek!  Loft style one bed, one bath, with large living/dining/kitchen area, a wall of windows, and an extra large outdoor space.  Relax with views of the Cherry Creek and direct access to the Cherry Creek Trail.  Conceirge building with a fully equipped large gym and a dedicated indoor parking space.  Steps to all the best Denver has to offer!
neighborhood_overview:
LODO (lower-downtown) is home to nearly 100 restaurants, clubs, galleries, shops and bars. A mix-use neighborhood for residents and tourist alike. In 1858 a small amount of gold was discovered at the confluence of the South Platte River and Cherry Creek and would become the birthplace of Lower Downtown. This loft is steps to the Museum of Modern Art, Union Station, Whole Foods, Ball Arena, and the best that Denver has to offer!

The Cherry Creek Regional Trail is a picturesque 40-mile route that begins in downtown Denver (just outside your door!) and connects suburban and rural neighborhoods. Perfect for runners, walkers, bikers, and those that want to just take in the beautiful Platte River and Cherry Creek.
host_about: We moved back to Denver after a decade living in London - the UK was great - but Denver feels like home!  I am the co-founder of a non-profit working in developing communities.  My husband Paul is a quantified-self enthusiast who consults during the day to pay for all of his hobbies!  We both love to run in the local parks, take long walks along the creek and ski whenever we can!  The head of our household is actually our new pup - Beanz!

name: Scamp 13 at 2120
description:
This mini fiberglass egg camper is cute as hell!
Great location. The hot shower is cramped, if you are over 5'-10", just sit down for showering. It sits next to a commercial building where there is a large shared kitchen with dishwasher and huge fridge, shower, office space with commercial grade WiFi, and two half bathrooms. It has an air conditioner that cools this little thing down super quick.
neighborhood_overview:
The immediate neighborhood is the only single family neighborhood in town that is actually right on the banks of the Platte River.
The Overland Park neighborhood is quite convenient, just a short walk to Levitt Pavilion which hosts 3-4 free concerts per week, Ratio Beerworks, lively restaurants, Overland Golf Course, Aqua Golf, Evans Station Light Rail, and many dispensaries. Just south is the Table Public House (as in "farm to table")
host_about:
Engineer, landlord, redeveloper
I'm an easygoing, innovative Real Estate entrepreneur.  I really enjoy experimenting with affordable housing ideas.

name: Modern LoHi Denver Loft in Trendy Neighborhood
description: Discover the charm of Denver from the comfort and convenience of this LoHi loft (separate entrance and outdoor patio).  Located just 5 minutes north of downtown! name: Central Denver-Great Walkability-Outdoor Space
description: Welcome to our lovely home located in Whittier, one of Denver’s favorite historic neighborhoods! It's a short distance from City Park, the Denver Zoo, downtown and RiNo, with easy access to the light rail and I-70 for exploring other areas of the city and the mountains. Discover restaurants, coffee shops, shopping and nightlife, all within walking distance. Private outdoor space, two-car garage. Linens and kitchen/bathroom/laundry starter kit included.
neighborhood_overview: Whittier is a historic neighborhood located in central Denver. The neighborhood has a residential feel, where many of the area’s beautifully crafted brick homes were originally built for blue-collar workers in the late 1800s. Its high walkability rating, abundance of local restaurants and bars, plus the nearby 30th and Downing light rail station, means guests get the best of both worlds: a true community-oriented neighborhood  that’s close enough to the city to benefit from all of the best urban conveniences!

name: Amazing 3Bd Townhome w/ Rooftop Deck in W. Denver
description:
Located 3 blocks South of Sloans Lake and 1 mile from the hip Highland Square, Edgewater district, Meow Wolf and Mile High Stadium, this newly built (2018) Sloans Lake townhome offers modern finishes with an outstanding open floor plan, large kitchen, and an amazing rooftop deck

→ Office / workspace
→ Fast internet
→ New appliances
→ Large Rooftop Deck with outdoor seating
→ Smart TVs
→ Great dining within 1 mile
→ Self check-in

Add my listing to your Airbnb Wishlist!
neighborhood_overview:
West Colfax is finally getting the attention it deserves. With close proximity to downtown, easy access to Sloan’s Lake, and both the Pepsi Center and Mile High Stadium in its back yard, you can see why West Colfax is officially on our radar.


While the distinction between the Sloan’s Lake neighborhood and West Colfax is often blurred, a few things set them apart. Sloan’s Lake is mostly single-family homes, while West Colfax has a more diverse mixture of mid-rise buildings, single-family homes, and a few brand-new condos. While this neighborhood is mainly residential, there are a few local breweries and coffee shops sprinkled throughout the area. Sloan’s Lake Park is just a stone’s throw away and offers locals a place to run, bike, or walk their dog.

name: NEW! 4BR, 2BA house in fun & eclectic East Colfax
description:
Enjoy this entire home in a fun, family-friendly neighborhood with easy access to Denver's main attractions.

Fully furnished with all the items you need to feel at home, this 4BR, 2BA home sleeps 9 guests and boasts an open, central living/dining space that walks out to a side yard fire pit area to enjoy those 300 days of CO sunshine even in the city.

Within minutes to parks, historic venues, shops, museums and more this is the perfect spot for those looking for a comfortable mid-term stay.
neighborhood_overview:
The fun and diverse East Colfax neighborhood of Denver is praised for offering the most condensed array of international dining in the city, with a range of authentic restaurants, from Greek to Ethiopian. This stretch of the famous 26.5 mile Colfax Avenue is not only lined with an eclectic mix of eateries, bars, brewpubs and shops, it is also known as a local music scene mecca with plenty of live shows and iconic music venues.

8 min - Bluebird Theater, Sie Film Center
10 min - Denver Botanic Gardens, City Park, Denver Zoo, Denver Museum of Nature & Science, Voodoo Doughnut, Tattered Cover Book Store
12 min - The Fillmore Auditorium, Ogden Theater, Cherry Creek Shopping Center
13 min - Colorado State Capitol
18 min - Denver Performing Arts Center

name: Steps from Top Breweries + Restaurants / Monthly
description: Please inquire for longer stays. Two bedroom, one bath located in Denver's most exciting neighborhood (RiNo)! Steps to the hippest breweries, food halls, restaurants, bars and dispensaries. Not to mention a short 10 minute walk to Coors Field and all that downtown Denver has to offer. Pet and pot friendly with 90 walk score. Free, covered parking. Located on the corner of Larimer and 29th.
neighborhood_overview: Located in Denver's hippest neighborhood, River North (RiNo) where you will find street murals, art galleries, food halls, restaurants, and micro brews all within walking distance . Recently featured in GQ and in Lonely Planet's "Hot 'hoods in the US," RiNo is THE spot to visit if you are coming to Denver. From eclectic food halls like Zeppelin Station to the city's top breweries (Our Mutual Friend and Odell's) and restaurants (Work and Class and Meadowlark), you will not be disappointed! Walking distance to downtown Denver and Coors Field. Also, if you're looking to get out of the city, there are loads of hiking trails within half an hour.
host_about: My name is Tim and I am originally from Denver! I live with my wife and our two young kids, Rocky and Isla. We love our place for its proximity to the most amazing park in Denver,  easy access to games and downtown, skiing in the winter, concerts in the summer, chilled walks in the park, the MCA for culture, endless new restaurants and the lively hustle and bustle of Denver living. Our couch is also pretty spectacular for lounging around on and recovering from all of the above!!

name: Charming Carriage House! Pet friendly & Walkable!
description:
Come stay in this charming Denver carriage house!
Open ceilings, string lights, and Mediterranean decor make this adorable cottage a treat of a getaway. Located just a couple of blocks from Broadway, guests can easily walk to shops, restaurants, cafes, bars, and music venues. The kitchen is fully outfitted for cooking, and all towels/linens are provided. The carriage house shares a lovely backyard with the main house which guests are encouraged to enjoy!
neighborhood_overview: We are located in the quiet neighborhood of Washington Park North filled with historic homes and large trees shading our well-kept sidewalks. We are a couple of doors down from the Art Students League of Denver (a gorgeous 1800’s brick complex - definitely poke your head in for a tour).  Across the street, is a huge community garden that is equally impressive and beautiful. Two blocks away you’ll find a host of fun things to do and see on Broadway. We recommend the Hi-Dive for music, Sputnik for drinks, and Mutiny Cafe or Metropolis for coffee. There’s sushi, Indian and Mexican restaurants to name just a few, as well as Voodoo and Parlor Doughnuts! The Mayan theater is also just a few blocks away - there’s truly too much to list. For reference, we are close to Broadway and First Ave.

neighborhood_overview:
There’s a lot to love about Platt Park. The tree-lined blocks of South Pearl Street, its main commercial drag, host a farmers’ market and First Friday art walks and a plethora of fabulous eateries and boutiques. Surrounding the charming commercial hub is a quiet, but not too quiet, neighborhood of Craftsman bungalows, Victorians, modern renos, and Tudors that stretch all the way to Broadway, a funky corridor where something fun is always happening.

Eat & Drink

Sushi Den is the grande dame of South Pearl Street, but there are options for every budget and craving along the short strip, like Uno Mas contemporary Mexican cuisine, family-friendly Chook, and cocktails at Hazel. Wherever you dine, save room for the scratch-made, Japanese-style pastries at Tokyo Premium Bakery.

Nixon’s Coffee House—with its garage door windows—or the patio at Steam Espresso Bar make for ideal out-of-the-house work spots. Like any reliable Denver neighborhood, Platt Park is als

description: Come see why we're a guest favorite! Our updated 1890s brownstone condo has classic charm and modern amenities. 2 bed/1 bath in The Curtis Park Historic District, Denver’s oldest neighborhood, under a ten minute walk to Denver’s vibey arts district, RiNo. Experience the history of Five Points, then explore the amazing restaurants, breweries, bars, shopping, music and art in RiNo. We're under a mile to LoDo and Coors Field! We love our home know you'll love it too! Sorry, no pets or children U13.
neighborhood_overview: Our home is situated between two prime Denver neighborhoods: we are in the Curtis Park historic district, known for its history hosting jazz legends like Billie Holiday and Beat greats like Jack Kerouac. You are also very close to downtown Denver for Rockies games, LoDo bar hopping, and Union Station. It’s the best spot in Denver!!
host_about: We are Denver natives and love our city. We love to keep on top of the Denver restaurant scene and will be happy to recommend any sort of food, drinks, or entertainment that you’re looking for. We’d love to be a part of your Denver experience. Thanks, Teddy and Chelsea

name: Stylish Studio in Denver Close to Sloans Lake
description: Our cozy basement studio is perfect for those solo travelers working away from home. We are just a few blocks from both Sloan's Lake and the light rail station. Access downtown Denver, Mile High Stadium, Coors Field, LoHi, and the RiNo art district, all via light rail or a quick drive. We have everything you need to be comfortable for longer stays, including 1 complimentary clean for each month you stay!
neighborhood_overview:
Enjoy Denver or easily escape to Golden and the mountains with great access to activities in the area, whether driving, riding the RTD train, walking or renting an electric scooter.

Driving:
Downtown, RiNo Art District, Mile High Stadium, Coors Field, LoHi all within 15 minutes
Downtown Golden - 16 minutes
Loveland Ski Area - 1 hr (when no traffic)
Copper, Keystone, Breckenridge, Vail - 1.5 hrs (when no traffic)

RTD Train (station to station):
Mile High Stadium - 8 minutes
Elitch Gardens Amusement Park - 13 minutes
Union Station (downtown) - 15 minutes
Golden Light Rail Station - 24 minutes

Walking/Scooting:
Sloan's Lake - 3 blocks
RTD Station - 2 blocks
Little Man Ice Cream Factory - .5 mile
Odell Brewing Sloan's Lake - 1 mile
Edgewater Public Market - 1 mile
Joyride Brewing Company - 1.1 mile
Many other options within ~ 1 mile
host_about:
Welcome to our page! 

We are a hospitality and property management company dedicated to guest experience, fast response times, property cleanliness and an overall seamless and enjoyable stay for our guests. 

We manage everything from luxurious homes to affordable, yet value driven properties. Whether you want to explore the mountains in Colorado, soak up the sun in South Florida or look for longer term stays for business travels, our portfolio has a diverse set of properties in locations nationwide. 

Each property is fully stocked with items such as linens, kitchenware, everyday house hold items and more. Our team is constantly auditing our properties and performing quality control checks to ensure we have everything just right for your stay. Our cleaning partners dedicate themselves to thorough and detailed cleans that match the standard of 5-star hotels. 

Things do happen from time to time and when they do we are right here to answer any questions or concerns. We respond quickly and have a 24-hour response team in those rare emergencies. 

Lastly, hospitality is our number one focus. We are here to answer your questions, guide you through your stay and take care of anything you need.  We want you to have a memorable experience that keeps you choosing us for you next travel adventure!

neighborhood_overview:
The Regis neighborhood offers a delightful mix of dining and outdoor experiences. N.O.S.H. is a pastel-hued gem known for its delicious pastries, particularly the standout coffee cake, along with breakfast and lunch sandwiches. Dubbel Dutch, serving the community since 2003, offers tasty sandwiches, fresh salads, aromatic coffee, and unique Dutch groceries. Beer enthusiasts will enjoy the woman-owned Goldspot Brewing Company, which taps new beers every couple of weeks, including classic varieties, funky collaborations, and unique creations like a pineapple hazy IPA.

Outdoor enthusiasts will find much to enjoy in the area. Willis Case Golf Course is a favorite for its stunning mountain views, especially from the first tee, and the challenging variability of each hole. Inspiration Point Park, founded in 1910 and recently renovated, is perfect for catching breathtaking sunsets. For those who love biking, the Clear Creek Trail runs along Regis’ northwest edge, offering a scenic

host_about: Hi, I’m Patti and my husband, Cem (aka Jim), and I have lived in the foothills of Denver for the last 39 years. We love hiking, camping, biking, snorkeling and traveling. In our retirement years, we have been privileged to visit some great spots. Some of our favorite places (other than Colorado, of course) are Alaska, Mexico, Costa Rica and Panama. Patti grew up in Alaska and Cem in Turkey, and we love meeting people from all over the world.  We are excited to share our AirBnB home with you - we hope you enjoy it and all the great things Denver and Colorado have to offer.  Please reach out with any questions!

name: Pet Friendly w/ Fenced Garden, Sauna and Hot Tub
neighborhood_overview:
Minutes away from the walkable RINO art district and the Western Complex. Away from the hustle and bustle yet close to central highway intersection for quick trips to metro Denver attractions. From our house to RINO and further downtown are designated bike paths. Close event venues:

Comedy Lounge Denver
Mission Ballroom - Tove Lo, Ice Cube, Kesha
Denver Coliseum - Disney on Ice
National Western Stock Show - Great Western Stock Show
ReelWorks Denver/Tracks - nightclub with monthly themed indoor roller skating parties

RINO is a rejuvenated district that was previously a sleepy warehouse district just 6 years ago. Since then there's been an immense amount of construction, changing it into an art district with seemingly a brewery, winery, cidery on every corner. New bars, restaurants, art galleries, dispensaries, concert venues and clubs have moved the center of Denver steadily northward closer to us.

Across the street is Swansea Park
host_about:
CJ and I met 7 years ago at a potluck just south of our house in Five Points. We bought our house in July of 2021 as somewhat of a fixer upper but saw it as a place we could grow and mold into something that's our own. Over the following year we painstakingly renovated the house to create the Airbnb. 

We married in August 2021 and had our wedding reception in a giant 20x40 foot wood framed tent where the fenced in yard area is. The barrel cocktail tables were later halved and used as the Aspen tree planter boxes.  The actual ceremony was held at a mining parcel we bought specifically for the ceremony.  It's precariously perched on the side of a mountain with views of the continental divide near Empire, Colorado. The wood for the bookshelves come from a ~120 year old sluice box, which was used to sift out gold from gravel, we found on our mining parcel.

Danny grew up in a military affiliated family in Germany and spent his formative years creating memories traveling as a family through Europe. He always wanted to work in hospitality so he could help families and friends create new memories through traveling. Today, Danny works from home as software developer for the U.S. Geological Survey. 

CJ grew up in Montana skiing and training horses. CJ loves bringing people together around food and a good movie. CJ works as a Physician Associate(PA) in urgent care.

In our free time we enjoy skiing, hiking, camping, playing with our dogs and traveling the world.

host_about:
Scott Hemerda is a founding principal and owner of Vacation Rental Collective (VRC), offering premier vacation rentals along the Front Range, including the greater Denver metropolitan area.  As a native Coloradoan, Scott spent his childhood in Littleton, studied at Colorado State University in Fort Collins, and raised his family in Parker. His daily commute to downtown Denver led to a love of the city in addition to his established love of the surrounding suburbs and mountains. Scott worked in financial services as the Director of Institutional Relationships for 18 years at TIAA-CREF, where he managed relationships worth 20 billion in assets. In addition to leading the top performing relationship management team, Scott supported and retained clients through challenging service model and system changes all evidence of his superior relationship management skills.
Scott married his high school sweetheart and they have three children. A lover of sports, he instilled the values of collaboration, teamwork, and good sportsmanship as a role model participating in softball and basketball and then as a coach for all of his children in their numerous activities. Scott grew up skiing and now enjoys hiking and exploring the mountains with his wife. Business trips, family vacations, and romantic getaways have cultivated his love and expertise on the needs of vacationers.

neighborhood_overview:
Five Points is in the heart of Denver! You will be able to walk to coffee shops and restaurants. The RTD is only one block away, making not having a car very easy!

Beyond that, you are in the Historic Five Points District. Cultures blend in historic Five Points, one of Denver's oldest and most diverse neighborhoods. The district was known as the "Harlem of the West" because it was a frequent stop for jazz greats including Billie Holiday, Louis Armstrong and Miles Davis, who played clubs like the Rossonian and the Rainbow Room. The neighborhood was also mentioned repeatedly in Jack Kerouac's "On the Road."

Today, historic Five Points' creativity and vibrancy live on in a fascinating fusion of old and new. Visitors can stop in at innovative coffeehouses and craft breweries, visit museums telling stories from the past, experience live music from all genres at independent music venues or eat at beloved soul food and barbecue institutions.

See the neighbo
host_about:
Hello :) 
My name is Clara.  I have the wanderlust bug and fell in love the the concept of Air B & B from a young age. It gives the opportunity to experience a city authentically :) Part of my professional vision working in real estate has always been to host my own properties.  I am a true real estate nerd and love creating warm, light & bright spaces.  Denver has a very special place in my heart and I get great joy hosting visitors :)

neighborhood_overview:
RiNo (The River North Art District) is home to some of the city’s best restaurants, breweries, bars, galleries, and boutiques (and even a karaoke bar).

Lonely Planet named River North one of the top 10 neighborhoods to visit in the U.S. “Even as The Mile High City expands, RiNo still clings to its punk-rock roots. You’ll find it in the street murals that seem to pop up overnight, in the experimental galleries that play open house on Friday nights, and in the innovative food halls and rockabilly microbrews that play host to the city’s young, bold and tattooed. [RiNo] is playing center stage for the resurgent arts and cultural scenes that have transformed D-Town into the cultural dynamo of the American West.” – Greg Benchwick

RiNo has adopted a rhino design for its official logo, so look for creative rhinos in art and signage all around the neighborhood! The district's interesting blend of urban charm and unique industrial revival makes it a great destination for

name: Denver Baker Area, Private Apt, Monthly Furnished
description:
Welcome to the furnished one-bedroom apartment located in the historic Baker neighborhood of Denver, Colorado. This charming and cozy apartment is perfect for long-term stays of one month or more, and comes fully furnished with everything you need to feel right at home.
Located in the heart of the Baker neighborhood, this apartment is just few blocks away from a wide variety of restaurants, bars, and shops.
neighborhood_overview:
The Baker neighborhood is a historic neighborhood located in Denver, Colorado, just south of downtown. The neighborhood is bounded by Broadway on the east, Mississippi Avenue on the south, the South Platte River on the West, and Sixth Avenue on the north.

Baker is a vibrant and diverse neighborhood with a mix of residential, commercial, and industrial properties. The area has undergone significant redevelopment in recent years, with many new restaurants, cafes, bars, and shops opening up in the area. The neighborhood is known for its unique and eclectic character, with a mix of historic and modern architecture, as well as a thriving arts scene.

Baker is home to several parks and green spaces, including the popular Baker Park and the Cherry Creek Trail, which runs along the South Platte River.

Overall, Baker is a popular destination for residents and visitors alike, offering a unique blend of history, culture, and modern amenities in a convenient locatio

neighborhood_overview:
This bright and sunny loft is perfectly positioned near 3 of Denver's most popular restaurant/bar/art districts (RiNo, LoDo, and Five Points). The loft provides easy access to more than 30 restaurants and bars, but is just far enough away to be peaceful and quiet. The walk from RiNo into downtown has become one of the highlights of a stay in Denver, thanks to the large murals that brighten the walls of this art district, and our home is in the perfect position to access it all. Public transportation is only blocks away, but a nice walk or e-scooter will probably be all you need.

This central area in Denver provides easy access to major highways, 10 min Coors Field and Mission Ballroom, 25 min to Red Rocks.

name: Chic Mid-Mod Cliff May home with hot tub & hammock
description:
This stylish place was created by architect Cliff May, who loved the California idea of indoor/outdoor living. Kickback and relax while enjoying the privacy and shade provided by the glorious trees that surround this mid century modern. There are only a 178 Cliff May's in Denver, and they are truly unique and sought after. Enjoy a little taste of California right in Denver!

Please note this is a peaceful quiet neighborhood, so no parties are allowed, and the hot tub closes at 10pm.
neighborhood_overview: Harvey Park in Denver is home to 170 Cliff May's, and this ranch style house is one of them!  The area is quaint, and quiet but still has the funkiness and charm that pocket of mid century moderns should!

name: Condo in the sky - amazing views - gym
description: Enjoy Downtown Denver from this ideally located home base. Minutes by foot from the 16th Street Mall, Larimer Square, Union Station and more. Minutes by car from everything else in the Metro area.
host_about:
Scott Hemerda is a founding principal and owner of Vacation Rental Collective (VRC), offering premier vacation rentals along the Front Range, including the greater Denver metropolitan area.  As a native Coloradoan, Scott spent his childhood in Littleton, studied at Colorado State University in Fort Collins, and raised his family in Parker. His daily commute to downtown Denver led to a love of the city in addition to his established love of the surrounding suburbs and mountains. Scott worked in financial services as the Director of Institutional Relationships for 18 years at TIAA-CREF, where he managed relationships worth 20 billion in assets. In addition to leading the top performing relationship management team, Scott supported and retained clients through challenging service model and system changes all evidence of his superior relationship management skills.
Scott married his high school sweetheart and they have three children. A lover of sports, he instilled the values of collaboration, teamwork, and good sportsmanship as a role model participating in softball and basketball and then as a coach for all of his children in their numerous activities. Scott grew up skiing and now enjoys hiking and exploring the mountains with his wife. Business trips, family vacations, and romantic getaways have cultivated his love and expertise on the needs of vacationers.

neighborhood_overview:
Sloans Lake is a friendly, urban neighborhood in the heart of Denver, just west of downtown. You will enjoy the architecture and character of the neighborhood while being able to be "car-less" if you wish to be! Public transportation is readily available and loads of destinations are walkable (including downtown, restaurants, bars, and the lake!)

Highlander is located:
• .75 mile from Sloans Lake
• 75 mile from the Highlands shops (many great restaurants!)
• 2 miles from Downtown Denver's LoDo neighborhood which includes Union Station, Coors Field, and Ball Arena
• 1 mile to Bronco Stadium
• 16. miles to Red Rocks (25 min drive)
• 8 miles to the Denver Zoo and City Park

name: Walk Everywhere! Garden Level in Heart of Denver.
description: Our professionally designed 2/1 basement apartment is located in the popular City Park West. You'll be in the heart of Denver with incredible walkability from our unit. Within steps you'll be on 17th Ave, often referred to as Denver's Restaurant Row, with lots of dining, breakfast, coffee and drinking options. host_about:
Welcome to our page! 

We are a hospitality and property management company dedicated to guest experience, fast response times, property cleanliness and an overall seamless and enjoyable stay for our guests. 

We manage everything from luxurious homes to affordable, yet value driven properties. Whether you want to explore the mountains in Colorado, soak up the sun in South Florida or look for longer term stays for business travels, our portfolio has a diverse set of properties in locations nationwide. 

Each property is fully stocked with items such as linens, kitchenware, everyday house hold items and more. Our team is constantly auditing our properties and performing quality control checks to ensure we have everything just right for your stay. Our cleaning partners dedicate themselves to thorough and detailed cleans that match the standard of 5-star hotels. 

Things do happen from time to time and when they do we are right here to answer any questions or concerns. We respond quickly and have a 24-hour response team in those rare emergencies. 

Lastly, hospitality is our number one focus. We are here to answer your questions, guide you through your stay and take care of anything you need.  We want you to have a memorable experience that keeps you choosing us for you next travel adventure!

name: Modern gem, close to dwntwn, free Botanic Gardens!
description:
#HollyHouse is a labor of love, from tattered decommissioned church to custom space, filled with visual artists from CO+beyond. #HH regularly hosts performing artists/events business mtgs.

Gorgeous outdoor spaces, gourmet kitchen w/ over sized island, solid walnut table for 10, LR, loft+media room, intimate BRs, all provide amazing hang spaces.

Perf. location for walk to local eateries; 5-15 min walk to best of Denver

Hi-speed internet/work from home, ask about pets, events+ commercial uses
neighborhood_overview:
Historic Park Hill is due east of City Park and Downtown, and boasts several acclaimed neighborhood bistros (Lucina, Cherry Tomato, Desmond's, and Bistro Barber--voted top 10 new Denver restaurants); great coffee shops/bakeries (Cake Crumbs and Spinellis), an Italian market (Spinellis) and gourmet specialty market (Marczyks), terrific wine shoos (Grape Expectations, Spinellis, Marczyk) a bike shop (Bike Depot), yoga studios, multiple pocket parks and adjacent to Denver's largest park-City Park. Two blocks from Rec center/pool, outdoor courts, library, awesome soul food; a few more blocks to more parks, eateries, services; a few more to museums, venues, and the best of Denver!

Enjoy walking along Park Hill's tree lined streets, filled with beautiful historic homes built from the late 1800s into the mid-century! Park Hill has a rich history of grass roots activism-both on local issues and national issues.

Park Hill is close to dozens of amazing restaurants, several
host_about:
Hi!  I've lived in Colo for 35 years.  In 2013, I purchased and restored an empty church on a sunny corner lot in historic Park Hill, min. from downtown.  10 yrs later, #HollyHouse is an evolving canvas, delighting guests from around the world--in for family gatherings, conferences/retreats, commercial+ priv. chef, visual and perf. art events. 

We enjoy sharing our love of Denver and CO w/ our guests, and can offer all kinds of recommendations!

neighborhood_overview: Central Park, previously Stapleton, is a neighborhood within the city limits of Denver and Aurora, Colorado. Located east of downtown Denver, the neighborhood is at the former site of the decommissioned Stapleton International Airport, which closed in 1995. It is the largest residential neighborhood within the city of Denver. The Central Park Neighborhood contains twelve specifically named sub-neighborhoods, 11 public/private schools, 50 parks (including city regional and community pocket-parks), 7 pools, several shopping and business districts, a city of Denver recreation center, and a Denver library.

name: Upscale Urban Home, Rooftop Deck, Private Hot Tub
description: Welcome to your home-away-from-home in the trendy Berkeley neighborhood! High-end interior finishes, modern aesthetics, and natural light create a cool, urban atmosphere. The gourmet kitchen, luxurious bathrooms, comfortable living areas, and fast Wi-Fi are just a few of the coveted amenities. In addition, Tennyson Street and its delicious eats are just a few blocks outside your door. Explore away, then end the night relaxing on the rooftop deck or private hot tub in the backyard.
neighborhood_overview:
Berkeley is a hip, thriving neighborhood that oozes personality and culture. The home is ideally located in the community to enjoy the best Berkeley offers. It’s also close to some of Denver’s other popular neighborhoods, including Sloan’s Lake, the Highlands, RiNo, and Downtown Denver.

Berkeley boasts two large lakes surrounded by parks, Berkeley Lake Park and Rocky Mountain Lake Park - perfect for strolling, picnics, or soaking in mountain views and the city skyline. Downtown Denver is a short 15-minute car ride away.

You are also just a few short blocks from Tennyson Street, considered the beating heart of Berkeley, where you’ll find delicious dining options and artisan boutiques.

Local eateries that are a short walk or car lift away:

Call to Arms Brewing (0.3 miles away) - Brewery taproom serving housemade craft beer in a pub-like setting with retractable garage doors.

Cozy Cottage (0.3 miles away) - Homey eatery with a season

name: Lovely Guest House, 1 Block from Sloan Lake!
description: Lovely Guest House one block from Sloan Lake Park. Private entrance with self check-in and off street parking. Very walkable to shops, restaurants, breweries and more. Easy access to Downtown Denver, Red Rocks, Empower Field, Ball Arena and Highways to the mountains or Denver Metro. The guest house has everything you need with full kitchen and an "eat-in" kitchen island. Washer and Dryer available during your stay.
host_about:
I'm a Southern boy turned Colorado transplant. I love enjoying everything Colorado has to offer - avid skier and snowboarder, trail runner, motorcycle enthusiast. Love going to shows at Red Rocks, doing yoga, tubing down rivers, hiking and camping. 

I live in Denver with my wife and two Bernese Mountain Dogs. My wife is an excellent cook which means I have an excellent appetite. 

We love to travel and explore new places - beaches, mountains, jungles, cities, you name it. 

I fell in love with live music when I moved to Colorado and generally love all music genres: funk, jam band, hip hop, electronic, rock, etc. but nothing beats a bluegrass show at Red Rocks during a Colorado summer. 

I'm laid back and down-to-earth, friendly and believe in the good in people.

neighborhood_overview:
In the complex you will find Uchi (amazing sushi and contemporary Japonese) and Lacuna (organic juices, light bites and Katonah yoga classes).

Right out the front door you will find Port Side coffee, Ramble Hotel (Death & Co, the renowned NYC cocktail institution; and Super Mega Bien, a lively restaurant serving Pan-Latin cuisine), Cart Driver (artisan pizza, olives and cheese), Work and Class (great old fashioneds), Nocture (jazz and supper club) and Denver Central Market (gourmet food hall and grocery).

Coors Field (Colorado Rockies baseball) is also walking distance.

The River North Art District "where art is made" goes by the nickname of "RiNo" and has even adopted a rhino design for its official logo, so look for creative rhinos in art and signage all around the neighborhood! The district's interesting blend of urban charm and unique industrial revival makes it a great destination for visitors. Historic warehouses and factories now house jazz bars,

neighborhood_overview:
This bright and sunny loft is perfectly positioned near 3 of Denver's most popular restaurant/bar/art districts (RiNo, LoDo, and Five Points). The loft provides easy access to more than 30 restaurants and bars, but is just far enough away to be peaceful and quiet. The walk from RiNo into downtown has become one of the highlights of a stay in Denver, thanks to the large murals that brighten the walls of this art district, and our home is in the perfect position to access it all. Public transportation is only blocks away, but a nice walk or e-scooter will probably be all you need.

This central area in Denver provides easy access to major highways, 10 min Coors Field and Mission Ballroom, 25 min to Red Rocks.

description: Beautifully remodeled duplex inside and out ideally located in Cherry Creek East.1 bedroom and 1 bathroom contemporary style with private back yard and sitting area. neighborhood_overview:
The duplex is located in Cherry Creek East, next to Colorado blvd. Cherry Creek East, the best neighborhood in the Denver Metro Area. We combine the charm of a residential neighborhood, trees, wide streets, beautiful homes and easy parking, with great city living. We enjoy the best shopping in the region (Cherry Creek Mall and its many surrounding boutiques) along with a wide variety of restaurants, bars and entertainment. Enjoy the close proximity to downtown, major highways, and DIA.

Cherry Creek is a bike lover, runner and walker's paradise. We are connected to the City's extensive trail system at our southern edge, with many miles of dedicated trails running north, south, east and west. Walk or bike all four seasons of the year. Play at the Gates Tennis Center, join throngs of dog walkers or just take it easy with neighbors on your front porch.
host_about: Math Teacher that loves to travel and explore new places. I love spending time outside and in the mountains. Denver has been my home for 25 years, and Cherry Creek continues to be my favorite neighborhood.
