name: Heart of RiNo Art District | Modern 2B-2B
description:
Right in the heart of RiNo, 50 steps from the hottest block on Larimer: take a stroll to immersive mural art, savor delicious tapas, or grab craft beer at one of five breweries within a two-block radius.

At a half mile, you're in LoDo enjoying the nightlife. A mile out, you're at Coors Field. At a mile and a half, enjoy stunning Union Station or attend a convention.

Walk, pick up a scooter, or snag Lyft or Uber to anywhere. Or, enjoy the privacy of your abode on a night in. Welcome to Denver!
neighborhood_overview:
This location is very walkable, with great things to explore and do at any time of day.

~~~~Food and Drink~~~~
RiNo is the biggest brewery district in Colorado, with 15+ breweries, distilleries, and winemakers within walking distance. Some of the best, Ratio Beerworks and Odell, are within a block. Our Mutual Friend Brewing, The Block Distillery, and Infinite Monkey Theorem Urban Winery are nearby. If full service bars or craft cocktails are more your style, Finn's Manor, Bar Fausto, or RiNo Yacht Club are great options. If you are interested in local, unique drinking experiences, you're in the right place!

In the morning, some of Denver's best coffee shops are right nearby. Crema is one of the neighborhood's most established options, offering craft coffee, cold brew, and a kitchen.
Denver Central Market has coffee, as well as a full indoor market with restaurants, produce, ice cream, and a bakery.

For casual dining, Park Burger, Osaka Ramen,
host_about: Hi there! I’m a Chicagoan settled in Denver as of 2021. I have a passion for travel and immersing myself in other cultures, which is why I’ve spent a number of years living and working overseas in counties including China and Germany. Currently, I work in the hospitality industry, which is one of the reasons I love having the opportunity to host on Airbnb. Looking forward to welcoming you to Beautiful Denver!

name: Charming Ranch Family Home w Office, DTC
description: Welcome to the ideal home base for your South Denver adventure! Situated just minutes from the Denver Tech Center, the University of Denver, and Colorado Station Light Rail, you’re perfectly located to explore the area. With 2 bedrooms, a combination office/bedroom, an updated kitchen, and comfortable living spaces, you’ll love coming back after a day of work or play. You’re also within walking distance of South Colorado Blvd’s coffee shops, restaurants, and popular retail establishments!
neighborhood_overview:
Welcome to University Hills, often described as Denver’s peaceful neighbor. It’s the perfect spot for those looking for a quaint suburban lifestyle with the hustle and bustle of Denver nearby.

Hit up South Colorado Boulevard (just minutes away) to indulge in the local foodie scene and shopping. The area is well-known for its delicious, authentic Mediterranean and Middle-Eastern cuisine. You won’t go hungry in this neighborhood! If you’re looking to stroll, check out Eisenhower Park or Highline Canal Trails for great views as you soak up the beautiful Colorado weather.

Local eateries that are a short walk away:
Gyros Town Restaurant (0.4 miles) - Delicious gyros, gooey baklava, and crave-worthy Mediterranean dishes.
Junction Food Hall & Drinks (0.5 miles) - Twelve food and beverage concepts serving dishes ranging from empanadas and tacos to pizzas and burgers, to gelato and coffee.
Baghdad Restaurant (0.6 miles) - Known for its falafel, shawarma,

host_about:
Hello there! 

Thank you for visiting my host profile!
I was born and raised in Colorado, where I studied ballet and eventually became a professional dancer/performer. This career allowed me to travel the world and discover many exciting places and interesting people. 

Now, I am CEO of Be Our Guest Housing. We aim to provide the best possible experience to all visitors through excellent service and quality local recommendations!. There is nothing more reassuring and calming than finding a place that feels like a second home on your travels.

Feel free to book or message me first; I am friendly, outgoing, and happy to answer any specific questions in advance. You’ll probably find me in great company of family, friends, or my cats when not working. I also enjoy working out, gardening, finding unique and yummy food spots, and seeing live performances.

I am a well-traveled guest who knows what a host should do to create a comfortable experience. My goal is to fulfill these requirements for every guest.

Hope to host you soon!

neighborhood_overview:
Welcome to Denver's historic and eclectic Five Points and RiNo (River North Art District) neighborhoods, where culture, creativity, and community come together in a vibrant tapestry. Steeped in history, Five Points was once known as the "Harlem of the West," renowned for its rich jazz heritage and cultural significance. Today, it boasts a lively atmosphere with a blend of classic charm and modern flair.

Just a stone's throw away, RiNo is a thriving arts district that has quickly become one of Denver's trendiest areas. Wander through streets adorned with colorful murals and discover a plethora of art galleries, craft breweries, and unique eateries. The neighborhood is a hub for local artists and creatives, offering a dynamic blend of contemporary art, music, and innovative cuisine.

Both neighborhoods are conveniently located near downtown Denver, providing easy access to public transportation, major attractions, and a lively nightlife. Whether you're exploring hist

neighborhood_overview:
Centrally located, Sky Lofts is located in Denver's central business district, LoDo, Coors Field, and the historic Ballpark District making it an ideal location for exploring Denver and the Front Range. This neighborhood is well known among Mile High locals for its walkability and historical significance. The community has a ton of charm, and one of its most desirable features is its proximity to other best-of-Denver areas such as City Park, Lower Downtown (LoDo), and the River North Arts District (RiNo). You’ll find coffee shops, craft breweries, museums, sports venues, and independent music venues outside your door. Soak up the tasteful and vibrant blend of old and new establishments while exploring Denver’s historic landmarks and longstanding food institutions.

name: The Pink Pearl, 1BD, 30 Day, Pool, Wash Park West
description: Welcome to this inviting one-bedroom apartment, designed for those seeking a comfortable extended stay in Denver. Whether you're here for business, transitioning between homes, or simply exploring the city, this is your perfect retreat. Nestled in the vibrant Wash Park West neighborhood, south of Capitol Hill and east of Baker, you'll discover a blend of urban convenience and cozy charm. The dining room table serves as a versatile workspace, ideal for productive days working from home.
neighborhood_overview:
Wash Park West

You’ll be staying only 2.5 miles from the neighborhood’s lovely Washington park, a unique urban oasis popular with Denverites out for a jog or picnic. Dubbed "Wash Park" by locals, the area has a Rockwellian feel with its lush landscaping, awning-covered storefronts and family-friendly atmosphere. Washington Park itself has two lakes, two formal flower gardens, tree-lined paths and seemingly endless expanses of green grass. It's a fitness mecca for locals, and on any given day you're likely to spot people walking their dogs, running, biking, paddle boating or doing yoga.

It's no wonder that it's consistently chosen as Denver's favorite park. Nearby is South Pearl Street, once the site of the city's first trolley car route, now home to art, wine and cocktail bars, specialty shops, boutique and high-end clothing stores and some of Denver's best local dining. Visit Old South Gaylord where you can experience local restaurants, galleries and shops.

Don't miss a chance to stay in this inventive and innovative neighborhood.

name: Snooze Retro Loft Ballpark Area, 30 Day
description: Experience the best of Denver in this vibrant Ballpark District loft! Located above the original Snooze restaurant, this retro-themed space puts you right in the heart of the city. Just a half-mile from Coors Field, Dairy Block, and Denver Central Market, with easy access to Blake and Larimer Street’s top eateries and shops. Ideal for 30+ day stays, this cozy loft offers the perfect blend of comfort and prime location for your Denver adventure!
neighborhood_overview:
Welcome to the Ballpark District, aptly named for the popular Coors Field, home of Major League Baseball’s Colorado Rockies. The area is a walkable, vibrant district, experiencing continued development over the years with an influx of buzzy new eateries and gathering spaces, complemented by much-loved local staples. Nightlife and entertainment options are numerous with bars, lounges, comedy clubs, and more, making it a hot spot no matter the baseball schedule.

This neighborhood is all about the city feel and the nearby amenities. Home of the popular Denver Milk Market located in the Dairy Block, Ballpark has a buzzing vibe and energetic feel, offering diversity and fun. Plus, the close proximity to RiNo and Downtown Denver make this the perfect location to experience all the attractions that draw visitors to the Mile High City.

Local eateries that are a short walk away:
Attimo Wine (95 ft) - 8,000 square foot winery, tasting room, eatery and event space.

neighborhood_overview:
The Baker Neighborhood in downtown Denver is a vibrant, eclectic area known for its rich history and artistic flair. It features a mix of charming Victorian homes, modern lofts, and local boutiques. The streets are lined with an array of trendy coffee shops, craft breweries, and diverse restaurants, making it a popular spot for both locals and visitors.

Baker is home to several parks, providing green spaces for relaxation and recreation. The neighborhood also has a strong arts scene, with galleries and murals that reflect its creative spirit. With easy access to public transportation and proximity to downtown, Baker combines a laid-back atmosphere with urban convenience, making it a desirable place to live and explore.
host_about: We are a duo of sisters helping manage our family homes! We both were born and raised in Denver, Colorado so we have a lot of local tips to give! We both love to travel, and have been all over the world! One fun fact is we have driven to all 48 continental US states!

name: New! Walkable Location in Baker Neighborhood
description: Our charming one-bedroom, one-bathroom basement apartment offers a cozy, inviting, and quiet retreat in the bustling Baker neighborhood, where you'll find yourself at the center of Denver's eclectic charm.
host_about:
Scott Hemerda is a founding principal and owner of Vacation Rental Collective (VRC), offering premier vacation rentals along the Front Range, including the greater Denver metropolitan area.  As a native Coloradoan, Scott spent his childhood in Littleton, studied at Colorado State University in Fort Collins, and raised his family in Parker. His daily commute to downtown Denver led to a love of the city in addition to his established love of the surrounding suburbs and mountains. Scott worked in financial services as the Director of Institutional Relationships for 18 years at TIAA-CREF, where he managed relationships worth 20 billion in assets. In addition to leading the top performing relationship management team, Scott supported and retained clients through challenging service model and system changes all evidence of his superior relationship management skills.
Scott married his high school sweetheart and they have three children. A lover of sports, he instilled the values of collaboration, teamwork, and good sportsmanship as a role model participating in softball and basketball and then as a coach for all of his children in their numerous activities. Scott grew up skiing and now enjoys hiking and exploring the mountains with his wife. Business trips, family vacations, and romantic getaways have cultivated his love and expertise on the needs of vacationers.
